story:
Something to think about...

What if you could change the world... with music? What if you could help bridge the divide between people and cultures with a music festival? Would you see value in that? Would you support such an endeavor? We know we can't change the whole world with one festival, but we can offer people the chance to find unity, one person at a time. From there it can spread. We think this is very worthwhile goal. Will you help us?

The inspiration for the Whidbey Island Guitar Festival is just that; building bridges between people and cultures. We invite people, both audience and musicians, from varied backgrounds to come together for one weekend of world-class music. Hopefully, they will leave with broadened horizons, both musically and culturally.

This is art with a heart. We are asking for your support to make this vision happen. Help us support a heart of peace and unity while also helping us support musical artists. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this years festival is $5,000. 

The money is to pay all of our musicians, purchase advertising, cover expenses of putting on a festival, and pay our small staff after all that. Hopefully, we will exceed our goal so we can begin plans for the 2020 festival as well. Our hope is to grow this into a much larger festival in the future.

In return, we will include the names of contributors in our festival program and on our facebook page (unless you prefer to remain anonymous). We are offering various levels of contribution with a variety of thank you gifts that range from a happy "Thank You" to festival tickets that can be used or donated, to private concerts with Andre Feriante.  

 

The Impact

This is possibly the only festival of it's kind in the world to mix musical styles during the same concert. Most music festivals focus on a single genre; Classical music, Blues, Jazz, Rock... etc. This is especially true for a festival focused on purely virtuoso instrumental music. 

Creating this festival has created opportunities for our featured musicians to reach out to a wider audience and possibly find new fans. It creates the opportunity for our audience to experience a wider range of music than they would normally be exposed to. Finally, it creates a bridge between people and cultures to share two afternoons of mutual understanding. Maybe, just maybe it will break down some of the metaphorical barriers people create and potentially lead to new friendships. 

 

Risks & Challenges

In short, a festival is an expensive proposition. Every year we risk running in the red with our budget. To feasibly continue offering the festival, we have to ensure that all expenses will get covered. If you're a supporter of the arts, we invite you to help us.

  • Professional musicians do not, and should not, work for free. It is our goal every year to pay our musicians an appropriate rate.  
  • We have to advertise so that people know about the festival. Advertising includes the printing of posters and Facebook targeted advertising. When the budget allows, it can also include radio ads, print ads, etc. 
  • There are venue and equipment expenses. 
  • Finally, the small festival staff puts in countless hours every year to plan and prepare for the festival. All the other expenses come before paying them. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you simply can't help us financially and maybe can't even purchase tickets for the event. You can still help though if you would like to:

  • Please tell people about our festival and this Indiegogo campaign.
  • Share our Facebook posts on your profile, pages, and groups!
  • Share on Twitter and Instagram too!
  • Share the link to this fundraising campaign with everyone you can. 

 

Whidbey Island Guitar Festival Team

Andre Feriante: Executive and Artistic Director

Shawn Berit: Promotions Director

 

To purchase tickets to the festival

https://wigf.brownpapertickets.com

 

History of the Whidbey Island Guitar Festival

The initial inspiration behind the Guitar Euphoria (and now the Whidbey Island Guitar Festival) concept was the idea of bringing people together from all walks of life.
 

Many guitar festivals are about a certain genre of music; Classical, jazz, Folk music, rock... thus they attract a very specific audience that is interested in that particular style of music. The idea behind the festival is kind of the post office concept, anybody and everybody could be there. Perhaps it could also be described as a high-end buffet where you can sample music you wouldn't normally be exposed to.
 

In an afternoon of the Whidbey Island Guitar Festival, you might have a classical guitarist playing right after a blues guitarist, an oud player performing right after an Americana folk style guitarist, thus bringing audiences of different types together under the same roof.
 

The artistic director, Andre Feriante, comes from a classical background but many years ago his philosophy of art opened to more extensive ideas, moving beyond tradition. He sought to step outside the rigid "rules" of the music. Open-mindedness, a quest for beauty, knowledge, cultural diversity, and a sense of community have become key components in Andres artistic vision. Andre has also become fascinated with every possible version and ancestor of the guitar, the roots of the instrument going back to ancient times from all corners of the planet. Therefore in the Whidbey Island Guitar Festival, you will hear instruments from all over the world.

 

About Andre Feriante

Andre Feriante is a multi-instrumentalist playing Spanish guitar, harp guitar, ukulele, nylon string banjo, charango, and most recently, the oud and tar. A crossover artist in the vein of YoYo Ma or Sting, his performance program represents a bold but fluid musical fusion, featuring predominantly his own compositions alongside music from Bach to the Beatles, flamenco improvisation to jazz standards, and even poetry by Federico Garcia Lorca, Rumi and of course, Feriante himself.

Andre Feriante’s career has taken him around the globe with performances in world-class locations like Carnegie Hall and Cathedrals of Sweden. He has played in countries including Columbia, Germany, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Islands in the Caribbean, and of course much of the United States. Feriante has long been a fixture of the Pacific Northwest music scene with frequent performances at Benaroya Hall and the Triple Door along with festivals like Bumbershoot and the Folk Life Festival. Andre Feriante is the host and artistic director of Guitar Euphoria, a northwest guitar festival celebrating the beauty and diversity of the guitar, and now the Whidbey Island Guitar Festival. Andre was recently a featured speaker in a TEDx Talk about the healing qualities of music and his performances reflect that goal.

story:
Hi everyone, my name is Jay.  I began the Grey Mourning project back in 2004.  This has been a labor of love to say the least!  Through various line-up changes, taking time off to focus on personal matters, and numerous other stumbling blocks, it has been a constant source of musical outlet for me.  After 15 years, I feel it's time to put it to rest as I continue to grow older and desire to explore new musical territory that doesn't fit under this project.  In coordination with the 15 year anniversary, our final studio e.p. will be released this December.  

    We are looking to raise at least $1000 to cover all initial costs.  This includes CD pressings, Digital release to iTunes, Spotify, etc, Vinyl copies of the e.p, Merchandise options such as T-shirts, bracelets, buttons, etc, as well as helping to cover professional sound and recording of the final show on December 7th (all contributors will receive the final show digitally at NO EXTRA CHARGE!)  Any additional funds raised beyond the $1000 will assist us in being able to provide additional merchandise items and potential video recording of our final show.  A portion of all proceeds beyond the $1000 will also be donated to various charities.

    We are not looking to make any financial gains off of this release, just to simply break even and provide our fans with an awesome e.p, some great merchandise, and the opportunity to help those in need.  Portions of proceeds from our final live shows will also be donated to select charities in addition to any potential overflow of support we receive on here.

  There are lots of great perks ranging from physical CDs to T-shirts, to combination package options, to booking a private acoustic performance for you and your closest friends!    Even if you are unable to donate, please share with your friends and ask them to contribute (tell them the live acoustic performance would be a killer Birthday gift!)

story:
Local Music Events the most comprehensive listing for live music in Gloucestershire on Facebook is going world wide on the web and you will be able add events onto the site at a click of a button immediately reaching thousands living in or visiting the county making it the go to hub for all music lovers

AND you can all be part of it's creation by either just donating or choosing from wide selection of "Perks".

READ ON TO DISCOVER ALL ABOUT IT:

As a teenager growing up in Newcastle in the 1960's John Plane developed a passion for music that has lasted throughout his life. Living in Gloucestershire he became a regular music goer around the local venues every week and John found people kept asking him what was on and where.

John realised the need for a live music listing and in 2012 as a way of giving something back to the community he created Local Music Events group on Facebook and for free and for fun began compiling a weekly list to let people know what was on in Gloucestershire, updated daily, and on being given his first ever digital camera for his birthday John began taking photos and videos at local events creating Local Music Events Youtube channel which to date has had 440,000 views.

The format of the weekly event list proved to be a winning one and it's popularity proved so successful membership of Local Music Events group on Facebook has grown to 4,000+ with some 500 events listed every month.

In October 2016 in recognition of his contribution to the community John was nominated for "Our Life Gloucester" project and a 7' x 5' portrait of him by local artist Russell Haines was hung in Eastgate Shopping Centre in Gloucester City centre.   

Collating all the information, typing it up and posting the list week in and week out has become virtually a full time job and 7 years on knowing he could not keep doing this for ever John came up with the original and inventive idea of creating a permanent interactive web site where everyone can input events straight onto the list.

John enlisted the services of Zayd Dawood Course Leader of Digital & Web Technologies at the University of Gloucestershire to build the web site to his design and help turn his idea into a reality and John's years of experience together with Zayd's computer expertise has proved to be a winning combination.

The event list on Local Music Events web site will be in weekly and monthly format with no deadline for adding events allowing people to add events a month (or more) ahead - or the week or night before - or even on the day.

The site will have a list of Venues (that can be added to) which will come up automatically with only those having a GL postcode being accepted and will be programmed to sort by postcode putting events for one area altogether and venues and performers and events names can be highlighted as "clickable links" that connect directly to their Facebook pages enabling people to look at further details if they want.

As well as being accessible via the web the weekly/monthly listing will remain accessible on Local Music Events Facebook page with a link to the site as the permanent "pinned post" at the top of the group page.

Venues across the County have expressed their support and local musicians have been eager to do their bit for the campaign providing 100+ signed CD's and other cool stuff to be offered as "Perks" in return for donations, along with exclusive design T Shirts created by John and printed by Cross The Tees . 

John does everything for free and all funds raised by this campaign will be used to pay for the creation and future development of the web site and a Local Music Events account has been opened with The Halifax. 

John has chosen the flexible funding option and regardless of whether the target figure is met or not the site will go ahead as planned.

Have fun, pick a "Perk" and be part of the future of live music in Gloucestershire. 

Thank you everyone. 

John 

 

 

 

  

 

 

 

    The Impact

    Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

    • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
    • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
    • Make it real for people and build trust.

    Risks & Challenges

    People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

    • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
    • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
    • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
Make it real for people and build trust.


Risks & Challenges
People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
Describe your plan for solving these challenges.


Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The background

We got together as TwoManTing some years ago when we were both playing in dance band, Le Cod Afrique at venues such as Montreux Jazz Festival, WOMAD and Glastonbury. Our music is inspired by Jah-man's origins in Sierra Leone, and influenced by both of our lives in the UK - but most people just call it "sunshine"!

We released our debut album "Legacy" in 2011, and since then we've been touring the UK constantly and spending most of the summer playing to lovely festival crowds around the country. This was followed by our second album "Say What?" in 2015.

We both feel that TwoManTing is the most creative project we've worked on - it combines dance music with social comment, and improvisation with feel-good sunny vibes. Audience response is heart-warming and sometimes humbling. We've had great reviews in fRoots magazine, Songlines magazine and on BBC Radios 3 and 6 Music.

What would we like to achieve?

The new album will enable us to continue touring and also further our musical career as we can get more radio airplay and media coverage.

Ideally, we need £3,500 to record, print and promote the new album. Life on the road is very hand-to-mouth so we're unable to fund that ourselves, but by asking people to pre-order we can produce the third album that we feel the project needs to progress. We plan to spend the money roughly as follows:

Recording £1,500

Production £500

Printing £1,000

Promotion £500

What are we offering in return?

As well as downloads, signed CDs and T-shirts, we'll have some exclusive perks to offer. Jah-man is offering drum lessons, Jon will give guitar lessons, and we'll even come and play a private gig for you and your friends.

We hope you can help by contributing financially to our campaign, but if you're unable to, please be kind enough to tell your friends and share this crowd-funding page around online.

Thanks very much for reading this, and hope to see you on the road soon!

Jon and Jah-man

story:
Super Quick Overview

Don't have time to read EVERYTHING below?

That's cool and the gang - here's the gist of it:

I'm Melanie Peterson, a singer-songwriter from Canada and I'm heading into the studio to record my third album which will be released in April 2020. I'll be working with an amazing producer and talented local musicians. I can't wait to get into the studio and record these new songs!

In order for the album to happen there are 3 things that I'd love for you to do right now:

1. Pick your reward (to the right)

2. Contribute

3. Help spread the word!!

I would LOVE it if YOU could help turn this dream into a reality and join me on this crazy, wonderful journey!

Cheers,

Melanie

Who the heck am I?

Oh yeah, true, you may never have heard of me or my music before. I'm a Canadian singer-songwriter originally from Saskatoon, now based in Toronto. I'm fortunate to have found my passion in life - writing and performing songs for people who like to listen.

It's coming up 6 years since I released my first album Unbreakable and a whole bunch of exciting has happened since then. I crowdfunded my second album Anywhere From Here and then played my way to Vancouver and back, thanks to the Via Rail Artist On Board Program,  making many new friends and fans along the way.  An absolute career highlight would have to be my recent opportunity to perform, for my first time ever, at the legendary Dakota Tavern in Toronto.

I'm eager to get back into the studio soon and see where this new album takes me...

 

The Plan

I'll be teaming up with producer Mitch Girio (Emma Lee, Kirsten Jones, Susan Cadogan) and a fine collection of local musicians, including hunky Peter Collins, lucky Pete Lambert, Mark Mariash and special guest Kevin Breit  at Union Sound Company in Toronto and at The Slow Cooker, in Scarborough. The album will be mastered at Joao Carvalho Mastering in Toronto.

I plan to release the first single in early 2020, but those who have the ALL ACCESS PASS will get a listen much earlier. The album will be released  mid-2020. (I know, it's a ways off, but a goal without a plan is just a wish).

The Songs

A lot has happened since he last time I was in the studio. I've experienced life, love, laughter, loss, gotten wiser (I hope), learned to be myself more fully and let go of what does not serve me.

After releasing my EP Two a lot of people commented that they loved the fuller, more pop sound, so folks, you'll be getting more of that this time around (with more magical string arrangements by Mitch Girio).

If you'd like to hear the songs in demo form, be sure to check out the ALL ACCESS PASS perk!

The Money

I'm looking to raise $10,000 to start with. What I need to complete the project is $12,000. To realize my ultimate vision for the project (which includes hiring a radio tracker to shop the album to radio, creating music videos and hiring a publicist for the album release), I need $15,000. For more details on the budget, scroll to the bottom of the page ("The Budget").

The Rewards

I have created some amazing rewards - check out the full list on the right ===>

My absolute favorite is the ALL ACCESS PASS! You get:

  • Behind the scenes access to my time in the studio
    • Live streams
    • Photos
    • Updates
    • Demos
  • A signed copy of my new album 
  • Digital download of my new album
  • A video thank you

 

Why Am I Doing This?

Music is my life! Being able to record my new songs at a high standard is essential to my career moving forward. It's also an amazing experience getting to hear my songs come to life in the studio and to work with talented musicians in the process. It's absolute bliss!

This ain't my first time at the fair, I've released 2 albums, a handful of EPs and 3 holiday singles. For the past 3 years, I've been analyzing other musician's crowdfunding campaigns and I'm hoping the wisdom I gained from supporting and following their campaigns will make for a killer crowdfunding campaign and an AMAZING new album!

One way or another, this album is happening!

The Budget

Recording an album can be an expensive process! I've broken the costs down for you so that you know what's being spent and where. At the end of the day, we want to know where our money is going, right?

Studio/Producer Fees: 43%

Mixing Fees: 14%

Mastering Fees: 6%

Manufacturing and Graphic Design: 10%

Musicians: 14%

Platform Fees: 8%

Reward Fulfillment: 6%

If I reach my ultimate goal of $15,000 this is where the extra funds will be spent:

Radio Tracker: 75%

Publiscist: 10%

Music Video: 15%

Other Ways You Can Help! 

If it's not possible to financially contribute toward my campaign, no worries, I get it! That being said, there are some things you can do that would make a huge difference and don't cost a thing.

It would be amazing if you could share my video or campaign through your social media or share my story with your aunt, dad, boss, girlfriend, bartender, therapist, neighbor...you never know who is going to want to help turn this dream into a reality.

Thank you so much for getting to the bottom of this essay.

Any questions - please get in touch!

Melanie xo
story_txt:
Super Quick Overview
Don't have time to read EVERYTHING below?
That's cool and the gang - here's the gist of it:
I'm Melanie Peterson, a singer-songwriter from Canada and I'm heading into the studio to record my third album which will be released in April 2020. I'll be working with an amazing producer and talented local musicians. I can't wait to get into the studio and record these new songs!
In order for the album to happen there are 3 things that I'd love for you to do right now:
1. Pick your reward (to the right)
2. Contribute
3. Help spread the word!!
I would LOVE it if YOU could help turn this dream into a reality and join me on this crazy, wonderful journey!
Cheers,
Melanie
Who the heck am I?
Oh yeah, true, you may never have heard of me or my music before. I'm a Canadian singer-songwriter originally from Saskatoon, now based in Toronto. I'm fortunate to have found my passion in life - writing and performing songs for people who like to listen.

It's coming up 6 years since I released my first album Unbreakable and a whole bunch of exciting has happened since then. I crowdfunded my second album Anywhere From Here and then played my way to Vancouver and back, thanks to the Via Rail Artist On Board Program,  making many new friends and fans along the way.  An absolute career highlight would have to be my recent opportunity to perform, for my first time ever, at the legendary Dakota Tavern in Toronto.
I'm eager to get back into the studio soon and see where this new album takes me...
 

The Plan
I'll be teaming up with producer Mitch Girio (Emma Lee, Kirsten Jones, Susan Cadogan) and a fine collection of local musicians, including hunky Peter Collins, lucky Pete Lambert, Mark Mariash and special guest Kevin Breit  at Union Sound Company in Toronto and at The Slow Cooker, in Scarborough. The album will be mastered at Joao Carvalho Mastering in Toronto.
I plan to release the first single in early 2020, but those who have the ALL ACCESS PASS will get a listen much earlier. The album will be released  mid-2020. (I know, it's a ways off, but a goal without a plan is just a wish).

The Songs
A lot has happened since he last time I was in the studio. I've experienced life, love, laughter, loss, gotten wiser (I hope), learned to be myself more fully and let go of what does not serve me.
After releasing my EP Two a lot of people commented that they loved the fuller, more pop sound, so folks, you'll be getting more of that this time around (with more magical string arrangements by Mitch Girio).
If you'd like to hear the songs in demo form, be sure to check out the ALL ACCESS PASS perk!

The Money
I'm looking to raise $10,000 to start with. What I need to complete the project is $12,000. To realize my ultimate vision for the project (which includes hiring a radio tracker to shop the album to radio, creating music videos and hiring a publicist for the album release), I need $15,000. For more details on the budget, scroll to the bottom of the page ("The Budget").

The Rewards
I have created some amazing rewards - check out the full list on the right ===>
My absolute favorite is the ALL ACCESS PASS! You get:

Behind the scenes access to my time in the studio
Live streams
Photos
Updates
Demos


A signed copy of my new album 
Digital download of my new album
A video thank you

 
Why Am I Doing This?
Music is my life! Being able to record my new songs at a high standard is essential to my career moving forward. It's also an amazing experience getting to hear my songs come to life in the studio and to work with talented musicians in the process. It's absolute bliss!
This ain't my first time at the fair, I've released 2 albums, a handful of EPs and 3 holiday singles. For the past 3 years, I've been analyzing other musician's crowdfunding campaigns and I'm hoping the wisdom I gained from supporting and following their campaigns will make for a killer crowdfunding campaign and an AMAZING new album!
One way or another, this album is happening!

Recording an album can be an expensive process! I've broken the costs down for you so that you know what's being spent and where. At the end of the day, we want to know where our money is going, right?
Studio/Producer Fees: 43%
Mixing Fees: 14%
Mastering Fees: 6%
Manufacturing and Graphic Design: 10%
Musicians: 14%
Platform Fees: 8%
Reward Fulfillment: 6%
If I reach my ultimate goal of $15,000 this is where the extra funds will be spent:
Radio Tracker: 75%
Publiscist: 10%
Music Video: 15%
Other Ways You Can Help! 
If it's not possible to financially contribute toward my campaign, no worries, I get it! That being said, there are some things you can do that would make a huge difference and don't cost a thing.
It would be amazing if you could share my video or campaign through your social media or share my story with your aunt, dad, boss, girlfriend, bartender, therapist, neighbor...you never know who is going to want to help turn this dream into a reality.
Thank you so much for getting to the bottom of this essay.
Any questions - please get in touch!
Melanie xo

story:
_______________________________________

This project is an exciting new step in my journey as an artist and I can't believe the time has finally come... my first music video shoot. I grew up glued to the screen watching my favorite artists' music videos on MTV. I found myself captivated by the worlds these artists were creating and the stories they were able to tell through their visuals, giving so much more depth to the songs that already meant so much to me. And now, I have the opportunity to share the worlds that exist inside my head with all of you, bringing a little more insight into what these songs mean to me and the places from which I created them.

As an artist and creator, so much of what I do is in collaboration with other incredible creatives. It means so much to me to be able to open up that collaboration even further, to share this process with you, my friends and family, as well as to have the opportunity to work with such an amazing team of creators! 

Partnering with director Brit Phelan, I will be taking two new songs I have been working on -- Worst Days and Wtv, It's Cool -- and creating visual representations of the wonderful worlds in which these songs exist. I can’t wait to be able to share these videos with you! 

xo

— Phé

About Phé 

Contemporary R&B singer-songwriter Phé offers up a dose of soulful prowess, as her commanding vocals, combined with raw and honest lyrics, expose a realness that truly sets her apart from the crowd. Born and raised in East Vancouver, Phé fell in love with the arts at an early age, taking to the stage as a dancer, actress, and singer. Throughout high school, she attended the Sarah McLachlan School of Music where she took her first official voice lessons -- exploring her voice and honing in on her skills as a performer. It wasn’t until Phé graduated from high school that she made the decision to officially pursue her career and post-secondary education in music. She attended the Berklee College of Music in Boston, where she studied vocal performance, music business, and songwriting, developing her unique style and refined her songwriting skills.

Having sung as a background vocalist for artists such as Aloe Blacc, Ella Vos, and Marianas Trench, Phé is ready to step into her light, sharing her own stories in the hopes of opening up a space in which her listeners can explore vulnerability, healing, and self-growth.


Following the release of her impressive debut single “Feel You”, in spring of 2018 -- gaining over 150K streams on Spotify -- Phé dropped her debut EP, CRISIS, landing placements in Spotify editorial playlists Just Vibing and The Launch, and features in publications such as Nylon Magazine and Live Nations: Ones to Watch. With her latest release,  “You and Me” being featured on UK's No.1 TV show, Love Island, Phé prepares for the release of her next single, excited to share her new music and expanded sound with the world. 

learn more at www.phemusic.com

About Brit

Brit Phelan is a director living & working in Los Angeles. 

Films, commercials, digital videos, and more—Brit can make it all. Her rare, two-for-one director / editor skill set is the result of a hardly traditional career path. But that’s Brit. Conventional wisdom hasn’t always applied to her. 

Brit started growing her professional network nearly a decade ago working with shops like Wieden+Kennedy, 72andSunny, Anomaly, and Google—ultimately leading her down a multidisciplinary road peppered with the cinematography, editorial and directorial experiences that shaped the unique creative vision she continues to polish daily.

Today, Brit doesn’t just bring beautiful art to life—she gives it a true purpose powerful enough to change the way people think, how they behave, and even what they do. Maybe that’s why brands like Nike, Abercrombie, Gymboree, Modcloth, Verizon, Coca-Cola, and Old Spice call on Brit to bring their stories to life in ways that make us all stop and think about a product in an entirely new light.

As a tried-and-true multidisciplinary creative, Brit knows great work never comes from following established industry norms. Her wide variety of experiences across all categories of film is exactly why Brit refuses to limit herself to the accepted ways of doing things. 

Brit genuinely loves creating, and the passion she brings to every project proves it. As a kid, Brit would religiously watch MTV. She would tune in every day for the top ten TRL countdown to see if the artist made visuals similar to what she imagined in her head while listening to them. 

Taking the next steps to her career as a Director requires dedication and determination. Sometimes it means rolling up your sleeves and doing new work on your own volition.

It's rare to come across such a great partnership. Partnering with Phé is a unique opportunity to not only create inspiring work, but to work together to grow as creative beings, and create future opportunities as artist and director. 

learn more at www.britphelan.com

Our Story

As an artist, making music videos has always been a dream of mine! They can be such a beautiful medium through which artists are able to better portray and share their stories. And it was a goal of mine to make at least one music video before the end of 2019. June rolled around, and it didn't look as though this dream was going to become a reality -- the music wasn't finished yet, I was struggling to find someone whose I could see eye to eye with in terms of the creative direction, and I had no money to invest into a project of this size. 

Then, one day I get an email from a stranger introducing themselves as Brit! Brit told me her story and said she had heard about me through a friend who worked in music and branding and asked if I would be interested in meeting to chat about possibly working together. Of course, I said yes. It just felt right. So we met for coffee -- both ordering an iced chai tea.. I mean come on, definitely meant to be ahaha -- and we started chatting. I showed her a couple of songs that I was working on, pitched her my video ideas, and the ball started rolling immediately. She pulled out a pen and notebook and started jotting down notes and drawing set sketches, and for the first time, I actually saw the vision coming to life.  

I don't know what you all believe, but I truly think the Universe brought us together. It all just happened too perfectly and at the exact right moment. If Brit had reached out to me to work togetehr a year ago I would have really wanted to but the music wouldn't have been right and my understanding of my artistry simply wouldn't be what it is today.  But, I felt it in my gut when I read her first email that there was potential for this to be a beautiful partnership through which we would create many wonderful things, and I knew I had the songs and the ideas from which we would be able to create something magical. And so, here we are! We've got the music, vision, team, passion, and now, with a little bit of help from all of you, we are getting one step closer to turning our vision into a reality which we can then share with the world. xo 

Budget Breakdown

In order to produce these videos at a level and quality that will allow us to stand out in today's market, we must invest both time and money into this project. As independent creators, we have time! But unfortunately, money can be a little harder to secure.

While we have a large number of people volunteering their time, expertise, and equipment -- simply because of their passion and drive to see these videos happen -- there are some costs that are simply unavoidable. Below we have broken down the funds that we are asking for your help with, in order to properly produce this project. 

Camera/Lighting - $1500 

Location - $2000

Props - $2500 

Truck - $300 

TOTAL = $6,300

*Any funds raised beyond our goal will be used towards marketing, distribution, festival submissions, and more! 

The Impact

With the popularity of online streaming platforms and social media, today's music industry is highly saturated and competitive, making it hard for independent artists to break through all the noise. For new independent artists to have even a chance of standing out, they must have a wide-reaching and captivating online presence, as well as music that is able to compete.

Visual content plays a huge role in the discovery of new artists among fans, as it creates a new avenue through which artists can be found online, and invites viewers deeper into the world of the artist, giving them further insight into the artist's mind and perspective.

With your help, we are hoping to give current and future fans the opportunity to further get to know and love Phé, bringing her deepest thoughts and feelings to life with breathtaking visuals.  

Risks & Challenges

We are attempting to accomplish a big feat here. The goal of shooting 2 videos in one day is not a task to be taken lightly, and we are sure to run into any number of obstacles and challenges throughout the day. But, with our carefully put together team of experts, and countless hours of planning, and preparation, we feel confident in our ability to accomplish our goal and face any challenges that present themselves along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support means the world, and we really wouldn't be able to do this without your help! While we understand that you may not be able to contribute financially, there are other ways you can support us in this journey.

Help us to spread the word!

Share this with your friends, your mom and dad, siblings, co-workers, grandparents, neighbors, your crush... anyone who you think might be interested in contributing to the dreams of an independent artist trying to make it in the world.  And who knows, with your help, she just might!

story:
In breve

I My Sunday Spleen sono un trio dall'attitudine "rock is dead". Scriviamo e suoniamo canzoni appassionate, intense, con un tocco noir. Potete ascoltare il nostro primo disco "Before" qui:

https://open.spotify.com/album/0qD9WUjUJxaDBIcx...

Dopo mesi passati a comporre siamo pronti per tornare in studio a registrare nuove canzoni, che verranno prodotte e distribuite dalla Rocketman Records, una piccola ma grintosa etichetta indipendente con cui abbiamo recentemente firmato.

Sfortunatamente la qualità ha un costo, per cui speriamo nel contributo di voi amanti della musica là fuori per raggiungere la cifra di 3000€.

Questi fondi ci serviranno per promuovere l'album (ufficio stampa, promozione online), realizzare un video pazzesco e lanciare il singolo.

Non c'è alcun rischio nell'investire nella musica, solo il piacere di scoprire nuove eccitanti realtà.

SALITE A BORDO! FACCIAMO ASSIEME IL NOSTRO NUOVO ALBUM

Short Summary

My Sunday Spleen is a  "rock is dead" trio. We write and play our own songs which sound vibrant and poignant, with a touch of noir. You can listen to our first record, "Before"

https://open.spotify.com/album/0qD9WUjUJxaDBIcx...

After months of hard work and reharsals now we have a bunch of new great songs ready to be recorded and released and to do so we signed to Rocketman Records, a small but fierce independent italian label.

Unfortunately quality doesn't come cheap, so we need and hope for the contribution of all of you music fans out there to achieve the result of € 3000 to print Cds', promote the album (press office and social campaigns), make an astonishing video and launch the single.

There's no risk in investing in new music, just the pleasure you get from listening to fresh, exciting sounds.

GET ON BOARD! LET'S MAKE OUR NEW ALBUM TOGETHER

story:
HEY THERE!

Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign in support of my Sophomore album, "Melancholy"

I have been working on this album since I was 17-years-old and finally at the age of 19, I am at a place where I feel ready to share it with you all!

ABOUT ME AND THIS ALBUM:

My name is Ginger Rodriguez, I'm a 19-year-old singer-songwriter and music producer from Austin, Texas. I started writing songs for this album when I began my senior year of high school at The Ann Richards School for Young Women Leaders and now as a second-year full-time student at Texas State University, the album is finally ready to be released! However, I need your help with releasing my upcoming singles. It will cost about $200 to release all four singles and get them distributed to all music sellers and streaming platforms; however, as an unemployed college student living through a pandemic, this is not the easiest task. So if you are in a place where you can make a donation that won't hurt the bank, please help be apart of making this album come to fruition. Thank you!

ABOUT THE TEAM

  • Ginger Rodriguez - Songwriter, Lyricist, Producer, Recording/Mixing Engineer, Musician, Singer, Mastering Engineer
  • Lily Martinez - Manager
  • Lauren Breach - Album Art Photographer

PERKS OF SUPPORTING:

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • For a $2 donation, you will receive a personalized e-card from Ginger Rodriguez thanking you for your help with the album
  • For a $5 donation, you will receive a thank you card and an unreleased sticker in the mail from Ginger Rodriguez
  • For a $10 donation, you will receive a thank you card, an unreleased sticker, and a copy of a page from Ginger's songwriting book with handwritten lyrics 
  • For a $20 donation, you will receive all of the above along with a personalized video of Ginger thanking you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don’t worry if you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Please spread the word! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend or family member who might be interested in supporting it.

  • "Like" and "Follow" me on Facebook & Instagram (@grdzmusic)

  • "Follow" my artist page on Spotify, and please like/save/heart my songs/albums if you like them!  After you like/save/heart those songs/albums, please add them to your playlists and/or share them with your friends!!
story_txt:
HEY THERE!
Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign in support of my Sophomore album, "Melancholy"
I have been working on this album since I was 17-years-old and finally at the age of 19, I am at a place where I feel ready to share it with you all!

ABOUT ME AND THIS ALBUM:
My name is Ginger Rodriguez, I'm a 19-year-old singer-songwriter and music producer from Austin, Texas. I started writing songs for this album when I began my senior year of high school at The Ann Richards School for Young Women Leaders and now as a second-year full-time student at Texas State University, the album is finally ready to be released! However, I need your help with releasing my upcoming singles. It will cost about $200 to release all four singles and get them distributed to all music sellers and streaming platforms; however, as an unemployed college student living through a pandemic, this is not the easiest task. So if you are in a place where you can make a donation that won't hurt the bank, please help be apart of making this album come to fruition. Thank you!

ABOUT THE TEAM

Ginger Rodriguez - Songwriter, Lyricist, Producer, Recording/Mixing Engineer, Musician, Singer, Mastering Engineer
Lily Martinez - Manager
Lauren Breach - Album Art Photographer


PERKS OF SUPPORTING:
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

For a $2 donation, you will receive a personalized e-card from Ginger Rodriguez thanking you for your help with the album
For a $5 donation, you will receive a thank you card and an unreleased sticker in the mail from Ginger Rodriguez
For a $10 donation, you will receive a thank you card, an unreleased sticker, and a copy of a page from Ginger's songwriting book with handwritten lyrics 
For a $20 donation, you will receive all of the above along with a personalized video of Ginger thanking you!


Other Ways You Can Help
Don’t worry if you can't contribute, you can still help:

Please spread the word! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend or family member who might be interested in supporting it.
"Like" and "Follow" me on Facebook & Instagram (@grdzmusic)
"Follow" my artist page on Spotify, and please like/save/heart my songs/albums if you like them!  After you like/save/heart those songs/albums, please add them to your playlists and/or share them with your friends!!

story:
BE MY RECORD LABEL

In today's music industry, becoming a successful Rock artist, is nearly impossible without a record label. An independent artist also has zero chance of being on radio without funding. Sadly, that is just the way it works. The only way around the "big machine" (or major labels) is YOU!
There is simply no way I can continue touring or make this my career without YOUR support. SO how how do we do it? 

It all starts with the music...

The competition is higher than it ever has been. In the past, "A RECORD DEAL"  meant, a record label would typically front the cost of recording the record including, studio rental, production, engineering, mixing and mastering. The label would also be 100% in control of distribution. THEY decide who hears you. Then, the label would also invest in the artist by publicizing and campaigning the record to the applicable markets (I.E. - FM radio, XM satellite radio, Spotify playlists curators etc...). A record label also fronts the cost of touring and merchandise. Unlike an individual, big labels can absorb the huge overhead cost. BUT! In turn, the artist gives up rights to their own name, music and royalties and sometimes identity and dignity. Most become puppets. In the end, the artist has to pay back the label and then some... The label always wins.

"SELLING YOUR SOUL TO ROCK N ROLL" -  As the old saying goes...

Sadly, even these traditional "record deals" do not exist anymore. Most indy artist now have to pay the label... yeah, you heard that right.
The artist takes all the risk, as long as they have the money. Even rich parents can't buy you success in the music industry today. (especially in the Rock-Metal genre) Really, there is only ONE WAY to win this battle, and that is YOU the fans. It is 100% up to you!

 

Why so much?

A high quality full length studio album is way more expensive than you think and you get what you pay for. Without a good quality record, promotion, publicity & distribution, a new artist doesn't stand a chance at getting on heard in todays market. But it all must start in the studio.

Studio rental cost, record producer fees, engineers, artwork, mixing and mastering can be astronomical. A band like "Disturbed" for example, spends well over a million dollars on a full length album. Guns N' Roses spent $13M on their new record. I am simply asking for enough to cover my recording cost. 

 

A simple breakdown

How much does a song cost exactly?

Well, there is no definitive answer, but I can give you an idea of what I have experienced in the past. Here is some examples of very BASIC costs:

  • Daily studio/equipment rental $500 - $1,000 per day
    (quality microphones, engineers and isolation rooms are a must)
  • Producer fees $1500 - $3500 per day
  • Mixing - $500 - $1000 per song
  • Mastering - $250 - $500 per song
  • Engineer $250 - $500 per day
  • Artwork for album $1000 - $3500
  • Basic essential (food, gas, lodging etc) $200 - $300 per day
  • Manufacturing physical copies (500 CD's at $3 each) $1500 plus shipping 

The main difference between me and a typical band is I write and perform basically everything on my record. I must emphasize, this is with ME doing a lot of the footwork MYSELF. Being in a traditional "band" means the load would be distributed amongst 4-5 other guys + a manager. Me being a "solo artist" means I carry the entire load of EVERYTHING... and boy does it get heavy!

 

How long do we have?

The campaign is set for 60 days only! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people just cannot contribute financially. Believe me when I say, I have been there before... at one time I was homeless and living in my car with nothing. Not even a guitar. Word of mouth is everything. I believe in networking. Maybe you know someone who can contribute. Talk to them and tell them why you are passionate about this cause. It takes a small village to make this happen and that includes YOU.

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE on social media (I.E. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter etc...) Don't forget to hashtag and tag my artist profile.
    Remember when sharing, to talk about WHY you are passionate for this campaign

story:
Boy, Am I Glad to See You! 

Hey there! David, Robert, Patrick, Tyrone, and Steve here, wishing you brightest of fall seasons.

Over the past two months we have released 4 new singles titled  Constellation, Monsoons, -22, +27, and Mummy! First we want to thank you for all of your wonderful support of our new music. We hope you have enjoyed the singles, and we would love your support on our next big project! This November, we are taking this show on the road - headed West, for a 10 city west coast tour titled “Boy, Am I Glad To See You!” The essence of this tour, and our upcoming EP, is quite simply - joy - in connection with others. A friend, a parent, a lover, a dog, a neighborhood cat, a mouse in your house; whomever it might be - you’re never alone. “A person is a person through other persons; you can’t be human in isolation. You are human only in relationships.” - Desmond Tutu. When you walk into a room, and see someone that matters to you…let them know: BOY, AM I GLAD TO SEE YOU!

 

What We Need & What You Get

So now we ask for your support! Spacebones is looking to raise $8,000 to help fund our tour and produce our EP:

Seattle 11/6 -  Central Saloon

Portland 11/7 - Twilight Cafe

Portland 11/8 - Dantes Live

Eugene 11/9 - Moth Mansion 

Portland 11/10 - Cruz Annex 

Hayward, CA 11/14 - The Bistro

Bay Area 11/15 - Winters Tavern

Bay Area 11/16 - Mystery House DIY

Sacramento 11/17  - The Colony 

Los Angeles 11/19 - The Redwood Bar

Los Angeles 11/20 - Resident DTLA

Los Angeles 11/21 - The Viper Room

San Diego 11/22 - De Oro Mine Co.

Las Vegas 11/23 - Indigo Kidd DIY

These funds will go directly to rental of our band RV,  gas, merch, tour booking costs, and printing our first project to vinyl records. Below we have laid out a few financial options for different donors. We hope you can find an amount that works for you. If you can’t donate, no worries, walk your cat, throw your dog a ball, and share this link with a friend!

$10 - Digital Download of our EP

$25 - Free admission to a show at Hungry City Collective & Digital Download of our EP

$50 - T- shirt of your choice

$100 - A vinyl record of our first vinyl presses + T-shirt 

$250 - Dinner with the band, or a band member of your choice! + Vinyl Record + T-shirt 

$500 - T Shirt, Vinyl, and a 3 song Tiny Desk Concert in our Tiny RV

$1000 - Spacebones will play a show or private event of your choice

 

The Impact

In the past year, Spacebones has played over 60 shows in Chicago, and along the east coast. We are proud members of Chicago’s DIY Music scene, and while we love playing our own music, we also run an art space called Hungry City Collective, alongside brother, rapper and producer Woes. Our priority first and foremost is to build community. Our event space is located at division and western in Chicago’s Humboldt Park neighborhood. We book shows - for Chicago (and touring) artists of all mediums. We focus mainly on musical performers, but round out the events by inviting multimedia artists to sell or display their work throughout the space. As artists ourselves, we know what it’s like to book, promote, and play shows; this has given us real insight into what makes a great event and performance happen; in contrast to bar or club owner, who’s main priority is to pull a profit each night. It’s no secret this venture isn’t a big money maker, we keep entrance fees low, and we pay our artists and staff well - whatever’s left over goes into covering costs for the next show. We think, at least we hope, people see Spacebones as a band that loves to consume music as much as we love to create it.  Our Next event, and first show of the tour is Saturday October 26th.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to read more about Hungry City or Spacebones in general, check out our website spacebonesmusic.com. Here you can find links to recent press, merch, tour dates, and more!

Have a radical fall season, thanks for your time! See you on the other side!

Sincerely,

David, Robert, Tyrone, Steve, Patrick & Luna

story:
"One thing art does for us is transform what we ignore and find mundane into aesthetic experiences. Brown’s work does exactly that; humanizing what listeners rightly expect to be a coldly clinical topic." San Francisco Classical Voice

Mortal Lessons is an hour-long "medical oratorio" based on a book of the same name by Richard Selzer. A former Yale surgeon, Dr. Selzer's writing combines his intimate knowledge of the human body with a love for baroque language and flights of fancy that are by turns grotesque and sublime. Mortal Lessons explores our relationship with hospitals, with our bodies, and the people who tend to them—what’s funny, what’s sacred, what’s embarrassing, what’s absurd, and what’s just plain disgusting. Life, death, love, and all the rest.

"By expressing Selzer’s thoughts musically...Brown has been able to reflect on the prose, encompass it and enlarge it. The music takes you further, deeper and higher at the same time, more than the words themselves did." San Francisco Chronicle

The work was premiered in February 2018 to great acclaim. Now it's time to get into the studio and make the definitive audio recording. 

And that's where you come in. 

Our first recording session is planned for January 6, 2020, and we need your help to cover studio expenses and performance fees for 11 musicians. Everyone is thrilled to be a part of this project, but professional musicians need to be supported, and studio time isn't cheap. 

Your support will help capture and share this important work.

Thank you in advance!

Ryan

story:
Embracing Oceans and our Dear Dawn, Project

"A dynamic duo, comprised of American vocalist and oboist, Skye Butterfield and Brazilian rock guitarist and two-time Latin Grammy nominee, Edi Roque, combine their worlds of musical polarities into an unparalleled expression." -Voyage LA 

Embracing Oceans, will be releasing our debut album on February 20th, 2021. We have been intricately working for the past year and we are so excited to have completed the work! The two of us are determined to use our platform to contribute to mechanisms of change. This past year Skye lost her Auntie Dawn to pancreatic cancer and finishing this album has been a very healing process, with the album being a tribute to her and her beautiful spirit. From day one, Dawn's passion for music was felt by everyone around her. When she sang, her voice filled the atmosphere and her spirit would vibrate the universe. Beyond her love for music, she was an active advocate for the empowerment of disadvantaged youth through the arts, community engagement, and personal connection. By donating the proceeds of our album to an organization aligned with her beliefs that also follows the dialogue Embracing Oceans would like to contribute to, is the most honorable way for us to let the world continue to feel her impact. We will be donating album proceeds to Extraordinary Families, a non-profit here in LA, that serves as a lifeline for children and youth in foster care to provide the stability and safety they deserve. Their vision is that every child, youth, and family in child welfare will have the ability to achieve their hopes and fulfill their dreams. Our multilayered campaign offers the opportunity to share our affinity for music, our passion for community connection with you, and bring you into our orbit.

 

What is Foster Care?

The child welfare system or foster care system, refers to the array of services and programs designed to ensure children's safety and well-being. Most families become involved in the system after suspected child abuse or neglect. Children remain in foster care temporarily until they are able to safely reunify with their family, are adopted, or "age out" of foster care and transition into adulthood. 

 

Extraordinary Families

Founded in 1994, Extraordinary Families has committed decades to the improvement of foster care outcomes. They work with a collective group of non-profits, private entities, and public sectors, such as the California Alliance of Child and Family Services and the Foster Together Network, to inform and advocate for policies that favor the child-centric approach. Much of Extraordinary Families work is pushing policy to create systemic betterment for youth in foster care, but that is just a fraction of the work they do. They search for and vet families that are open to both fostering and providing lifelong permanency for a child in need. One of the many traumas a foster child can experience is the instability of permanency; 95% of children experienced only one foster home under the services of Extraordinary Families. In 2019 alone, they successfully finalized 36 adoptions and supported 175 foster youth. They are committed to finding families for children, not children for families. There is however an immense amount of teenage foster youth being tossed around in the system with little to no support to guide them into adulthood. Extraordinary Families' UP4Youth Program supports young adults to help counter negative life effects, teaching them basic life skills and connecting them to the resources they need to reach their fullest potential. The goal of the program is to help youth build the personal life skills necessary for a successful transition to adulthood, employment, and a lifelong network of peers and mentors to help them along the way this helps ensure they know that someone is truly always there for them.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are pleased to implore our community to contribute to a cause that might otherwise have been invisible. Since our production was self-financed, our financial goal is to ensure a sizeable donation will be made to Extraordinary Families. We hope to increase their visibility and recognition beyond the local community. You can be the difference! 

Along with our album, we are offering some Embracing Oceans Merchandise that is exclusive for the campaign! Additionally, we are collaborating on the production of a virtual concert that will be held this summer. The proceeds from this concert will be donated in FULL to Extraordinary Families - there might even be some surprise performances...you will just have to find out ;-).

If we don't reach our entire goal, our donation will continue as planned based on the orders filled!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Because the album has been completed and is awaiting its release date, you are guaranteed to receive an album with your contribution. 

Risks for stretch goals: if stretch goals are not met, we will be unable to follow through on those goals. We want to reach those goals as much as you, so share, share, share! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to make an additional donation to Extraordinary Families please visit their website https://extraordinaryfamilies.salsalabs.org/don...

Your contribution goes beyond funding. Sharing our campaign helps increase the project's visibility, so don't forget to use the Indeigogo share tools!!!!

 

Stretch Goal #1:  $8,000 Dear Dawn, Vinyl

We will get the album pressed, complete with a single sleeve.

 

Stretch Goal #2: $10,000 Dear Dawn, Songbook

We will publish and print a Dear Dawn, Songbook, complete with all 10 charts and our custom lyric art. 

 

Stretch Goal #3: $12,000 Dear Dawn, Colored Vinyl with Lyric Book Insert

We will do a colored pressing of the album, complete with a lyric book of our custom lyric art.

Risks for stretch goals: if stretch goals are not met, we will be unable to follow through on those goals. We want to reach those goals as much as you, so share, share, share! 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you would like to make an additional donation to Extraordinary Families please visit their website https://extraordinaryfamilies.salsalabs.org/don...
Your contribution goes beyond funding. Sharing our campaign helps increase the project's visibility, so don't forget to use the Indeigogo share tools!!!!
 
Stretch Goal #1:  $8,000 Dear Dawn, Vinyl
We will get the album pressed, complete with a single sleeve.
 
Stretch Goal #2: $10,000 Dear Dawn, Songbook
We will publish and print a Dear Dawn, Songbook, complete with all 10 charts and our custom lyric art. 
 
Stretch Goal #3: $12,000 Dear Dawn, Colored Vinyl with Lyric Book Insert
We will do a colored pressing of the album, complete with a lyric book of our custom lyric art.

story:
The Moonah Arts Collective, and Tuff Cuff Records combine to present SPAWN! Recorded, and filmed by the experienced audio, and video professionals of The Moonah Arts Collective, and JK Productions.

The Moonah Arts Collective is a community based Arts Organisation on the Southern Mornington Peninsula, offering rehearsal, recording, and event space. They are dedicated to progressing, promoting, and empowering music, and other arts , with a strong focus on developing local content.

Tuff Cuff Records is a Record Label, and Record Club created by Record Collectors for Record Collectors. Focussing on Limited Edition runs of Australian Musicians.

Originally formed in 2016 as a doom-metal outfit, SPAWN has been reborn in 2019 through a mutual worship of late ‘60s counter-culture and rose-tinted, love spiked ‘70s grooves.

SPAWN’s live performance is spellbinding. A combination of hypnotic drumming, eastern influenced guitar/sitar melodies and compelling deliveries from four vocalists make SPAWN a flowing, graceful immersion. 

Fusing elements of retro psych, doom, folk and gospel, and incorporating eastern scales with international poetry and spirituality, SPAWN has birthed a unique sound that equally represents the old world and the new. 

SPAWN look forward to meeting you in MUSIC and LOVE. Where you're at, with whomever they've got!

Moonah Arts Collectives mission is to document, and champion Victorias music scene, by capturing local musicians with high quality vision, and sound, and sharing it globally through The Moonah Arts Collective Youtube Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrJGtAQxzhxJbM..., and other avenues.


We hope by making, and releasing these videos to the world, that we can help find, and build markets for local acts, Our goal is to make our Youtube channel the go-to online destination to rummage through modern Victorian music.


Our first series of videos from Rye locals Stiff Richards was gobbled up by fans on release, with over 60% of views occurring outside Australia.

Check out our video of Stiff Richards live: https://youtu.be/cE4xGsq8diU

Our second series of videos was Victorian Rock Legends “Warped”, recorded Live at our studio at The Moonah Arts Collective back in early June.
 

Check out our video of Warped live: https://youtu.be/OiAWvaf8cbE


To continue our mission of producing these videos we need to cover our costs, and reward the musical acts. So we are launching our first Indiegogo campaign to help us raise the money to produce these video performances. We hope you can help us out by participating.
Our production costs for this videos is $800AUD. $400 goes to Venue and Audio, $400 goes to video production, $200 goes to Spawn. After goodies, Indiegogo platform fees, and charges, that makes $1375.00 for the entire campaign.


We are looking for contributors to help us in our mission to document our local music culture.
Contributors will have their name in the credits for our live music video. They will be supporting local music, and will help us in creating a document of our music scene in the present moment that will last as long as the internet, accessible to a global audience, and you can share it with your friends.

We've already had two successful Indiegogo campaigns for the bands Polarize, and Two Headed Dog. Their videos will go into production when Victorias Covid19 restrictions make it legal to do so.


With our larger “Sponsorship” level offer we offer a full screen super displaying your name, or your companies name, and logo.

Here are our perks:

$20: Credit & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (sml)
We will include your name in the credits for our live music video.
You will also receive a Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick.

$40: Credit & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (mid)
We will include your name in the credits for our live music video.
You will also receive a Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick.
 
$100: Credit & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (large) & Ticket
We will include your name at the top of the credits for our live music video.
And you will Receive a Medium Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a 7” Record from their archives, Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick. 
You are also invited to attend the recording of the performance (covid restrictions allowing).
 
$200: Sponsorship & Tuff Cuff Records Gift Pack (deluxe) & Ticket
We will give you your own full Screen super at the beginning or end of the music video.
And you will Receive a Tuff Cuff Records Pack including a T-Shirt, 7” from previous Tuff Cuff releases, a Badge, Sticker and Guitar Pick 
You are also invited to attend the recording of the performance (covid restrictions allowing).

story:
I have always been fond of the old Country music icons like Randy Travis, Conway Twitty, Don Williams, and Johnny Cash. With a resonating tone in my voice that is reminiscent of those giants in music, I carry on that deep Baritone bellowing country vocal sound within the music I play and write.

My original songs have a style that mixes a number of those various influences, capturing the essence of those traditional country roots. My songs are very personal and there is a lot of emotion that I pour into them. Living through those moments of desperation, loneliness, and heartache, the moments of joy, success, and hope too… We all have our share of both sides of the coin.

I am in the studio recording 5 of my songs. In the past I've always done quick live sessions with an acoustic guitar, and that just does not do these songs justice. I get some amazing feedback from my music, and it always boils down to "I wish there was a studio recording, that would be on my daily playlist for sure...". 

I have the amazing Professional Musician, Engineer and Producer Cactus Jim Soldi already working on the recordings with me at his OutHouse Studio. Jim has played alongside Johnny Cash and Ricky Skaggs, to name a few. He knows his recording studio very well and is the best guy for my project! You'll hear some of what we've worked on in the videos I've posted here. 

Being able to get these tracks fully completed by a true professional would fulfill a huge goal of mine. I could then reach the masses via CDBaby, DistroKid, Amazon Music, Spotify, Apple Music, Soundcloud, Facebook, etc.

I know for sure that I can get more gigs with an amazing recording of my music to showcase.

15 years ago I was in a burn accident and nearly lost the ability to play completely. My right hand was severely damaged by third degree burns which resulted in fingertip amputations. I could not play for a long long time, but I am back now, and I have some great music to share.

Won't you help me do that please?

What is needed and why:

I will need $6,000.00 to fund the project.

That goes toward: recording, engineering, producing, cover art,etc.

See below

Each song is about 3-4 hours with myself and Jim getting the basic recording and vocal tracks down, so, roughly 20 hours @$45/hr.

Then Jim & I will need to call in a few other musicians for drums, pedal steel, violin, and backing vocal sessions. roughly 16 hrs @$75/hr.

Once all the recording is what it needs to be, mixing is estimated at 4hrs per song so it's 20hrs @$45/hr.

Mastering is going to be roughly $600.00

Getting 1500 CD's made costs roughly $2,000.00

If for some reason I do not meet or exceed the final 6k goal, I will use what funds I do get to make as much of the recordings as I can. I will only do a digital release,  & perhaps a semi-finished EP will have to do.

It is up to you all, and Me of course to push this as far as I can. So let's do this!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you yourself cannot contribute financially, don't worry.

Send this to a friend, or 10 friends, or ALL of your friends. Chances are one of them will thank you for it.

I believe in my music and it's ability to reach in and make you FEEL what I'm singing about.

also, check out my website: michaeldeangoodrich.com 

Please please please, use the Indiegogo share tools when you share this, so it gets directed to my Campaign page.

story:
DAMON JOHNSON'S INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN 2020

Greetings to you all, friends and music lovers. Damon Johnson here, thrilled to share the news that recording starts THIS WEEK for yet another new album I’m planning to release in the summer/early fall of 2020.

Like we did with ‘Memoirs Of An Uprising’ two years ago, I’m calling on my amazing fan base to support a crowd-funding campaign to help this new effort become a reality. I’m looking forward to working with the staff at Indiegogo as my platform this time.

Most of you were there for me during my 2018 Pledge Music campaign, and everything about that experience was fantastic, inspiring, and humbling. You provided enough revenue that I was able to have my album recorded, mixed and mastered ultra pro; created stunning artwork and design for my vinyl and CD packaging; hire experienced professionals in various roles promoting my album.

Sadly, the final story with Pledge Music saw their bankruptcy and their theft of not only most of my revenue but thousands of dollars of other hard working independent artists’ money as well. But there was no way we (my family and I) were going to allow that debacle to deprive the hundreds of supporters that spent their hard earned cash to help me at the crucial moment of launching my solo career. We are certainly proud of the fact that all orders were filled and everyone received all the items that they purchased.

As Eddie Vedder sings, “I saw things so much clearer once you were in my rearview mirror”. We took out a loan, we put Pledge Music behind us quickly, and we soldiered on with over a year’s worth of tour dates, interviews, and private house concerts to spread the word about ‘Memoirs of An Uprising’. My touring profile has never been stronger, my streaming numbers on all the digital sites are into the tens of thousands on multiple tracks, and my back catalog is getting more attention now than it did when those albums were originally released. Translation: BIG success for ‘Memoirs Of An Uprising’ and Damon Johnson’s profile as a credible artist.

We’re going to have lots of fun with this new campaign! First, my friend and Grammy winning badass, Nick Raskulinecz, is going to produce my album this time (he only mixed ‘MOAU’). He and I worked together on Black Star Riders’ albums ‘The Killer Instinct’ and ‘Heavy Fire’, and those experiences sealed one has become one of the great friendships of my life. Nick is going to put the same amount of experience, love and care into my album as he has done for records by Alice In Chains, Rush, Foo Fighters, Mastadon, Halestorm, Evanescence, and many others. And during this Indiegogo campaign I’ll be sharing exclusive video footage from the studio, documenting the entire process of tracking drums, guitars, vocals, and ultimately the mixing of the tracks. You can only see it here!

We will be offering an even greater array of unique one-of-a-kind items this time, in addition to traditional things like pre-orders of vinyl and CD, personalized lyric sheets for songs of your choice, autographed guitars, guitar lessons, acoustic house concerts, and more. Lynda and the kids have going through my closet, yet again, and found some cool stuff that I would only part with for an effort such as this new album that I’m beyond thrilled to make.

Stay tuned here for more updates and info, and I look forward to communicating with all of you in one form or another. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Here we go!!!!

Love,

Damon

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share link: https://igg.me/at/damonjohnson2020

story:
WHO IS DANII??

DANII is my music project and I am Brisbane-based singer-songwriter/musician/dancer/performer.

 

WHY IS DANII DIFFERENT FROM ANY OTHER MUSICIAN??

I want to inspire others to NEVER LET YOUR DISABILITY DISABLE YOU!

I am a 31 year old woman; living with a disability; who is a person of colour (POC);  trying to make a difference and stand out in an industry that believes that women over 30 are "expired", and is lacking in representing those that identify the same as I do.

Growing up and living with a disability, I have a unique perspective of the world and I always knew that I would have it so much harder trying to make a living and be 'normal'. But not for a second would I ever use my disability as an excuse to be complacent!

 

SO WHAT IS THE FUNDING FOR? 

Like most, my income has been affected because of COVID-19 both in my day job and side hustle aka music. If you have ever wondered why musicians are always 'struggling', here is an insight into my budget for this project and how I will spend the money;

- $2500 will help promote my next single and distribute across Australia for radio play and playlist submissions. Get that s**t viral!

- $500 for photoshoots for the single art cover

- $500 for song production, mixing and mastering to make the song release ready

- $6500 will help create a visual for this song! This song deserves a music video!

WHAT DO I GET OUT OF IT?

Ok so here's the thing; I get that we are living in a global pandemic. People are struggling and it feels wrong to ask people for money to help pursue my dream career.

But don't worry boo I gotchu - I wanna give back to you! I wanna give you something in return for your hard earned dollar! 

 

YOU ARE ASKING A LOT. WHAT ARE YOU CONTRIBUTING?!

Good question! I am currently self-funding everything I do. And you will notice that I am not expecting the full budget. I simply just need a boost to help reach this goal.

If I reach my goal, great! If I don't, also great! If I blitz it, even better!

But I don't want this to be just about me either. If I can reach my intended goal by my intended date, then I will personally match 5% of the funds raised and donate to Cure Brain Cancer Foundation. Last year I lost my dearest Lola to brain cancer and I want give back towards research of finding a cure.

I REALLY CANNOT AFFORD TO DONATE RN. HOW ELSE CAN I HELP?

Follow, stream, request, share!

Follow me on Facebook, Instagram, Spotify, and Soundcloud.
Go a leave me a review on Triple J Unearthed and request it on their unearthed show
Play my music on your choice of streaming platform.
Share this fundraiser.

Every little bit helps! Click on the link to find my other socials and follow!! https://linktr.ee/iamdanii
