story:
Aloha! Help us rebuild our home studio & make music again! 

Thanks for tuning in! My name is Lani & I'm an Asian American singer songwriter & single mama who just got on the ballet for 15 awards in 7 categories for this year's 2021 Na Hoku Hanohano Awards, with my 4/20/20 3 album release, da HI Life, Vol I, II & III (which are all on the ballot for Album of the Year ~ yay!). This campaign is to raise money to help me rebuild my home studio so I can record my next album, a reggae album, and level up the quality of my music videos and songs. 

This campaign is really important to me because it will help me rebuild my music studio so that I can continue to focus my energy on creating quality music for my community during a time of great change & turmoil. As a single mother, most of my time, energy & resources go towards my children, and whatever is leftover is what I have. We live very humbly and I don't ask for much. I lost all of my music recording equipment & gear when we had to evacuate from Pele's lava flow a few years ago, and now am down to only one ukulele and one guitar.

I have all the music, the songs, the beats, the talented local and international musicians who have agreed to bless this project all lined up & ready to go !~ we just need some help getting musical & recording equipment & money to compensate these talented studio musicians to get started! 

Please consider being an angel & helping us on our journey to create more healing, soothing, beautiful music for our island & our planet. Make a statement & support your independent Asian American artists during this time of rampant anti~Asian racism ~ be the change you seek in this world! God bless you & thank you for listening, and for your aloha. 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown in more detail, dear:

Basically, I need anywhere from $3k-4k to fund the re~creation of my home studio and to help me record this next reggae album.  The costs are itemized in detail below. Most musicians ask for 20k for their album or even single fundraisers; however I'm not trying to milk you for more ~ I'm asking for the bare minimum, because as a single mama, I know how to stretch and budget and get things done with good quality at a fraction of the regular price, haha. I think this amount is totally achievable ~ if just 30 -50 people bless this project with $100 each, or if 10 generous & music~loving folks simply act as patrons and support by providing for one of the items on the list below each, then it's done! 

Specifically, what I need is: 

* a new laptop with Logic Pro  ($1200)
* 2 mics ($300)
* speakers ($200)
* amp ($500)
* midi  ($200) 
* ukulele fix, mic stand & wires ($200)
* headphones ($100) 
* honorarium for musicians ($1k) 
* video camera ($500) 

Here are some of the unique perks you'll get:
* my complete discography (all my songs!) 
* a monthly membership where you see exclusive videos & photos & get recipes & mantras
* your name written in the liner notes and included in the thank you section of my next album and music video, and
*  even a custom song and private acoustic concert for the most generous of Lani's angels!

ps ~ I am also open to doing sound healing workshops, creative writing workshops, yoga classes, guitar, ukulele & voice workshops for patrons who donate $100 or more ~ just pm me and we'll talk~story details! 

If we don't reach your entire goal, we will simply use what we have collected to get the most important & necessary musical gear and build from there. Step by step, you can do anything, as my auntie says. 
 

The Impact

Your contribution, no matter how big or small, will make a big difference to this project, because you will be showing your very real support of an Asian American artist in a time of great anti~Asian sentiment in our country. 

This project is valuable because it helps to amplify the voices of under~represented Asian American singers in our country and in helping our journey, you are a crucial and necessary part of the creative process. In the olden days, artists had patrons that supported them so they were able to create freely ~ by helping with this project, you are being a true patron of the arts. 

Last year, on this same day (4/20/20) I simultaneously released 3 albums into the world, in the middle of a global crisis. I had no idea what would happen; I just put in the good work, because Work is Love. I am over the moon to announce that within this year, all three albums made the local and national news & my songs were featured in music podcasts and music articles, I am thrilled that all 3 albums are currently in the running for Album of the Year for the 2021 Na Hoku Hanohano Awards. Three songs from those three albums are nominated for Song of the Year, and two are nominated for Instrumental Composition of the Year, and I am a nominee for Female Vocalist of the Year & Most Promising Artist of the Year. 

This recognition from the Na Hoku Hanohano Awards is a true blessing & honor for me, my dears, and I hope & pray that you trust that I will do my best to leave a beautiful legacy & record of music for my children, and for our future generations. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute at this time, it's all good ~ we are grateful if you can please share this with souls who may resonate. 

Thank you so much for tuning in, and for your support ~ God Bless You! * ALOHA *
story_txt:
Aloha! Help us rebuild our home studio & make music again! 
Thanks for tuning in! My name is Lani & I'm an Asian American singer songwriter & single mama who just got on the ballet for 15 awards in 7 categories for this year's 2021 Na Hoku Hanohano Awards, with my 4/20/20 3 album release, da HI Life, Vol I, II & III (which are all on the ballot for Album of the Year ~ yay!). This campaign is to raise money to help me rebuild my home studio so I can record my next album, a reggae album, and level up the quality of my music videos and songs. This campaign is really important to me because it will help me rebuild my music studio so that I can continue to focus my energy on creating quality music for my community during a time of great change & turmoil. As a single mother, most of my time, energy & resources go towards my children, and whatever is leftover is what I have. We live very humbly and I don't ask for much. I lost all of my music recording equipment & gear when we had to evacuate from Pele's lava flow a few years ago, and now am down to only one ukulele and one guitar.I have all the music, the songs, the beats, the talented local and international musicians who have agreed to bless this project all lined up & ready to go !~ we just need some help getting musical & recording equipment & money to compensate these talented studio musicians to get started! Please consider being an angel & helping us on our journey to create more healing, soothing, beautiful music for our island & our planet. Make a statement & support your independent Asian American artists during this time of rampant anti~Asian racism ~ be the change you seek in this world! God bless you & thank you for listening, and for your aloha. What We Need & What You Get

In the olden days, artists had patrons that supported them so they were able to create freely ~ by helping with this project, you are being a true patron of the arts. Last year, on this same day (4/20/20) I simultaneously released 3 albums into the world, in the middle of a global crisis. I had no idea what would happen; I just put in the good work, because Work is Love. I am over the moon to announce that within this year, all three albums made the local and national news & my songs were featured in music podcasts and music articles, I am thrilled that all 3 albums are currently in the running for Album of the Year for the 2021 Na Hoku Hanohano Awards. Three songs from those three albums are nominated for Song of the Year, and two are nominated for Instrumental Composition of the Year, and I am a nominee for Female Vocalist of the Year & Most Promising Artist of the Year. This recognition from the Na Hoku Hanohano Awards is a true blessing & honor for me, my dears, and I hope & pray that you trust that I will do my best to leave a beautiful legacy & record of music for my children, and for our future generations.

Gracias Christmas Cantata is performed by award-winning Gracias Choir & Orchestra, an international renowned music group whose sole mission is to showcase the life-changing power of music and performing arts. This mission has taken Gracias Choir all around the world every year. They perform in front of presidents, mayors, congressmen, educational leaders, and devoted audiences who know, appreciate, and adore Gracias music.

story:
Irish Traditional Fiddle Music, new edition needed!


Above: The new 3rd edition will look as similar as possible to this, the 2nd edition.

1,000 books needed, with high-quality photo-offset printing, spiral bound, durable. 235 authentic Irish jigs, reels, hornpipes and more. 176 pages, compact 8.5" x 7" size fits in a fiddle case!

This will be the 3rd edition of this landmark collection of Irish fiddle tunes. Irish Traditional Fiddle Music was originally published in three distinct volumes beginning in 1973 by Irish music enthusiasts Randy Miller and Jack Perron. Subsequently the 3 volumes were combined and published in 1977. That 1st edition was updated and expanded in a 2nd edition, released by Randy Miller on St. Patrick's Day 2006. Financial assistance is urgently needed and with your help, a revised 3rd edition will be published early this fall!

"Frankly, it's the best Irish tune collection issued for many a long year." -Geoff Wallis, Musical Traditions e-zine (complete review here)

This book (abbreviated "ITFM") remains in high demand as musicians fall in love with Irish music. But the book is in danger of going out of print. This new edition will ensure that the next generation of fiddlers will have access to this definitive collection. Won't you please consider a pledge in support of the re-issue of ITFM?

The new edition will contain the original clear and faithful settings of 235 jigs, reels, hornpipes, polkas, slip jigs, and airs. Updated text will be added and the book will be printed on heftier paper stock for added durability. Additionally, photo-offset printing will be used in order to enhance the print quality both in the music notation and in Randy Miller's finely detailed wood-engraved illustrations.

Although the book is primarily edited with fiddle players in mind, it can very readily be used by any melody instrument. Guitar chords are included as well as a discography, bibliography, and extensive notes on tunes and sources. The cover and inside illustrations are from an original wood engraving by Randy Miller titled "Images from the Book of Kells." (To learn more about Randy's print click here.)

The tune transcriptions are true to the personal and regional characteristics of fiddlers such as Julia Clifford, Paddy Cronin, Martin Wynne, Sean McGuire, Andy McGann, Mairtin Byrnes, Michael Coleman, Paddy Canny, and others. Great pains were taken to contact musicians or their descendants, and recording companies to secure permission to publish, and all copyright rights have been secured for publication. ITFM remains a unique and meticulously edited collection of great Irish music.

For this 3rd edition of ITFM I will be using my own InDesign desktop publishing application to create files of all the pages and covers. They will then be used by Morgan Press, based in New Hampshire, to print 1,000 copies. The appearance of this edition will be quite similar to that of the 2nd edition (as shown in the photo) but with better durability due to higher quality paper. I have worked previously with Morgan Press to publish my other tune books, and they do a fine job of printing and binding.

I hope you will want to support the new edition of my book. In so doing, you will help preserve and make available to lovers of Irish fiddle music a treasure trove of traditional tunes.

Thank you!

Above: Randy Miller, fiddler, teacher, graphic artist, button maker, and tune book publisher.

After graduating from Oberlin College (Ohio) in 1970, I began life-long interests in the graphic art of wood engraving; pewter button casting; collecting traditional fiddle tunes from New England, Ireland and Scotland; editing and publishing tune books; and playing fiddle.

Here is a link to my website and online gallery of prints.

These combined pursuits have allowed me to remain self-employed with a small home-based business for 45 years. I am the owner and distributor of Fiddlecase Books, now with 5 titles: Irish Traditional Fiddle Music, New England Fiddler's Repertoire, William Marshall's Scottish Melodies, The Fiddler's Throne, and The Fiddler's Friend. These books are available online on my website as well as through amazon.com. www.fiddlecasebooks.com

In 2005 I formed the band Celticladda which has performed throughout the United States and overseas, playing for contra dances, concerts, and at festivals. Currently I play in a duo called Shindy, featuring fiddle and guitar and performing Celtic music. I co-host several weekly Irish music sessions up and down the Connecticut River Valley.

I was featured in the January 2015 issue of New Hampshire Magazine.

And Upper Valley Life Magazine also featured me in an article about Irish Music sessions I host.

+ + + + + + +

More on the Perks - Your Gift for Contributing!

$10 - Thank you for supporting this project!

$20 - Randy's Cast Pewter Buttons

Above: Cast pewter buttons by Randy Miller, from a wood engraving of Celtic knotwork. Beautiful buttons for knitwear, shirts, and coats. These buttons are one of the rewards offered to contributors.

$25 - Assortment of 4 Notecards by Randy Miller

Assortment of 4 exquisitely detailed, black and white wood engravings on fine quality notecard stock. Includes envelopes, as pictured below.

Below: Randy engraving a woodblock. I use graver tools to engrave the design in a block of boxwood, then pull prints from the block on my antique printing press.


$35 - The Fiddler's Friend, book of fiddle exercises

This perk is a copy of "The Fiddler's Friend - 40 Exercises to Improve Fingering and Bowing" by Randy Miller. A great resource for helping improve your fiddling! For beginning level through advanced.


$40 - Assortment of 12 Notecards by Randy Miller

This perk consists of 12 assorted original notecards by Randy Miller. Included is the design "Irish Ornaments" from the hand-engraved boxwood block by Randy, the same wood engraving also used on the front cover of Irish Traditional Fiddle Music! Designs include New England landscapes, animals, musicians, and dancers. Folded cards are 3.5" x 5" and are printed black and white on fine quality paper, blank inside. Includes matching envelopes.


$50 - New Edition of Irish Traditional Fiddle Music

You will receive a signed and dated copy of the new 3rd edition of ITFM. Randy Miller's signature will be on the title page. 235 meticulously transcribed classics of Irish fiddling, with extensive notes on the tunes and sources. Spiral bound for easy opening, quality paper and durability. Includes Randy's wood engraved illustrations throughout. FREE SHIPPING - USA.


$75 - Two tune books: New England Fiddler's Repertoire and ITFM

A copy of New England Fiddler's Repertoire by Randy Miller, with 168 classic tunes from the heart of New England. Considered "the bible" of contra dance music, this book contains the core repertoire of jigs, reels, hornpipes and marches. Illustrated with Randy's wood engravings; you will also receive the new edition of ITFM. Both books signed by Randy Miller.


$100 - Fiddle Lesson by Randy Miller

You will receive 2 items: 1) a 2-hour fiddle lesson by Randy Miller at your home or office within 100 miles of Keene, NH (Boston, Providence, Montpelier, Albany included). Randy has 15 years of fiddle teaching experience, all ages and levels, and is especially versed in Irish bowing and ornaments. He is also recognized by NH State Council on the Arts as a Master Teacher of Contra Dance Music. REDEEM by 4/2016!
AND, 2) A signed and dated copy of the new 3rd edition of ITFM.



$150 - Signed wood engraving print "Celtic Madonna" by Randy Miller

You will receive 2 items: 1) original wood engraving print by Randy Miller titled "Celtic Madonna," suitable for framing. Based on an image in Ireland's Book of Kells, this print measures 2-5/8" x 3-1/2" and is printed by the artist directly from the woodblock on cream colored Welsh basingwerk paper. Randy uses an antique Chandler and Price letterpress - this is an original work of art, not a photo reproduction! Signed by the artist in an edition of 200; AND 2) a signed and dated copy of the new 3rd edition of ITFM.

Below: Celtic Madonna (wood engraving by Randy Miller) Note: actual print is crisp and clear!


$500 - Signed wood engraving print "Images from the Book of Kells" by Randy Miller

You will receive two items: 1) original wood engraving print by Randy Miller titled "Images From the Book of Kells, ca. 800 AD," suitable for framing. Based on images in Ireland's Book of Kells, this print measures 5.5" x 7.25" and is printed by the artist directly from the wood block on cream colored Welsh paper. Randy uses an antique Chandler and Price letterpress - this is an original work of art, not a photo reproduction! Signed by the artist in an edition of 200; AND 2) A signed and dated copy of the new 3rd edition of ITFM.

Below:"Images from the Book of Kells" by Randy Miller. I engraved and printed this study of elements from the historic Irish book. Portions of this engraving decorate the cover and inside pages of ITFM. Note: actual print is crisp and clear!

For more information on the above print, Images from the Book of Kells, visit my online art gallery.


$1,000 - Set of 2 Wood Engraving prints by Randy Miller

You will receive 3 items: 1) Images from the Book of Kells, ca. 800 AD (print), and 2) Celtic Madonna (print), suitable for framing. Two wood engravings by Randy Miller printed by the artist directly from the wood block on cream colored Welsh paper. Both of these beautifully detailed engravings are based on images in Ireland's Book of Kells. Original works of art, not photographically reproduced! Signed by the artist in editions of 200; AND 2) a signed and dated copy of ITFM.


+ + + + + +

My Funding Goal - $6,500


I have a New Hampshire printer on board (the same company that printed the current 2nd edition nine years ago!) who will print and bind the book from my own Adobe InDesign digital files. I have specified photo offset printing in order to get the highest quality printing, and a fine quality, heavy paper stock to add durability to the book and keep bleed-through to an absolute minimum. The actual cost of printing and binding 1,000 copies of the new edition of ITFM is several thousand dollars more than my goal of $6,500. I will personally finance a portion of the publication costs but NEED YOUR HELP too!

story:
"3:10 To Heaven" is the working title of the new recording project. No it's not a spriritual or gospel record but those elements have always been a part of my writing and that includes this album as well.

"3:10" is an acoustic project that I'm very excited about. The songs are from my heart, my soul and from my life. I've been writing songs since I was 14 years old and that passion has only grown stronger with time. This will be my 6th studio album, all of which contain songs that I've written, and sharing those songs and these new songs is why I love to write.

Why "3:10 To Heaven"?

Well, about a year ago I lost my Mom to a terrible disease, Alzheimer's. She put up a brave battle but eventually it got the better of her. Late one night the Lord came and took her home. The time of her passing was "3:10"am. As we were riding home after being at the hospital, I asked my Dad about the time that she left us and he said "3:10, 3:10 to Heaven." Well by the time we got home I had most of the song written. And for the most part it stayed just the way I wrote it that night with very few changes. It became the focal point for this project.     

So that is how this project got started and why it's so important to me. I want to share her story and share the music that means so much to me...with YOU! If you can help with this recording it would mean so much to me and I know you will love these new songs. Your contribution would be an integral part of making this project come to life, and for that I THANK You!

The "Perks" of the Project!

We've set up some very unique, interesting and fun "perks" that you will receive in return for helping to make this project happen. From as simple as receiving a download copy of the new album to signed copies of the CD, house concerts and meet & greets, right up to a corporate package with a full band performance of your choice. At each step along the way we're excited to interact with you and get to know you better, while at the same time you are helping so much and it's very much appreciated.

Where does the funding go?

Recording music and watching your songs come to life is an amazing, rewarding experience. But that process is very time consuming, expensive and involves a number of steps and help along the way. Studio time, a producer, musicians, graphic artists, etc and so much more. Your contribution will help to cover a portion of these costs. And that is such an important part to this whole process!

Reaching our goal is of great importance to us in making this project a reality. But in the event we don't quite reach that mark, this project will proceed and your contributions will help so much!

Helping to spread the word!

It would mean a lot to us if you could share this funding campaign with your friends. Be it on social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to emails and contact lists. Use the "indiegogo" share tool to help make sharing quicker and easier. And again, in doing so you are helping us make this project a REALITY!

"3:10 to Heaven" is a story just waiting to be told, let's tell it together. THANK YOU!
story_txt:
"3:10 To Heaven" is the working title of the new recording project. No it's not a spriritual or gospel record but those elements have always been a part of my writing and that includes this album as well.
"3:10" is an acoustic project that I'm very excited about. The songs are from my heart, my soul and from my life. I've been writing songs since I was 14 years old and that passion has only grown stronger with time. This will be my 6th studio album, all of which contain songs that I've written, and sharing those songs and these new songs is why I love to write.
Why "3:10 To Heaven"?
Well, about a year ago I lost my Mom to a terrible disease, Alzheimer's. She put up a brave battle but eventually it got the better of her. Late one night the Lord came and took her home. The time of her passing was "3:10"am. As we were riding home after being at the hospital, I asked my Dad about the time that she left us and he said "3:10, 3:10 to Heaven." Well by the time we got home I had most of the song written. And for the most part it stayed just the way I wrote it that night with very few changes. It became the focal point for this project.     
So that is how this project got started and why it's so important to me. I want to share her story and share the music that means so much to me...with YOU! If you can help with this recording it would mean so much to me and I know you will love these new songs. Your contribution would be an integral part of making this project come to life, and for that I THANK You!
The "Perks" of the Project!
We've set up some very unique, interesting and fun "perks" that you will receive in return for helping to make this project happen. From as simple as receiving a download copy of the new album to signed copies of the CD, house concerts and meet & greets, right up to a corporate package with a full band performance of your choice. At each step along the way we're excited to interact with you and get to know you better, while at the same time you are helping so much and it's very much appreciated.
Where does the funding go?
Recording music and watching your songs come to life is an amazing, rewarding experience. But that process is very time consuming, expensive and involves a number of steps and help along the way. Studio time, a producer, musicians, graphic artists, etc and so much more. Your contribution will help to cover a portion of these costs. And that is such an important part to this whole process!
Reaching our goal is of great importance to us in making this project a reality. But in the event we don't quite reach that mark, this project will proceed and your contributions will help so much!
Helping to spread the word!
It would mean a lot to us if you could share this funding campaign with your friends. Be it on social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to emails and contact lists. Use the "indiegogo" share tool to help make sharing quicker and easier. And again, in doing so you are helping us make this project a REALITY!
"3:10 to Heaven" is a story just waiting to be told, let's tell it together. THANK YOU!

story:
Shanghai "Take Another Bite." 25th Anniversary.

ATTENTION !!! HOT NEW BAND ALERT!!!! Shanghai KICK ARSE!!! BE AFRAID!!! These guys are big haired sons of Motley Crue, Skid ...Row, Firehouse, Xyz, Steve Stevens Atomic Playboys, and Fastway, Shanghai have big spark flying guitars, big personality, and even BIGGER songs Shang Hai are probably one of the best bands of this style to have come out of the US in years SHANGHAI (great name) totally rock, there are uploads of PLAY IT LOUD killer Diller James Christian/Jeff Cannata produced songs like "Love Under Fire" a 'la Bon Jovi/Firehouse, "Hot To The Touch" stomping hard rock a' la Steve Stevens, Kix, Stryper and Motley Crue. "Shining Star" is a gentle Bon Jovi-ish power ballad and "Please Me Tease Me" is pure Motley Crue. "Without Love" is a whoa, whoa, power ballad that could almost be Dare and Europe with one huge mid chorus screeeeeeeeam from front man Jayde. Shanghai are also doing well in the far east, the album has already been available over there for a while, and has so far made a big impact with a whopping 25,000 copies already sold which is a good sign. Kivel and Metal Mayhem have made this album available to the American and European market for the first time, so expect good things to happen for this band. Shang Hai are an exciting new band who are eager to show the world their power. Make sure you buy "Take Another Bite", (which is also a multimedia cd) and get ready to get ShangHaied dudes!!!

Highly Recommended.

Rating:- 9/10 (Review By Nicky Baldrian

From Fireworks Magazine (U.K.)

Great Article for Take Another Bite and the Band.

Who We Are:


WE ARE SHANGHAI.

Jayde, Ron Kramer, Tony Childs, and Jodi (Fucking) Reese R.I.P 1967-2009

Shanghai had marginal success in Japan and Europe (Charting #19 on the Billboard Rock Charts and selling over 25,000 copies of their debut CD) and still continue to sell CDs but unfortunately the band split and have all gone their separate ways. "Pease Me Tease Me" has appeared in movies such as The Amy Fisher story Starring Drew Barrymore and Sunset Heat Starring Michael Pare, the late Dennis Hopper. Recently Tony the Guitarist and Jayde started recording again and are working on new songs hoping to perform live again with new twists on some Shanghai songs. The band has had a very rocky past 15 years, some have stopped playing al together and Jayde  almost gave up singing but now they are ready to begin their journey with you again. Unfortunately Shanghai lost Jodi the Bassist in 2009 and this, is dedicated to him.  With your help we can do this, we can't do it alone and at the present time we have very little financial backing. Shanghai NEEDS YOUR HELP and that is where you come in. Please help to continue the legacy of one of the best 80s records out there. And keep Take Another Bite and Shanghai alive for another 25 Years.

Where Your Money Will Go:

The goal for our project is $10,000

The funds raised will go to Recording, Mastering, Printing, Layouts, Graphics, Marketing, Merchandise, and expenses due to distribution of songs like iTunes and physical Vinyl packaging. If we don't reach the entire goal we will still use what we get towards the project. Don't worry perks are set in stone.

The perks of contribution include things such as: Autographed CD/Vinyl, and Exclusive to this Fundraiser, Posters and Limited Edition T-Shirts. Even some surprise RARE OOP Shanghai Merch.


This is for you:

This is for YOU the fans that have truly supported us over the past 25+ years. We want to  give back to the fans something they can cherish. This dream would never have come true without the help of our fans, friends and contributors. 


Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you cant contribute financially you can still make an impact. Spread The word. Word of mouth can be one of the biggest components in getting our project accomplished. MAKE SOME NOISE. Visit our pages and share with your friends.


www.facebook.com/shanghairockband/

www.facebook.com/jayde.vox

story:
JOIN THE MOB! 

“ROBERTA DONNAY & the Prohibition Mob Band” want to complete a NATIONAL TOUR 2015-16

Thank you !

Thank you for your sincere support!

Why ?

Our fans want to see us perform in person.  Right now, we're putting together an east coast tour for the spring. We have one big offer, but need funding to fill in the blanks with smaller venues along the way.

Based on the rich history of the Prohibition era and following the great success of “A Little Sugar” CD,  “Bathtub Gin” CD releases on January 20,  2015, in this series celebrating the roots of early jazz, focusing on women, with eclectic and obscure songs from the 1920s-1930s. On a national and International level, our show helps to educate our audiences on the history of American roots music.

About Crowdfunding:  1)  The money raised will directly pay for tour expenses, including musician fees, travel expenses, and tour promotion  2) You can give any amount you choose  3) There is no upper limit to the amount we raise  4)  If we raise more money than the amount we’re asking, more tours will be created.

Why So Much?

Taking a band on tour around the U.S. is an expensive proposition. Without big guarantees from major venues, the heavy burden of covering travel expenses for our rhythm section and horns, plus motel rooms, meals, and musician fees, falls on me, the band leader, (just like Velma in the above video), making it nearly impossible for us to consider bringing this music to our fans.

Why Tour?

Our fans want to hear and experience the band live and in person!

We all know the value of live music.  Nothing takes the place of being in the same room with our friends and fans and sharing the joy of great music and a live performance experience. We also have the opportunity to meet with our fans in person before and after our shows, which we value greatly.

The reward levels here are named for some 1920s slang terms. The cities we choose are based on our fan base, radio play, and fan requests.  We will be holding in this way, a kind of "contest" to see which cities raise the most funds to get us there. So, please include the name of your city when you give your donation.  (Previous band tours have brought us to New York City, Seattle, Portland OR, Eugene OR, San Francisco, Los Angeles, San Diego, Chicago, Phoenix, Albuquerque, and Santa Fe NM.)

Portland, Seattle, Baltimore, Miami, Phoenix, Houston, Oklahoma City, New Orleans, Kansas City, San Diego, Los Angeles, Boston, New York.  These are some of the cities where our fans want to hear the band play live.  With YOUR support, we can more than just dream about getting there.

Celebrating the vibrant history of American roots music!

We’re planning national tours so audiences can experience the magic of these wonderful songs in a live setting that is sure to transport them back to this fantastic era.  We've incorporated brief "jazz-age and prohibition-era history lessons" into our live shows, providing interesting background stories with facts about individual songs, artists, and writers.  Audiences who have experienced our performances have been enthusiastic about both music and history lessons. So I can't wait to tour with my musicians so we can share our love of this music with an even wider audience.

Imagine being transported back in time! 

Imagine being transported back in time to the roaring 1920s and 1930s “The Jazz Era”.  The history of this American art form has always fascinated me as a musician, artist, and student of jazz. I just need your help to make this dream a reality and bring it to the people in person.

Why This Project?

Growing up in the Washington DC area, I was fortunate enough to hear this music played at home, on old records and on the radio. My earliest experience singing in public was at age five, when I sang a 1920s song at a wedding.  I saw the magical effect this music had on everyone, instantly bringing a smile to their faces. Naturally, I was hooked from that moment on and decided I wanted to become a professional singer. 

Music literally saved my life.  Now, years later, I feel driven to pay homage to the artists and music that made it possible for me to thrive throughout my life as a singer and working musician.  These recording projects celebrate the vibrant, colorful history of the early jazz age that influenced my growth as an artist.  I selected an eclectic group of songs, most of which are obscure gems from the 1920s and 30s, plus a few well- known songs and originals based on this genre.  Many of these songs have been long forgotten and lost to the public; and some have never before been re-recorded. 

We’re proud to announce that our previous release “A Little Sugar” (Nov 2012) spent 9 weeks on the Jazz Radio charts and received rave reviews including DownBeat Magazine (shown below). Below are some quotes from the press…

We appreciate your interest and support. Without your support, there is no touring for this great band!

Thank you so much.

Please check out our great rewards!!!

Peace, Love, Joy and Gratitude,

- rd

Background info :

Roberta Donnay (lead singer and band leader for the Prohibition Mob Band) is a jazz recording artist, and an award-winning singer and songwriter.  She is listed in "The Jazz Singer" as one of the top 521 jazz singers. As a touring artist, Ms. Donnay has performed with or opened for many great artists (Ernestine Anderson, George Benson, David Grisman, Dr. John, John Hammond, Dan Hicks, Jonny Lange, Huey Lewis, Bonnie Raitt, Joe Sample, David Sanborn). In addition to appearing on others' recordings, songs on film and TV, 2 CDs have been released of Ms. Donnay's jazz recordings.  Now the 3rd jazz release, titled "Bathtub Gin" (on Motema Music) releases to the public Jan 20, 2015.

As a composer, Donnay wrote the song “One World”, used to celebrate the United Nation's 50th Anniversary, adopted by schools and events as a world peace anthem, including Hague Appeal For Peace (NL) and World AIDS Day (South Africa). Ms. Donnay has been touring the past 9 years as one of the Hot Licks in the performing group Dan Hicks and The Hot Licks.  Donnay signed a recording deal with Motema Music (motema.com) in 2012.

'The Jazz Age' Is Timeless

"In keeping with our Women's History Month theme, we found two current singers who are investigating music of the 1920s and '30s and making it relevant today: Roberta Donnay and Diana Krall."- Linda Yohn, WEMU 89.1 Jazz.News.Blues.

Donnay's voice could make any classic material sound wondrous and timeless, but the fact that she digs so deep into American musical history -- and works with some of the Bay Area's top jazz musicians (under the guise of the Prohibition Mob Band) -- makes A Little Sugar not only sweet, but a recording that will stand the test of time.- All Music Guide 2013

Once in awhile, a talent comes along that’s an undeniable force of nature. Roberta Donnay, the driving wheel behind Roberta Donnay and the Prohibition Mob Band, fits that description. She’s currently on the road in support of her newest CD, “A Little Sugar,” her uniquely hip tribute to Prohibition Era women singers and songwriters. Dubbed ‘a rebel jazzer’ and given superlative marks by music critics, Donnay was recently snapped up by Motema, the prestigious jazz and blues label based out of Harlem in New York. – Music And More Arizona 2012

JAZZ WEEKLY: Roberta Donnay and the Prohibition Mob Band: A Little Sugar More than musical time travelling, Donnay makes music fun again. - George W. Harris

Donnay immerses herself in the feminist sentiments of Roaring twenties and Depression Era women jazz singers, and Donnay’s softer vocals take on a gritty edge even with songs by Irving Berlin and Hoagy Carmichael. Woman empowerment, though tongue and cheek on songs such as One Monkey Don’t Stop No Show come into play. Playful is the right word to describe this recording and if you want sexy innuendos listen to (Tropical) Heatwave or (I Want a Little) Sugar in My Bowl. If you look for clever lyrics, you’ll find plenty here and you’ll chuckle at the witty one-liners too. After listening to this CD, I feel like watching Hollywood classics, even Silent Era movies. – Whole Music Expo  2012

DOWNBEAT MAGAZINE: Sugar, Soul and Microtones

Roberta Donnay, whose interpretive license is valid for both jazz and blues, knows exactly how far she can go drawing inspiration from time-honored singers like Bessie Smith, Ethel Waters and Ida Cox without sacrificing a sense of self.

Fronting her swinging Prohibition Mob Band (three horns plus rhythm section), the Bay Area chanteuse resucitates a dozen chestnuts, among them "You Go To My Head" (recall Billie Holiday's version) and "Sugar Blues" (well treated by Ella Fitzgerald)> Donnay's touch is firm and playfully coy, her tonal control secure and her combination of silkiness and sensuality effective in a meticulous, measured manner.

— Blues - by Frank John Hadley

story:
Our Story

We are a 6 piece metal-core band from the Reno Tahoe area in Nevada. For Those Searching formed in July of 2014. In this short year we've been able to accomplish so much, such as playing huge shows with Crown The Empire, Palisades, Kingdom Of Giants, Affiance, as well as playing festivals such as Treasure Fest and the All Stars Tour. Without our fans none of this would have been possible, including winning 2nd place in Ernie Ball's Battle of the Bands for Warped Tour 2015. After seeing what amazing support our fans have given us, we know that moving on with this dream of ours is tangible. The only obstacle left for us to spread our wings outside of the Western United States is that we don't yet have an EP recorded. This is where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

By donating to the recording of our first EP, you're not only helping us along our dream of playing music, but we also give back in return. Depending on how much you donate, you get awesome merchandise from us!

We know $7,000 seems like a lot to record some music, and we make it a point to be totally transparent with you. The $7,000 covers all expenses that are planned for this endeavor, including;

  • Recording studio time
  • Making of the physical CD's
  • The cost of the merchandise you receive in return for donating
If this goal is not totally met, we plan to put all of the money acquired in the process into savings towards the recording of our EP. Whether we don't quite reach $7,000 or we blow past it, our whole intent is to produce a professional quality album for you to enjoy.

The Impact

When you donate, you're making a tangible impact

  • We're given the ability to record our first, all original EP for you and the world to enjoy
  • This music will be able to serve as a portfolio to give producers, management and booking companies, as well as labels.
  • It gives us an upper hand when reaching out to labels; they see that we have the drive and the fanbase to accomplish such feats on our own and, well, it simply impresses.

Risks & Challenges

Like we said, we strive to be open and transparent about the whole process, including the risks that come with it. Some of these include;

  • Reaching our goal in the allotted time constraint
  • Shipping in the merchandise you get from donating in a timely manner
We plan to overcome these obstacles by constantly promoting this campaign, and having you do the same. Once we have all donater's shipping information, the shipping won't be an issue.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about what we're doing here. Whether that be Facebook, Twitter, whatever. As long as you're able to spread the word on any social media platform, you're helping us out! (tag us in your post so we can see it!)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • TELL YOUR FRIENDS. Any publicity towards a crowd of people who don't know us contributes towards our EP release.

story:
THANK YOU!! Between Indiegogo and in-person donations I received, we made it to a total of $4,472 and 89% funded. THANK YOU!!

I'm Jen Hitt and I am raising funds to help complete my first full-length studio album, Amphibious Heart. 

I began writing songs for this album in 2012, with the inspirational help of the Song of the Month Club, a group of patrons who listened and kept me writing songs. In December 2014, I began recording 11 of my favorite tunes with Grant Johnson and Christopher Cox of Fat Fuse Music. Grant & Chris are wonderful producers who really listened to my music and understood the stylistic goals and "sound" I wanted to create. Finding time between busy schedules, we spent 7 days recording and 5 days mixing from December 2014 through May 2015. I expect to have the album finished and in-hand by the end of September 2015.

Many talented professional musicians stepped up to help with the process: 

  • Matthew Shepherd on Drums 
  • Christopher Cox and Andrew Pressman on Bass
  • Wilson Marks on Guitar
  • Sumukhi Kristina Lanuza on Harmonium
  • Diana Burgess of Mother Falcon on Cello
  • Casie Luong, Debbie Ceron, and April Frederick lent their voices
  • and, of course, I play guitar, piano and sing :)

I am absolutely in love with this album and am more proud of it than anything I have ever recorded. The producers and musicians have brought my songs to life in a way that I only dreamed of. 

Here's a preview of all 11 songs:

With your help, I will be able to bring this album to an audience, no small feat without a record label. As a musician, I understand easily how to write and perform music, but the business side of releasing an album is challenging and requires your support to make it happen. I really can't do it without you. 

What Your Donation Will Fund 

I've been able to cover 65% of the costs and am coming to you for the final 35% of funds needed to bring this album into the world. Your donation will fund:

  • Professional Mastering: Mastering is the engineering process that makes the songs sound polished and prepares music for radio, CD and digital distribution. Here's an article about why: http://www.audio-issues.com/mastering/audio-mastering-important/
  • Grace Park Cover Art: The talented Grace Park has agreed to create a custom piece of art for the cover of the album. http://www.graceparkartist.com/
  • Graphic Design: for the physical album and the liner notes
  • Production Costs: The manufacturing of physical goods
  • Publicity: To bring this music to the widest possible audience, I will be employing a publicist for an outreach campaign. 

What You Get

PERKS!!! I've come up with some fun "thank you" gifts for your donations. 

  • The Music Itself: you can receive a digital or physical version of the album. 
  • Cool Lyric Pencils: I write all of my music using pencil. There is something distinct about how the brain works using pencil and paper, it's so solid and real. I'll be creating some silver pencils with good erasers that have lyrics from the album engraved in them. 
  • Matchbooks: with the Amphibious Heart printed on them to light candles in your home or just keep in the bathroom ;-)
  • Handpainted Moleskine Journal: a little notebook for you to use your lyric pencil in! I'll hand-paint the covers so each one is unique.
  • Beer Can Shaped Pint Glasses: Have you tried these new shaped pint glasses?They are amazing. The curved rim allows for your lip to sit gently on the edge of the glass, making your beverage of choice that much more enjoyable. I'll print them with the Amphibious Heart logo.
  • Sheet Music & Illuminated Lyrics: Handmade music and art from Jen
  • Music for you: I'll record your favorite song!
  • Yoga & Concert experiences: set up a private yoga class or concert!

Songbook Stretch Goal!

If this campaign exceeds the goal and reaches $6,000, everyone who donated $100 or more will also receive a songbook with the printed sheet music from the album.

The Impact

The songs express my belief in the mystery of love, the grand idea that despite life's ups and downs, at the core of this universe is love and its ability to help us be human regardless of whether we know the outcome or "meaning" of life. 

The message in this music is one that I deeply believe to be true. I believe opening to the mystery of love is a message worth spreading to as many ears and hearts as possible. Please help me in this mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Tell your friends! Help me get the word out by posting on social media about the campaign
  • Send a personal email to anyone who you think would appreciate this music
  • If you have contacts with music blogs that would be interested in this album please forward their information and I can follow up

Thank YOU!

I am super grateful for all of the support that I've received from friends, family and colleagues along they way... from my move to Austin in 2011 to pursue my music career, to your hugs and smiles when I see you. 

Thank you for helping to bring this music to life!

story:
Greetings everybody and thank you for checking out my Indiegogo fundraising page. To bring everyone up to speed my name is Craig and I moonlight as the rapper/lyricist "The Flu"  based out of Seattle, WA. Although in the past, music has been more of a casual hobby, my writing has always been something that has helped me through hardship and I've always had the passion & drive to keep going. Currently, I am 5 years removed from my last album dropping and have fought to get back to a level where I am proud of what I am making. The production on this album is handpicked from a bunch of dope producers by yours truly. The sound overall is a distinctly 90's sounding boom bap, retro feel with beats from Low-Hiss (Lyon, France), Bass Estrada (St. Petersburg, Russia), Loopy Luke (Lucerne, Switzerland), Pygment (Seattle, WA) & several others.There are also a few rapper/singer features on the album so far, with a couple more in the works for the final pressing. The album is going to be 14-18 songs deep with an official tracklisting coming soon! Flu Piniella represents my growth as a lyricist, it chronicles my experiences growing up in Seattle as well as my affinity for the local sport teams. I think there is something for everybody on this album.  

 Q: What exactly will your donation be used for you ask?  A: To pay for the cost of the physical albums themselves and for video production costs.

 With a minimum donation of $5 you will receive a FREE physical copy of "Flu Piniella" when it drops in August 2015.  The first three people to donate $20 or more will be invited to make a cameo in a future music video for this album. Anything and everything is appreciated and thank you for your time, as well as your generosity. - Craig Louie

story:
Hello there!


First off, I want to say thank you for giving me time out of your day just to see who I am and what I am about.


    At base level, you need to know that I created an album of music that I am very much proud of. My purpose for creating this campaign is to have a platform to independently sell my music, and regulate it myself to hopefully raise funds for College. Also, if I meet the goal I get to keep this campaign going on IndieGoGo!

    

    My name is Jesse Lee, I’m a 20 year old college student majoring in Comedic Writing and Performance. If you haven’t heard the free songs I’ve released and are looking for a better idea of what I’m about, as well as getting a taste of my style—then feel free to listen to “I’m Jesse Lee,”  “College Student Anthem,” and “Get What I Want” on my YouTube channel or Soundcloud page!  I pride myself on creating an album of music that I believe is specific to me and me only. Yes everyone has musical influences, but I’ve labeled this album in the genre: “Extra-UnOrdinary.”


    It means a lot to me to be sharing this music with whoever may stumble across it. Spread the word and tell a friend or two because I’ve put so much of myself into this album, and I want people to experience it along side of me.


   In addition to selling the album I’m also asking for additional donations to help fund my College tuition, so if you happen to enjoy the album or are feeling extra generous feel free to come back to the website and make another donation. I’m offering 2 other perks in addition to selling the album at $10 or more: if you donate $100 or more I will personally create a song using an idea you have, and it will be yours and yours only. If you donate $500 or more you’d be paying my rent for the month, and I’d be so grateful I would like to also send you a hand written/ handmade card to show my appreciation of your support.


    If I am to meet my goal of $1000 I get to keep my IndieGoGo Campaign on the site indefinitely to sell more music which I will then continue to work on. The first two months are crucial to meet the goal to move forward. If the campaign does well, I would also like to get myself better equipment to work with so I can make even better music. To make this album I used Loopy HD on my iPhone and Apple headphones, so imagine what I could accomplish with better equipment!


    Help by spreading the word! I’ve created pages on all of the popular sites and will also be making videos on my YouTube channel to continue promotion. Feel free to subscribe there, like, follow, and share this link! Thank you so much! All Love.


Links:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEzBMZt-kzvbqVmU-bfqBSA

https://twitter.com/EymeJesseLee

https://www.facebook.com/ImJesseLeeMusic

http://igg.me/at/ImJesseLee


All songs are Copyright Jesse Lee 2015.

story:
(for english description scroll down)

Wie alles begann / Die Idee

Im Spätsommer 2014, während die LANGTUNES mehrere Wochen für die Produktion ihres Debütalbums in Deutschland zu Gast waren, kam es zur ersten „Begegnung der dritten Art“. Elnaz Amiraslani, gebürtige Iranerin, Unterstützerin und Labelchefin der Musiker arbeitet parallel mit der israelischen Band RAMZAILECH. 

Schnell war die Idee geboren, die beiden exotischen Bands zusammen zu bringen.

Aufgrund des großen Interesses an dem exklusiven Doppelkonzert wurde klar, dass es etwas derartiges anscheinend noch nie gegeben hat.
Zum einen, weil ohnehin selten eine Indie-Band aus dem Iran die Möglichkeit hat sich einem deutschen Publikum vorzustellen, aber auch weil die Heimatländer beider Bands bekanntlich in tief verwurzelter Feindschaft zueinander stehen und gesellschaftliche Schnittstellen zwischen beiden Kulturen vermeintlich nicht ausgelebt werden können.

An diesem Abend wurde ein kleines, aber hell strahlendes Licht für den Frieden entfacht. Warum ist es so unvorstellbar, dass sich junge Leute aus beiden Ländern begegnen? Die Bands verstanden sich nicht nur auf Anhieb, sondern beschlossen auch ihre sich entgegengestreckten Hände zu ergreifen und nicht mehr loszulassen.

Wir, also die Musiker von LANGTUNES (Teheran), RAMZAILECH (Tel Aviv), das Label, Freunde und Fans wollen nun mit dieser gemeinsamen Tour nicht nur ein Wiedersehen feiern, sondern auch unser Zeichen für den Frieden hinaustragen.
Hinaus in die Welt, die den Glauben, dass Frieden einfach ist, so dringend nötig hat.


The Secret Handshake Tour / Warum ausgerechnet in Deutschland?

Deutschland bietet uns den neutralen Boden, auf dem sich Menschen aller Länder und Religionen frei begegnen können. Das bietet uns nicht nur die politische Neutralität, um dieses Projekt umzusetzen zu können, sondern entspricht auch unserem persönlichen Verständnis von Demokratie und Freiheit.

Außerdem haben wir schon bei unseren letzten Deutschland-Besuchen viele Freunde und Fans gefunden, die wir auf unserer Tour zusammen bringen wollen.

Einen Monat lang wollen wir quer durch Deutschland auf Tour gehen und damit nicht nur unsere Musik in Eure Lieblings-Clubs bringen, sondern auch möglichst viele Menschen Teil haben lassen an dieser einzigartigen Begegnung. Wir wollen ein gemeinsames Zeichen setzen, dafür, dass Musik und die unvoreingenommene Jugend Grenzen überwinden kann und Feindschaft nur in den Köpfen der Regierenden besteht.

Ohne Eure Hilfe ist das nicht zu schaffen! Um zwei Bands mit komplettem Equipment einen Monat lang durch die Republik zu fahren, müssen Flüge,  Hotels, Verpflegung, Techniker, Tourbus usw. bezahlt werden.

Wir wollen ausdrücklich nicht um staatliche Unterstützung bitten, um die politische Neutralität unseres Projekts zu wahren und uns nicht zum Werkzeug irgendwelcher Interessen machen zu lassen.

Der Rest liegt bei Euch. Mit Eurem Beitrag macht ihr unseren und vielleicht auch Euren Traum möglich - ein kleines Stück Weltfrieden zu schaffen! 


Das bekommt ihr von uns

Natürlich gibt es für Eure Unterstützung jede Menge großartiger Belohnungen:
von Peace-Dealer-Buttons, CDs, riesigen Dankeschön-Paketen, bis hin zu ganz privaten Begegnungen oder einem Konzert in Euren Wohnzimmern.

Hört uns zu und lernt, wie einfach es ist Freunde zu sein.
Kommt auf unsere Konzerte und erlebt es selbst.

Und natürlich versprechen wir Euch unvergessliche Konzertabende.


Und was dann?

Die Medien überbieten sich darin, Ressentiments zu schüren und berichten gerne über den Hass und die Dummheit der Menschen. Ganze Kontinente fliehen aus ihren Heimatländern, die in Brand gesetzt durch diesen Hass keinen Platz zum Leben mehr bieten.

Wir wollen mit unserem Projekt die Aufmerksamkeit der Medien aber auch darauf lenken, dass eine ganze Generation die Grenzen, die so unerbittlich umkämpft werden, bereits hinter sich gelassen hat. Junge Menschen in allen Ländern träumen doch dieselben Träume, hören dieselbe Musik und lachen gemeinsam über die Beschränktheit der sogenannten Staatsmänner.

Wir haben unser Ziel sehr hoch gesteckt. Wir wollen, dass das hier groß wird. Jeder Euro von Euch fließt direkt in unser Tour-Budget und macht es für uns überhaupt erst möglich diesen Plan umzusetzen. 

Wir machen uns auf den Weg zu Euch, helft uns dabei!


Geht das überhaupt?

Dass wir das können haben wir schon bewiesen. Schon einmal standen wir jeglichen Konsequenzen zum Trotz gemeinsam auf der Bühne und rockten uns einen Abend lang in die Erinnerung einer Stadt.

Gerade LANGTUNES sind Experten darin das zu tun, was eigentlich nicht geht. Eine Indie-Band in Teheran? Konzerttouren durch Deutschland, in Eigenregie? Ein Album im Westen veröffentlichen? Genauso wenig glauben RAMZAILECH an die staatlich verordnete Feindschaft.

Hört Euch unsere Geschichte an, um zu verstehen, wieviel Mut und Leidenschaft nötig ist, das eigentlich Unmögliche zu tun und einem Traum immer weiter zu folgen, gespannt wohin er einen führt. 

Musik kann eine Welt nicht verändern heißt es, aber wir können zeigen wie einfach es wäre die Welt zu einem besseren Ort zu machen. 


Was könnt Ihr sonst tun?

Kommt zu den Konzerten und bringt Eure Freunde mit. Bleibt auf dem Laufenden. Erzählt die Geschichte weiter. Helft uns unsere Nachricht hörbar zu machen. Glaubt nicht an die Feindschaft der Religionen, Staaten und Nationen. Trefft Euresgleichen, auf den Konzerten oder einfach überall im Netz, aus allen Ländern.

Become a Peace-Dealer!

****************************************************************************

How it all began

During the late summer of 2014, while the LANGTUNES were in Germany for the production of their debut album the first strange encouter came to place.
Elnaz Amiraslani, born in Iran, supporter and label owner of the musicians was also dealing with the israeli band RAMZAILECh for a cooperation.
Pretty quickly the idea was born to bring the two exotic bands together.

The large response and interest in the double-concert proved that nothing like this had existed before.
For one, having an iranian indie-band publicly tour through Germany was close to never. In addition, combining these two specific bands together with their national complex and deep polictical hostility avoid any cultural contact was one of a kind.

 

During this evening, a small light of hope and peace came to kindled. Why is it so unimaginamble that young people from both of these countries meet? Both bands did not only get along from the beginning but also decided to reach out to a handshake and not let go.

We, the band Langtunes (from Teheran) and Ramzailech (from Tel Aviv), the label, friends and fans would want not only celebrate being together again but also set a clear sign for peace. Into the world, we want to present how easy peace is to get.

The Secret Handshake Tour / Why in Germany?

Germany gives us the neutral grounds that we need where citizens from all over the world with various beliefs can live freely and get into interaction.
It not only gives us the political neutral surroundings for this project but also reflects our personal understanding of freedom and democracy.

In addition, we have also won a fan basis and friends during our last tour in Germany which we would like to bring together.

For one whole month we want to tour through Germany to not only bring our music to your favorite venue but also to share our special collaboartion with as many people as possible. We want to set an example and sign that music and the unbiased youth can overcome any boundary and hostility that only exist in the heads of governments mainly. 

Without your help, we cannot achieve this! We need to rent equipment and a tourbus, pay flight-tickets, accomodations, technicians, we need a promotiom-budget etc.

We specifically do not want to ask the state to subsidize us to protect our politically neutral project and avoid becoming instruments of certain interests.

It is now in you hands. With your support you just might be able to make one of our, and perhaps your, dream come true - to create a some world peace.

This is what you will get from us

 

Of course you will recieve recognition for your support with a great deal of rewards:
ranging from Peace-Dealer-Buttons, CDs, big Thank-You-Packages to a private meeting with the band or even a private concert in your living room.

Listen to us and learn how easy it is to become friends.
Come to our concerts and experience it for yourself.

Of course we also promise you an unforgettable concert night.

 

And then what?

 

The media is outdoing themselves in to construct ressentment and always quick in  reporting about hate and stupidity among people.
Whole continents are fleeing out of their home-countries that have been burnt to the ground by hate making it impossible to live there.

With our project we also want to bring the attention to the media to show that a whole generation exists that has already left these borders behind them. Young people in all countries are dreaming the same dreams, listening to the same music and are laughing together at the so-called statesman.

We have set our goals very high. We want this to be huge. Every Euro from you will flow directly into our tour-budget and will make it possible for us to even start this plan. We will be on our way to you. Help us!

Is that even possible?

That it is possible has already been proved. We have already stood together on stage despite any consequences and rocked through the night in rememberance of a city.

The Langtunes especially are experts in doing what is actually not possible. An indie-band from Teheran? Concert tour through Germany on their own? Releasing an album in the west?

It is exactly the same with Ramzailech who do not believe in the state directed hostility.

Listen to our story to understand how much courage and passion it takes to do something impossible to follow a dream and see where it can lead to.

Music cannot change the world they say, but we can show how easy it is to make the world a better place.

What can you do?

Come to our concerts and bring your friends. Stay informed. Tell the story to everyone you know. Help us get our message heard. Do not believe in the enemies and hate between religions, states and nations. Meet with like-minded people at the concerts and everywhere on the net from all over the world.

Become a Peace-Dealer

story_txt:
(for english description scroll down) Wie alles begann / Die IdeeIm Spätsommer
2014, während die LANGTUNES mehrere Wochen für die Produktion ihres Debütalbums
in Deutschland zu Gast waren, kam es zur ersten „Begegnung der dritten Art“. Elnaz Amiraslani, gebürtige Iranerin, Unterstützerin und Labelchefin der Musiker
arbeitet parallel mit der israelischen Band RAMZAILECH. Schnell war die Idee geboren, die beiden exotischen Bands zusammen zu bringen. 
Aufgrund des
großen Interesses an dem exklusiven Doppelkonzert wurde klar, dass es etwas
derartiges anscheinend noch nie gegeben hat. 
Zum einen, weil ohnehin selten eine Indie-Band aus dem Iran die Möglichkeit
hat sich einem deutschen Publikum vorzustellen, aber auch weil die Heimatländer
beider Bands bekanntlich in tief verwurzelter Feindschaft zueinander stehen und
gesellschaftliche Schnittstellen zwischen beiden Kulturen vermeintlich nicht
ausgelebt werden können. 
An diesem Abend
wurde ein kleines, aber hell strahlendes Licht für den Frieden entfacht. Warum ist es so unvorstellbar, dass sich junge Leute aus beiden Ländern
begegnen? Die Bands verstanden sich nicht nur auf Anhieb, sondern beschlossen auch ihre
sich entgegengestreckten Hände zu ergreifen und nicht mehr loszulassen.
Wir, also die
Musiker von LANGTUNES (Teheran), RAMZAILECH (Tel Aviv), das Label, Freunde und
Fans wollen nun mit dieser gemeinsamen Tour nicht nur ein Wiedersehen feiern,
sondern auch unser Zeichen für den Frieden hinaustragen. 
Hinaus in die Welt, die den Glauben, dass Frieden einfach ist, so dringend
nötig hat. 

The Secret Handshake Tour / Warum
ausgerechnet in Deutschland?Deutschland
bietet uns den neutralen Boden, auf dem sich Menschen aller Länder und
Religionen frei begegnen können. Das bietet uns nicht nur die politische
Neutralität, um dieses Projekt umzusetzen zu können, sondern entspricht auch
unserem persönlichen Verständnis von Demokratie und Freiheit. 
Außerdem haben wir schon bei unseren letzten Deutschland-Besuchen viele Freunde
und Fans gefunden, die wir auf unserer Tour zusammen bringen wollen. 
Einen Monat
lang wollen wir quer durch Deutschland auf Tour gehen und damit nicht nur unsere
Musik in Eure Lieblings-Clubs bringen, sondern auch möglichst viele Menschen Teil
haben lassen an dieser einzigartigen Begegnung. Wir wollen ein gemeinsames
Zeichen setzen, dafür, dass Musik und die unvoreingenommene Jugend Grenzen
überwinden kann und Feindschaft nur in den Köpfen der Regierenden besteht. 
Ohne Eure Hilfe
ist das nicht zu schaffen! Um zwei Bands mit komplettem Equipment einen Monat
lang durch die Republik zu fahren, müssen Flüge,  Hotels, Verpflegung, Techniker, Tourbus usw.
bezahlt werden.
Wir wollen
ausdrücklich nicht um staatliche Unterstützung bitten, um die politische
Neutralität unseres Projekts zu wahren und uns nicht zum Werkzeug irgendwelcher
Interessen machen zu lassen.Der Rest liegt bei Euch. Mit Eurem Beitrag macht ihr unseren und vielleicht
auch Euren Traum möglich - ein kleines Stück Weltfrieden zu schaffen! 
Das bekommt ihr von uns 
Natürlich gibt
es für Eure Unterstützung jede Menge großartiger Belohnungen: 
von Peace-Dealer-Buttons, CDs, riesigen Dankeschön-Paketen, bis hin zu ganz
privaten Begegnungen oder einem Konzert in Euren Wohnzimmern. 
Hört uns zu und
lernt, wie einfach es ist Freunde zu sein. 
Kommt auf unsere Konzerte und erlebt es selbst. 
Und natürlich versprechen
wir Euch unvergessliche Konzertabende. 
Und was dann?
Die Medien
überbieten sich darin, Ressentiments zu schüren und berichten gerne über den
Hass und die Dummheit der Menschen. Ganze Kontinente fliehen aus ihren Heimatländern, die in Brand gesetzt durch
diesen Hass keinen Platz zum Leben mehr bieten.
Wir wollen mit unserem Projekt die Aufmerksamkeit der Medien aber auch darauf
lenken, dass eine ganze Generation die Grenzen, die so unerbittlich umkämpft
werden, bereits hinter sich gelassen hat. Junge Menschen in allen Ländern
träumen doch dieselben Träume, hören dieselbe Musik und lachen gemeinsam über
die Beschränktheit der sogenannten Staatsmänner. 
Wir haben unser
Ziel sehr hoch gesteckt. Wir wollen, dass das hier groß wird. Jeder Euro von
Euch fließt direkt in unser Tour-Budget und macht es für uns überhaupt erst
möglich diesen Plan umzusetzen. Wir machen uns auf den Weg zu Euch, helft uns
dabei!
Geht das überhaupt?
Dass wir das
können haben wir schon bewiesen. Schon einmal standen wir jeglichen
Konsequenzen zum Trotz gemeinsam auf der Bühne und rockten uns einen Abend lang
in die Erinnerung einer Stadt.Gerade LANGTUNES sind Experten darin das zu tun, was eigentlich nicht geht. Eine
Indie-Band in Teheran? Konzerttouren durch Deutschland, in Eigenregie? Ein
Album im Westen veröffentlichen? Genauso wenig glauben RAMZAILECH an die staatlich verordnete Feindschaft. 

Hört Euch unsere Geschichte an, um zu verstehen, wieviel Mut und Leidenschaft
nötig ist, das eigentlich Unmögliche zu tun und einem Traum immer weiter zu
folgen, gespannt wohin er einen führt. Musik kann eine Welt nicht verändern heißt es, aber wir können zeigen wie einfach
es wäre die Welt zu einem besseren Ort zu machen. 
Was könnt Ihr sonst tun? 
Kommt zu den
Konzerten und bringt Eure Freunde mit. Bleibt auf dem Laufenden. Erzählt die
Geschichte weiter. Helft uns unsere Nachricht hörbar zu machen. Glaubt nicht an
die Feindschaft der Religionen, Staaten und Nationen. Trefft Euresgleichen, auf
den Konzerten oder einfach überall im Netz, aus allen Ländern.Become a Peace-Dealer!****************************************************************************

story:
Here's The Deal

Ever since we've formed as a band, we've wanted to do a live release because we feel that's who we are as a band.  Up until this point, we haven't had the time or resources in order to do this.  However, we have been presented with an opportunity from New Vine Media to help us create this project and we are stoked!

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $10,000 in order to fully fund this project.
Here's a couple of key reasons that we're asking for this amount specifically:
  • New Vine Media is bringing Matt Goldman from Glow In The Dark Studios in Atlanta to help record this live EP.
  • New Vine Media will be renting a few RED cameras (some of the best cameras in the business) in order to capture video for the night of the recording.
  • We'll need money to replicate this project in order to get physical copies in peoples hands that order them through the perks.
  • The remaining money will go towards merchandise for this project such as shirts and other things we'll have for sale as well as other production costs.


The Impact

It's pretty simple!  We believe this investment can and will effectively proclaim the greatness and majesty of God.  When you support something like this you are not only getting a great  experience, but are taking part in proclaiming the Gospel of Jesus Christ to the nations.  One of the biggest reasons we wanted to use video is because, let's face it, most everyone is looking at their phones and tablets to watch videos and listen to music these days.  And again, with this EP/DVD, we'll have opportunity to not only put this on sites like YouTube and other video streaming sites, but also international television around the world.  This opportunity is amazing and we are so thankful for it, but ultimately, we want to use this not just as another release, but as a unique opportunity for us to use Live Recordings and Video to promote the spread of the gospel and worshiping in spirit and truth to the King of all kings.

story:
Lead Single from the Album:


A Story Told In Song

We are Day Like This, a melodic rock band consisting of Jean' and Mandee Guillory, Joel Fussell, Roland Bennett, and Chanse Benoit. In 2011, we began writing songs with the themes of hope and despair. Songs inspired by school projects, astronomy, getting married, being lost at sea (yes, that really happened), and more. Once placed in a certain order, the songs began to tell a story. When we discovered this, we knew it was something worth sharing. So we decided to make our first album a concept album, a story told in a collection of songs.

After years of writing and rehearsing, we are finally at the point where we can bring this story to life. And we want you, our fans and friends, to be a part of it. 

To Our Fans

Fans of Day Like This, you are as much a part of the music as any band member. We could never thank you enough for all you do. We can't make music without the love and support that you give us. We humbly ask for your help to produce this album. This album is a labor of love for you, and we want to bring you the best possible product. We do not make any money from this campaign; all of the support you may give goes towards producing the album and perks for you. Please help us spread the word about this campaign so that it can be a success! Nothing excites us more than the possibility of going on this journey with you and seeing this album in your hands at the end of it.

How Will Funds Be Used?

In order to deliver a professional album, we need a minimum of $11,000 to produce the album, get it printed on high-quality CDs with booklets, and fulfill your perks. If we were to exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to shoot a music video, put on a professional tour to support the album, and do a promotional campaign in order to get our work out to more people and licensed into film and TV (see Stretch Goals below). Listed below is a quick estimate of how funds raised will be spent, provided we were to meet our projected goal; this is to give you a transparent idea of how much it costs for things of this nature to be done, and what your direct support in this campaign will allow us to do:

  • $5500 - Cost to produce the album (recording, mixing, mastering)
  • $1700 - CD Printing
  • $1200 - Album Art & Graphic Design
  • $1500 - Perk Fulfillment
  • $1100 - Indiegogo Fees & Paypal/Credit Card Processing Fees (10% of total raised)

What Do You Get In Return?

We are excited about this campaign because we're not only giving you an album, but also one-of-a-kind perks just for you! Check out the lists of perks to the right or below to see how you would like to take part in this project. Let's make it happen!


Stretch Goals


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us immensely:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of this page. The more buzz, the more chance we have at success.

Why Crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding is an awesome opportunity for fans and artists to partner together to bring a project to life. In the past, a record label would loan an artist money to record an album. Then the artist would be in debt to the label until they made up 100% of the cost with album sales. Which is kind of backwards if you ask us. 
Instead, why not have the fans pre-purchase the album upfront and get one-of-a-kind perks for their contributions! Crowdfunding also allows you, our closest friends and fans, to be a part of the album production.

Risks & Challenges

The more time we spend in the studio, the more money it will cost. Our budget estimate allows us to spend a reasonable amount of time in the studio while also leaving room for a little leeway for experimentation or for the unexpected.

If we do not reach our goal, the album will still be produced, and you will get your perks, but it will likely take longer for us to produce the album, as we will have to find other ways to raise the remainder of funds needed. 

Thank you all for supporting us and being a part of our story. Everything you do helps more than you know.
story_txt:
Lead Single from the Album:



A Story Told In Song
We are Day Like This, a melodic rock band consisting of Jean' and Mandee Guillory, Joel Fussell, Roland Bennett, and Chanse Benoit. In 2011, we began writing songs with the themes of hope and despair. Songs inspired by school projects, astronomy, getting married, being lost at sea (yes, that really happened), and more. Once placed in a certain order, the songs began to tell a story. When we discovered this, we knew it was something worth sharing. So we decided to make our first album a concept album, a story told in a collection of songs.
After years of writing and rehearsing, we are finally at the point where we can bring this story to life. And we want you, our fans and friends, to be a part of it. 
To Our Fans
Fans of Day Like This, you are as much a part of the music as any band member. We could never thank you enough for all you do. We can't make music without the love and support that you give us. We humbly ask for your help to produce this album. This album is a labor of love for you, and we want to bring you the best possible product. We do not make any money from this campaign; all of the support you may give goes towards producing the album and perks for you. Please help us spread the word about this campaign so that it can be a success! Nothing excites us more than the possibility of going on this journey with you and seeing this album in your hands at the end of it.
How Will Funds Be Used?
In order to deliver a professional album, we need a minimum of $11,000 to produce the album, get it printed on high-quality CDs with booklets, and fulfill your perks. If we were to exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to shoot a music video, put on a professional tour to support the album, and do a promotional campaign in order to get our work out to more people and licensed into film and TV (see Stretch Goals below). Listed below is a quick estimate of how funds raised will be spent, provided we were to meet our projected goal; this is to give you a transparent idea of how much it costs for things of this nature to be done, and what your direct support in this campaign will allow us to do:

$5500 - Cost to produce the album (recording, mixing, mastering)
$1700 - CD Printing
$1200 - Album Art & Graphic Design
$1500 - Perk Fulfillment
$1100 - Indiegogo Fees & Paypal/Credit Card Processing Fees (10% of total raised)







What Do You Get In Return?
We are excited about this campaign because we're not only giving you an album, but also one-of-a-kind perks just for you! Check out the lists of perks to the right or below to see how you would like to take part in this project. Let's make it happen!




Stretch Goals




Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us immensely:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools at the bottom of this page. The more buzz, the more chance we have at success.


Why Crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding is an awesome opportunity for fans and artists to partner together to bring a project to life. In the past, a record label would loan an artist money to record an album. Then the artist would be in debt to the label until they made up 100% of the cost with album sales. Which is kind of backwards if you ask us. Instead, why not have the fans pre-purchase the album upfront and get one-of-a-kind perks for their contributions! Crowdfunding also allows you, our closest friends and fans, to be a part of the album production.
Risks & Challenges
 The more time we spend in the studio, the more money it will cost. Our budget estimate allows us to spend a reasonable amount of time in the studio while also leaving room for a little leeway for experimentation or for the unexpected.
If we do not reach our goal, the album will still be produced, and you will get your perks, but it will likely take longer for us to produce the album, as we will have to find other ways to raise the remainder of funds needed. 




Thank you all for supporting us and being a part of our story. Everything you do helps more than you know.

story:
Hello,

My name is Vasko and  I am 12 years old. This year  I auditioned at Mannes Prep  in NYC  http://www.newschool.edu/mannes/prep/ and I have been accepted in the piano pre-senior program. I believe in Mannes I can accomplish great achievements and learn much more than I ever have learned before. With the program I will be engaged in a professional environment. I will also have various performing opportunities. The program will also provide the opportunity to learn from a great music and have master classes with remarkable piano teachers.

I started piano lessons when I was four and a half years old. At this time my family and I had no intention of learning piano professionally. It was two years later that I decided I wanted professional teaching so I could develop a career when I grow up. By this time I wanted to become a concert pianist. Classical music is very relaxing and I love the beautiful melodies in every song. I sometimes listen to classical music when I'm doing homework because it helps me concentrate more. So far I've played in many concerts but my greatest achievement was when I won the first place in the Rondo Young Artist competition. My reward was the chance to play in Carnegie Hall. Here I played, Sonata in F major by Beethoven and Study in E minor by Bertini.

Mannes might be a choice of a lifetime and I would be really happy to have the chance to participate in this professional program. Another benefit of being in the program is that I would have access to Steinway pianos. I am willing to do all the hard work that it will take to participate in this program. I believe the Mannes can make me a better pianist and raise my self-confidence.

You can see my performance of Mozart Fantasia in D minor and a duet of Mozart in D major when you click at the links below.


https://www.dropbox.com/sc/ gmntyixmb2mhg3q/ AAC69ERW2pbHfXBBEmWoM-EPa

https://www.dropbox.com/sc/ 6yckt9i3oiecrjk/AAB1k7bSEe7_ ZND1GLkMCceQa

My tuition for Mannes is $ 4370.00 and I will appreciate any help.
