story:
The Mission

The mission of Christ Citadel (CIC) is to bring people to Christ and support them in becoming successful and relevant Christians. Christ Citadel is committed to raising and empowering leaders to reach out and disciple. The vision is to reach communities and nations with the balanced Gospel of Jesus Christ. This is relevant for the end-times, thereby bringing deliverance, transformation and restoration to people.

St Catherine’s


St Catherine’s is a big part of Nottingham city’s natural heritage. Originally part of the Church of England’s network/family, due to a struggling congregation, it was closed (in 2003). The building has since been left to the natural elements and local vandals around the area. As time passed the building’s condition has deteriorated.

St Catherine’s, which was purchased in mid-2006, required huge restoration work to the building in order to bring it back to its former glory.

The key aim is to have a direct impact in the local community. For this to be accomplished, a vibrant, warm and loving environment must be created to welcome all people; members & non-members.

Community impact

Soup Kitchen-ministering to the underprivileged in the community

Youth Development through music, motivational talks, expressive arts

Counselling Center

Parish Nursing-meeting the communities needs holistically by promoting healthy lives and offering support through support groups , counselling and prayer.

Restoration Phases

Since the purchase of St Catherines, a number of restoration projects have been run that aim to improve the churches condition, inside and out. These projects have been carried out in phases as a matter of maximizing cost efficiency and effectiveness.

Restoration Phases:

Phase 1 - Clearing out of old antiqued/damaged furniture.

Phase 2 - Removal of walled partition in main hall & thus increasing [or restoring] building seating capacity.

Phase 3 - Remodelling of chancel and creation of administrative offices behind altar.

Phase 4 - Upgrade of heating network and new boiler installation. <<---- THIS IS THE CURRENT PHASE

Future Phases - Window restoration, stonework repair,

Phases 4!!!

Since embarking onto the fourth restoration phase; there have been a number of setbacks meaning the church has remained cold and unwelcoming. The church has resorted to using gas space heaters as a means of maintaining a moderate temperature within the church during meetings….. These space heaters were brought in as a temporary solution but have remained a permanent fixture….and costly.

Carbon monoxide, Nitrogen dioxide, Carbon dioxide and water vapour are produced as by-products during the heating (combustion) process, with the first two proving to be serious health risks in unvented areas.

An additional issue is that with the increased amount of water vapour in the air, degradation of the interior has increased substantially affecting the paint and eroding the structural pillars.

With your assistance, CIC hopes to address these adverse issues promptly and warm up the church through safe conventional means.

Budget

Item

Cost

Amount

Total Cost

Heating System (piping network, new boiler, labour)

30000

1

30000

Fire doors (draft repair)

1500

2

3000

Windows (draft repair)

2000

1

2000

Target amount

35000

Fundraising fees

Indiegogo fees

-900

Cost of perks

-2000

Overheads & Processing fees

-2100

Fundraising target

40000

Other Ways You Can Help

CIC is eternally grateful for you reaching this point and for taking part in the Church’s history.

All forms of your help is welcome, please feel free to do one of the following;

·  Remember CIC in your quiet time; Prayer is the Key that opens ALL doors and frees us from all earthly bondage.

·   Utilise the SHARE tools provided by Indiegogo to help SPREAD the word on Facebook and Twitter.

·  Tell your friends, church, family and neighbours and let them know of the great work CIC is doing for the Nottingham community.

·   Sending an e-mail to anyone you know who you think will want to help too. Writing or blogging about us with a link to this campaign.

More Questions

Please feel free to get in contact by e-mailing CIC at
cicnott@christ-citadel.com

story:
Who are you?

We're Brandi & the Alexanders, a soul/rock/funk band. We'd like to complete a ten-song album to introduce to the world stage, but there's one thing holding us back -- we're broke! 

Between kids, marriage, work and NYC rent, we've barely been able to scrape by! But we have a record full of good music that NEEDS to be heard -- and you can help make that happen!

What do you need money for?

Out total need is $15,000 -- yep, we're shooting for the moon! This will cover:

  • Recording (including basic tracking, mixing and mastering)
  • A producer
  • Promoting the record to radio
  • Marketing and print promotion
  • Tour funds

What do I get for a donation?

The perks vary per donation, but we're offering a variety of gifts:

  • Digital copy of album
  • Crafty, personalized thank-you cards
  • Brandi & the Alexanders t-shirt, poster and buttons
  • One-on-one music lessons with a member of the band
  • A home-cooked dinner made by a (culinary-trained) band member
  • Listening party and private concert
  • And much more!

What happens if you don't hit your goal?

Even if we don't hit the magic number of $15K, we will still use every penny we get to record, market, promote and tour as much as we can!

The Impact

Over the course of the past year, the band has been focused on both what kind of music we want to make and how we must challenge ourselves to reach as high as we can, not to give up, not say "good enough" or settle for less.  We're on the precipice of big changes both in our individual lives and as a band, so now is the time for us to go for it!

Risks & Challenges

There is only one risk: We might not make it to the total. But you know what? Every single contribution will still go toward making the best music you've heard in a long time. We can't wait for you to hear what we've got!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, email, smoke signals in the park -- wherever! And use the Indiegogo share tools -- it makes it easy to put on your social media channels!
  • Come to our shows! Even if you can't donate, your face in the crowd is another way to support the cause!

Thank you for anything and everything you can do to help us achieve our goal!

- Brandi, Eric, Eric, Nick and Allan

story:
***ALL DONATIONS INCLUDE SHIPPING COSTS!***
***ALL PERKS WILL BE SHIPPED FROM THE U.S.!***


A Little About Us

We are a six-piece hardcore/pop-punk band based out of Nagoya, Japan. We love music, and we love you for loving music and being here and reading this.

To see more of who we are and what we do, check us out elsewhere on the net:
  • Visit our Website
  • Like Us on Facebook
  • Listen on BandCamp
  • Follow Us on Twitter
  • Watch Us on YouTube

Here is a short teaser of the 5 songs to be on 'Lessons Learned':


___________________________________________________
Our Campaign

We will be hitting the studio in January and February to record a debut 5-song EP, to be titled 'LESSONS LEARNED'. We're trying to raise $4,000 to pay for the costs of recording, mixing, mastering, design, and duplication. We have two months to meet our goal!

Price Breakdown....
  • Recording: $750 for 20 hrs of studio time
  • Mixing/Mastering: $2,500 for 5 songs
  • EP Design: $200
  • Disc Duplication (+shipping to Japan): $550

At the end of this campaign (Feb. 5th), we'll receive whatever money we've raised, and pay for the remaining costs out of our own pockets. In that scenario, the completion time will be pushed back at least a few months.

___________________________________________________

How This Works

We have a goal of $4,000 to reach in two months. We offer you rewards (to the right, and below). You choose the reward that you want, contribute that amount toward our goal, and you get the perk. When the campaign is finished, we get the amount raised, and you get your stuff! Cool, right?

For the perks that come with shirts, choose from one of the following! We'll be sure to email you to get your size and the design you want before the campaign is finished in February!

___________________________________________________

Thank You!

We understand that not everyone has the ability to contribute monetarily. That's OK! If you don't have money to spare, you can still help by getting the word out about this campaign on Facebook or Twitter! Thank you so much!

story:
Spread Vibes is an alternative rock mixed with cool electronics music project from Russia (I hope, you are not concerned about political issues) created in 2010 and running by me (Vladimir Smirnov) only. I'm making music for 7 years already and, you know, it owned me almost instantly. I can't even imagine my life without music. As I'm doing everything by my own, it takes a huge amount of effort and time. I want to keep moving forward and improve my skills, that's why I need your help!

I don't really have a big fan base or friends and family support, so if you can, please contribute now! The future of Spread Vibes really depends on your action. 


What is One Year of Spread Vibes?

An idea is pretty simple: I need $5000 to make music whole next year without thinking about how to make money, so I'll have a plenty of time for creation process. Past couple of years I have put a lot of time and effort to earn money from the internet and I thought it will work for me and my music, but it's not. It still takes a lot of time to continuously gain necessary funds just for living. Now there is financial crisis in Russia, sales dropped and it seems, there is no escape from financial instability except crowdfunding and your help!

I need One Year of Spread Vibes campaign to bring my music on stage (to perform live) with a great success. And to do that I need money to free up my time and to make more songs, I need a band, I need a bigger community and I need more people who would like to help me! This campaign and whole next year is a real opportunity to make Spread Vibes live.


What do I need $5000 for?

$5000 is just enough to reach my needs: to rent an apartment, to eat and drink, to free up my time to make music and practice a lot. All costs for material prizes and shipping will be spent from my current budget.  

If I succeed, I'm going to release at least SIX new tracks in 2015 and 2016: one every two months. Every track will be a unique, fresh and modern piece of music. Probably more, but six for sure. Please, keep in mind, that I'm doing everything from scratch by myself and everything has to be perfect, that's why it takes so long. In 2014 I released three tracks: Believe In Me, Power and Information War. 


$5000 is a minimum. I need extra money for a better equipment (microphone, midi keyboard and better camcorder will cost about $1000) and for promotion purposes, because promotion is really a 50% of success, it's very important. So if I'll raise more than $5000, it would be great! I will definitely increase quality and improve content of my music videos.


Time = money

Alright, if I need money to free up my time, what will I spend my time for? First of all, music. From my experience, I need about 4 weeks to make perfect instrumental and write lyrics for a song. Then it goes vocal rehearsal process that takes about 2 weeks and acapella recording in one day as a result. Finally, I need 2 weeks to mix acapella with instrumental, finalize, mix and master whole track and make a graphics for a single. Everything has to be perfect and reviewed lots of times! But it does not take 24 hours per day of course. At the same time of music making I will improve my vocal skills: rehearsals in a studio 3 days a week for 3 hours. It will cost about $720. At the same time I have to do a lot of infrastructure work: renew and update spreadvibes.com, make a good Spread Vibes Shop, constantly update information on social networks and let you know what's going on, increase my fan base, work on advertising and internet radio, to monitor how's everything going and to spread the world.


What you get?

I can't give you a lot of physical stuff like merch or something (shipping also costs), but I can make something more special like giving you an experience of how music is making, to make you really a big part of something awesome and to offer a lot of personal gratitude!

I think that the most interesting perk for you and me is Collaboration! It will be a very unique experience, because you can actually be a part of my music and I can actually work directly with you!

Each physical CD you choose will be signed and shipped carefully! I'm taking full responsibility for it's content and quality, as well as for shipping issues.

I'm sure that our Skype chats will be also memorable for both us! It will go in positive way, and as a result we could know and understand each other better.

If I don't reach $5000, I'm not going to give up! Music is already a big part of my life and would definitely be. For sure, I will find time and power to keep moving, but with your help I can reach my goal way faster. Subscriptions for three or six tracks will be valid until I'll make them. As well as collaboration perks. Lifetime warranty.


The most recent Spread Vibes stuff

Spread Vibes - Information War. Release date: November 12, 2014.

Spread Vibes - Power. Release date: June 8, 2014.

Spread Vibes - Believe In Me. Release date: March 13, 2014.



Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge is to keep moving forward your entire life. But if you put all your difficulties together, the most popular problem would be the lack of money. It's true, and there's no escape from that. With money you are almost free for everything. And I need this freedom for music I'm making.

I'm sure that my plan will work and there will be no delays. But even if something extraordinary will happen, I will be in touch with you and we'll figure out what to do. Of course I'm not going to spend everything right away. If you will not like my work and if you would like to have your funds back, I'll do it.


If you can't contribute

You can always help me by spreading this campaign and it will be rewarded too!

1. Shares to your friends on your social network:

  • less than 500 friends will cost $5 from perks list
  • from 500 to 1000 friends will cost $10 from perks list
  • more than 1000 friends will cost $15 from perks list
2. Shares to your communities on your social network:

  • less than 5000 subscribers will cost $5 from perks list
  • from 5000 to 10000 subscribers will cost $10 from perks list
  • more than 10000 subscribers will cost $15 from perks list
3. Bring a friend who contribute and you will receive up to $15 from perks list.
4. If you will be super active, you will receive $20 or $30 from perks list.
5. You can combine and sum previous options to get better prize.
6. Any nonmaterial help you can provide? Contact me: sv@spreadvibes.com.

Shared link should be alive until campaign deadline. If you made a share, please contact me (sv@spreadvibes.com or www.facebook.com/vladimir.spreadvibes) with link(s) your shared, screenshot(s) and your email adress.

Please use Indiegogo share tools, it's the easiest way to help!

Also, if you are late with contribution, you can donate here: spreadvibes.com. Don't forget to contact me with donation details and your email so I could give you your perk.
story_txt:
Spread Vibes is an alternative rock mixed with cool electronics music project from Russia (I hope, you are not concerned about political issues) created in 2010 and running by me (Vladimir Smirnov) only. I'm making music for 7 years already and, you know, it owned me almost instantly. I can't even imagine my life without music. As I'm doing everything by my own, it takes a huge amount of effort and time. I want to keep moving forward and improve my skills, that's why I need your help!
I don't really have a big fan base or friends and family support, so if you can, please contribute now! The future of Spread Vibes really depends on your action. 

What is One Year of Spread Vibes?
An idea is pretty simple: I need $5000 to make music whole next year without thinking about how to make money, so I'll have a plenty of time for creation process. Past couple of years I have put a lot of time and effort to earn money from the internet and I thought it will work for me and my music, but it's not. It still takes a lot of time to continuously gain necessary funds just for living. Now there is financial crisis in Russia, sales dropped and it seems, there is no escape from financial instability except crowdfunding and your help!


I need One Year of Spread Vibes campaign to bring my music on stage (to perform live) with a great success. And to do that I need money to free up my time and to make more songs, I need a band, I need a bigger community and I need more people who would like to help me! This campaign and whole next year is a real opportunity to make Spread Vibes live.


What do I need $5000 for?
$5000 is just enough to reach my needs: to rent an apartment, to eat and drink, to free up my time to make music and practice a lot. All costs for material prizes and shipping will be spent from my current budget.  

If I succeed, I'm going to release at least SIX new tracks in 2015 and 2016: one every two months. Every track will be a unique, fresh and modern piece of music. Probably more, but six for sure. Please, keep in mind, that I'm doing everything from scratch by myself and everything has to be perfect, that's why it takes so long. In 2014 I released three tracks: Believe In Me, Power and Information War. 

$5000 is a minimum. I need extra money for a better equipment (microphone, midi keyboard and better camcorder will cost about $1000) and for promotion purposes, because promotion is really a 50% of success, it's very important. So if I'll raise more than $5000, it would be great! I will definitely increase quality and improve content of my music videos.

Time = money
Alright, if I need money to free up my time, what will I spend my time for? First of all, music. From my experience, I need about 4 weeks to make perfect instrumental and write lyrics for a song. Then it goes vocal rehearsal process that takes about 2 weeks and acapella recording in one day as a result. Finally, I need 2 weeks to mix acapella with instrumental, finalize, mix and master whole track and make a graphics for a single. Everything has to be perfect and reviewed lots of times! But it does not take 24 hours per day of course. At the same time of music making I will improve my vocal skills: rehearsals in a studio 3 days a week for 3 hours. It will cost about $720. At the same time I have to do a lot of infrastructure work: renew and update spreadvibes.com, make a good Spread Vibes Shop, constantly update information on social networks and let you know what's going on, increase my fan base, work on advertising and internet radio, to monitor how's everything going and to spread the world.

What you get?
I can't give you a lot of physical stuff like merch or something (shipping also costs), but I can make something more special like giving you an experience of how music is making, to make you really a big part of something awesome and to offer a lot of personal gratitude!
I think that the most interesting perk for you and me is Collaboration! It will be a very unique experience, because you can actually be a part of my music and I can actually work directly with you!
Each physical CD you choose will be signed and shipped carefully! I'm taking full responsibility for it's content and quality, as well as for shipping issues.
I'm sure that our Skype chats will be also memorable for both us! It will go in positive way, and as a result we could know and understand each other better.
If I don't reach $5000, I'm not going to give up! Music is already a big part of my life and would definitely be. For sure, I will find time and power to keep moving, but with your help I can reach my goal way faster. Subscriptions for three or six tracks will be valid until I'll make them. As well as collaboration perks. Lifetime warranty.

Spread Vibes - Power. Release date: June 8, 2014.




Spread Vibes - Believe In Me. Release date: March 13, 2014.

story:
Hi!

I'm Satyakam Mohkamsing a Violinist trained in Indian Music and World Fusion, my goal is to help the world through art, by sharing my thought: "seeing life in terms of music" through the voice of my violin.

Born in New Dehli raised in the Netherlands, I started playing violin at age of seven in Varanasi in India under guidance of Satyaprakasa Mohanty, when I returned to the Netherlands Lenneke van Staalen became my violin teacher for many years. In 2004 I moved to Surinam where I continued my training of Indian music at the Indian Cultural Centre under V. K. Sambyal and Rita Bokil. Returning back to the Netherlands in 2006 I went to the World Music Conservatory where I studied under guidance of Lenneke van Staalen,  pt. Dhruba Ghosh and pt. Hariprasad Chaurasia. During my study at the conservatory I combined my musical education in India as well where I was privileged to learn also from dr. N. Rajam. In 2012 I graduated at the conservatory for my MA, since then I kept travelling yearly to India to expand my musical knowledge.

By the age of ten, started performing on stage. Since then I have appeared at several music venues in various countries in Europe, India and South America as solist and with several fusion ensembles.


Goal

My goal is that I can share my musical thoughts with the world how I see "life in terms of music" through the voice of my violin. This happens most of all on stage through the live performance but the album can be listened to whenever and ofcourse shared whenever.
So my goal is to record and launch my album, this goal can be accomplished with your support in many ways!

Exclusive packages


Budget

Studio time + use if recording tech: $ 5,000
Mixing: $ 1,000
Mastering: $ 250
Album art, cover, album book etc.:$500
CD producing: $ 3,000
Release: $1,500
Musicians expenses: $1,100
Indiegogo fees: $500

Totaal: $12,850


Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to support me, and we know that not everybody can become a financial backer.  If you want to help with the campaign, you can also spread the word by telling your friends, sharing on social media, coming to a live show, or just loving music!


That was all! Thank you!

story:
The Idea!

The Electric Magpie is still a young band, though we've done 2 west coast tours and released an album within our short existence. We've found the road to be a most trying endeavor and are asking, if you'd be so kind, to lend your spare pennies and quid to help this band get to the next level of success! SXSW is a breeding ground for excellent talent and record label scouts give it a close watch. This tour could pave the way toward a sustainable music career and make our sorry lives worth their weight in gold. Anything helps, so please, if nothing else, share this page with friends and loved ones and keep on groovin'! LOVE YUH BABIES!

What We Need!

On the way to and from South-By-Southwest in Austin, we will be making stops in Arizona, Nevada, and other areas of Texas. This is where touring can get costly: lodging, gas, food, as well as other unforeseen costs that are really hard on a lil' band like us and most gigs don't even begin to cover these expenses. That is why we need all of you! With your help, we can make this tour a reality. Touring as a new band can be hard and being young folks with little money makes it even harder. But with your kindness and love, we can go to SXSW for the first time and you will be able to benefit from our perks! 

Challenges!

The road is cold and long, and we have but 4 tires to take us the distance. Flash floods, dead batteries, band members smelling to high heaven, broken strings and broken dreams, promoters stiffing us and leaving town, being robbed at gunpoint in a burger joint parking lot. Also, gas prices will most likely go back up in the coming months.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't contribute your hard earned cash, come out to a show! Or tell your friends about us. Like our Facebook page or follow us on Instagram. Or think about us while tenderly making love to your sweetheart.

story:
Short Summary

I’m an Australian singer songwriter and pianist based in Los Angeles. It was always my dream to record an album in America having grown up listening to Carole King, James Taylor, Lionel Richie and the Eagles.

I first started coming to the States after meeting L.A. based singer songwriter Karen Nash. Karen's husband Bob Malone introduced me to engineer/producer Steve McDonald who invited me to co-produce my new album with him in Los Angeles and suddenly I saw my dream coming true!

I now have 12 tracks ready to mix, master, press, print and promote. I am so excited and can’t wait to get this album out to you. Not only am I extremely proud of the songs on this album, I have had the privilege of working with some of America’s most celebrated musicians including Mike Baird (Joe Cocker, Journey), Randy Ray Mitchell (Donna Summer), Bob Malone (John Fogerty) and many more.

I feel like I’ve been blessed with these enormous opportunities and now I owe it to all my supporters to Get This Baby Out!


What We Need & What You Get

Below is a breakdown of what you can expect your contributions to help make happen:

Mastering - USD $1500   Capitol Records - Los Angeles - CA
Photography - DONATED   Gotham Girl Photography - New York City/Arizona
Album Art - USD $1000   Glen Hannah - Studio Goonga - NSW - Australia
Press & Print - USD $1500
Radio - USD $4000 +   
Publicity - USD $5000 +

In return for you joining me on this journey, and apart from the list of treats for you to choose from when you contribute, you’ll be privy to exclusive behind the scenes videos and photos. Come with me to Arizona for the photo shoot, DeMarco Productions CA for mixing, Capitol Records Los Angeles for the mastering and a few fun surprises along the way.

A large portion of funds needed will go towards the promotion of the album. I want this album to gain as much exposure as possible in order for it to reach it's highest potential. However, if the entire goal is not reached, I will press 1000 copies to be sold at my live shows, on CD Baby, iTunes etc. and to be distributed by me to you! The rest can happen organically.

The Impact

The one thing that really drives me to do what I do for a living as opposed to a hobby is the number of people who come to me after a show with love in their hearts and tell me how the songs have touched them so deeply. Enough said!

Many of you have known me now for a number of years and you’ve supported me with your presence at my shows, your heartfelt comments and your hard earned dollars. The only way I know how to give back to you is through my music which makes this album THE MOST important album for me yet.

Risks & Challenges

There have been many challenges to date but this is my fourth album and it’s my absolute priority to make new music available to my fans. Challenges are a natural part of the process and I believe where there’s a will, there’s a way. The essential part (the recording) is done! The rest will be a fun journey with your help to make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don’t have a dollar to spend, you can help spread the word by sharing this link with your friends. Please feel free to try the Indiegogo share tools or just copy the URL!

story:
I am Music; Music is me!

Every living thing in this planet can be altered by music in one way or another. Music is used daily in our lives and takes 'us' the creators, musicians, songwriters etc...to keep doing it any way we can no matter what. 

My name is Bermudo and I’ve been making music and playing it for almost 30 years. I started playing bass at age 15 and from then on I knew I was going to fall in love with the instrument, it’s such an amazing feeling being the foundation and backbone of a band by keeping time and grove together. I attended Berklee Collage of Music in 1991 and graduated in 1995, it was an “eye” and “ear” opening experience...playing, jamming, writing and recording with a lot of musicians from all over the world and by 1996 I was writing songs, I picked up a guitar and haven’t put it down ever since. In 2003 I released my first album ‘EDYEPI’ (El Diablo y El Payaso Infeliz) (The Devil And The Unhappy Clown) and the first single ‘Que Bien’ got a lot of airplay in Alfa Rock 105.7 a well known rock station in Puerto Rico. 



I’ve been collaborating and working with different artist and musicians throughout the years and now it’s time to finish and release this album ‘To Kill a Fool’. I started working on it about 4 years ago, In the beginning I thought I would finish the project in a couple of years, but as we all know there are times when we have no control over things.  About a year into it I became very ill and was hospitalized for three weeks.  I finally was able to get back on my feet but realized how far back this put the project. I lost my “regular” job that would have helped fund it, and my dream was now on hold with me not knowing if it would ever emerge.  I did not have the funds and quite honestly the strength to continue.  But…. the thing about dreams is, that, they never really leave you.  Dreams stay alive in us and we can either continue fighting hard to make them come true or we can just let them go.  This album is exactly about that. It’s about embracing life and conquering fear, it’s about letting go and moving on.


All of the funds...

Will help me with the mixing and mastering of the record. This album is going to be mixed by the same engineer that did my first record (EDYEPI)  Bob St. John           bobstjohn.com (Duran Duran, Extreme, Collective Soul) I’ve known Bob for more than 15 years and he’s not only a producer and mixing engineer, he is a true fan of music and great songwriting, it’s always a pleasure and an honor to work with him. Also, part of the money is going into buying recording equipment and studio time and will also help me finish the artwork and the cover for the record which I’m working on. 


And speaking about artwork...

Another passion of mine is painting, I started taking it seriously about 10 years ago and I have been blessed to have some of my work displayed in numerous galleries in Puerto Rico, Texas, Oklahoma and Miami. You will see that some of the PERKS will not only include music downloads but you will also have the opportunity to own a signed print of the cover for 'To Kill a Fool' and an original oil painting. I've uploaded photos of all 12 pieces, just click on the Gallery tab on top of the campaign video for more info...

Circa 2007, Tony Escapa (Played drums in the album 'TKAF') and Bermudo at Butter Gallery, Miami, FL. 

THANK YOU!!!

Thank you so much for taking the time and checking my Indiegogo Campaign, remember that anything, any amount helps!!...Lets make music and share stories together…Remember to use the share tools so you can spread the word, the joy and the MUSIC!!...Share it!!...With family, with friends, with EVERYONE!!...Take care! See you soon!


Don't Blink (Short Acoustic Version)


Longing for that same old dream that'll cast a spell upon your next arrival...You can't see, but you will. 
The colors blend so perfectly they'll shape your heart and soul with great commotion, let in the motion follow me please...and you'll see.
But don't blink cause you might miss all the action...Don't blink you'll regret it everyday...Don't blink your life is going under...Don't blink you can die another day.
Just don't blink and you'll see...Don't blink and you'll see...What's real?

my first record (EDYEPI)  Bob St. John           bobstjohn.com (Duran Duran, Extreme, Collective Soul) I’ve known Bob for more than 15 years and he’s not only a
producer and mixing engineer, he is a true fan of music and great songwriting,
it’s always a pleasure and an honor to work with him. Also, part of the money
is going into buying recording equipment and studio time and will also help me finish the
artwork and the cover for the record which I’m working on. 





And speaking about artwork...


Another passion of mine is painting, I started taking it seriously about 10 years ago and I have been blessed to have some of my work displayed in numerous galleries in Puerto Rico, Texas, Oklahoma and Miami. You will see that some of the PERKS will not only include music downloads but you will also have the opportunity to own a signed print of the cover for 'To Kill a Fool' and an original oil painting. I've uploaded photos of all 12 pieces, just click on the Gallery tab on top of the campaign video for more info...


Circa 2007, Tony Escapa (Played drums in the album 'TKAF') and Bermudo at Butter Gallery, Miami, FL. 
THANK YOU!!!
Thank you so much for taking the time and checking my
Indiegogo Campaign, remember that anything, any amount helps!!...Lets make music
and share stories together…Remember to use the share tools so you can spread
the word, the joy and the MUSIC!!...Share it!!...With family, with friends, with EVERYONE!!...Take care! See you soon!



Don't Blink (Short Acoustic Version)

Longing for that same old dream that'll cast a spell upon your next arrival...You can't see, but you will. 
The colors blend so perfectly they'll shape your heart and soul with great commotion, let in the motion follow me please...and you'll see.
But don't blink cause you might miss all the action...Don't blink you'll regret it everyday...Don't blink your life is going under...Don't blink you can die another day.
Just don't blink and you'll see...Don't blink and you'll see...What's real?

story:
Welcome to my IndieGoGo campaign!

I’m a full time student, part time waiter, and a singer songwriter from Los Angeles, California. My sound has been described as indie/folk/alt rock/singer songwriter with a strong emphasis on the lyrics and vocal melodies.  A sample track can be heard here, and more demos will be released over the course of the campaign.

I have recently gathered a collection of songs that need to be recorded.  Having been written over the course of five plus years but only performed in an acoustic setting, these songs deserve to be heard in their full capacity.  And with 2015 well underway, my goals and dreams on the horizon, it’s high time I get this project started.  With your help, this year will see the completion of my first full length album, Objects In Mirror. 

This is a flexible campaign, which means that I can keep what I’ve raised even if I fall short of the target, in which case I will still do everything in my power to make the best record possible.  What is my target amount? $7,500.

32% studio time, 25% copies, merchandise, and perk fulfillment, 17% paid musicians, 13%mixing, and 13% mastering.

You tell me! Listen to this demo version of my song, Rearview, recorded at Clearlake Recording Studios, engineered by the very professional and capable hands of Eric Milos. The same hands will be at the controls for Objects in Mirror in its entirety. My vision for these songs is a grand one, and the $7500 will put this vision into fulfillment. 

Well, other than good karma and the satisfaction of having supported local music, quite a bit!  If you look to your right, you will see a very extensive list of perks that are appropriate for all donation levels.  They include stickers, digital downloads, CDs, posters, Tshirts, custom printed guitar picks, signed setlists, lyric sheets, original pastel drawings by me, a private show for which you decide the location and set list, we can co-write a song, hang out in the studio for a day, admission to the release parry, lifetime admission to all shows, a massage from my licensed massage therapist girlfriend, Christina Palmeri,  a professional in office teeth whitening by Dr. Ruiz and Associates in Burbank, and much more!

I’m not stopping with Objects in Mirror!  If I exceed my goal of $7500, the remaining funds will be put immediately towards my follow up EP, “The Tape Trilogy,” which will feature crowd favorites like “Masking Tape,” “Caution Tape,” and the soon to be heard, “Packaging Tape.”

I want to reach out to everyone who has ever known me, believed in me, or anyone out there who is willing to support the endeavors of a hard working artist.  This is your chance to help fuel the fulfillment of a lifelong dream, and my chance to give back something tangible and beautiful, showing you that your support is not in vain.  So visit my pages: Facebook, Reverbnation, YouTube, give it a listen, and please share the link to this campaign and help me bring this music to life! Thanks for watching, and thank you so much for your support!

story:
Help me spread your message to the world. 


Let me extract your knowledge into video!



I know “rock star” entrepreneurs and investors, have know-how to extract their knowledge into video




Help me create Professionally Based Video Studio:


  1. Interview entrepreneurs and startup owners
  2. Create entrepreneurship courses



Videos produced will be forwarded to the media, YouTube channels and online educational platforms.



What You Get in Return

As an incentive for your contribution, I am prepared to offer:


1. Lifetime access to the course materials I’ve already released on Udemy – the instructions that over 7,000 people have paid to receive. 

2. An illustrative pic of me interviewing some famous entrepreneur or vc.

3. My ebooks for FREE

4. I will develop a Udemy course for you

5. An interview with you!

6. Host your name, photo and website address in the Hall of Fame section of my website.

...........And more!!!


Contribution to my cause at a high level is a business venture in itself. 

  • For $500, I will develop a Udemy course for you. For example, if you own a tech startup and want to teach people how to use a piece of software you have just launched, I will create the course that educates them. This is a great way to make money teaching about whatever area of expertise you might have, or just to promote your business. If I set up your course, I can guarantee 5,000 students within 6 months. 


*see perks on the right hand side.


https://www.udemy.com/u/christospittis/

Udemy is an online education platform used by over 5 million students worldwide, with content supplied by 12,000 passionate instructors. I am a member of the Udemy Instructors Council, and I’m asking for your help today.

Udemy is an extremely helpful and powerful tool in sharing the valued secrets of business professionals. The courses I teach enable people to start making their own money. From the essential business standbys like Entrepreneurship to contemporary work channels such as YouTube, I use my degrees in Economics and Management to help ambitious content creators pave their own way.




My courses:

Accounting 101: A Beginner’s Guide to Business Accounting

Accounting 102: A Intermediate Guide to Business Accounting

Become a Global Entrepreneur: A Young Professional's Guide

Website Secrets: Get a Gorgeous Website on the Cheap

VKontakte: Beginner’s Guide to European Social Media

YouTube: Transform your channel into a money making machine


My Mission

Throughout my career, I have sought out the very best credentials, to be as qualified as I can be for the businesses who have used my services. Now that I am in the digital arena, I want to boost the power of my messages, with top-quality live-action videos that stand out above the crowd. At present, I’m using SlideShare to create my material. 

http://www.slideshare.net/cpittis


I’m raising money for professional production equipment and related expenses that will allow me to produce video – echo sound filters, cameras, microphones, Teleprompters, and much more.


BEFORE


AFTER



Join Me

It’s about growth. I wouldn’t have designed this campaign had I not been completely confident that my courses can make Udemy a better place. Helping my business grow will help yours grow. By contributing, you will learn things that help get your message out to more people, at a fraction of the cost. Harness the power of the teaching tool that has allowed me to share my expertise to thousands of viewers, and can help you do the same. Thank you for your support, and be sure to spread the word of my campaign to your friends on social media.

story:
Point Motion began in 2012 when Berklee College of Music student Kevin Andrew Clark returned from India with new spiritual and creative aspirations. As Clark puts it, "I had a vision of creating music with only the movement of my body; an entire orchestra within me. I knew it was possible and I needed to find out how."

Soon after, Clark created a "skin-and-bones" prototype using the Xbox Kinect and open source coding developed by Ryan Challinor.

With this, he was able to create a number of musical pieces which helped solidify his vision of Point Motion’s potential; so, he established Golden Wish LLC in Massachusetts.

Clark spent the next 3 years finishing his studies as a Jazz Composition/Film Scoring major, applying for Patents, and continuing to develop Point Motion (Then only known as "Puppet Master").

Upon graduating in May 2015, Clark set his focus on bringing Point Motion to people around the world. After meeting many people who would help him further his vision; Clark finally connected with Tufts graduate and "Programming Prodigy" Chris Penny.


The two saw the potential for a system that only used 2D cameras as a controller and that allows anyone to access this technology. Along with the rest of the Golden Wish team, they have since worked together in bringing Point Motion to fruition by partnering with Extreme Reality and Boston Engineering to create the first universal and completely wireless motion-control instrument.


FAQ's

1. What makes Point Motion different from the other Gesture devices out of the market?

Every gesture control device that exists continues to give the user the same games and home theater controls. However, they have yet to explore the deeper possibilities of gesture tracking technology as a creative tool. Point Motion will open a new realm for creative experiences and self expression that no device has offered before.

2. What is the difference between using Point Motion applications with a laptop camera and using them with the Point Motion Controller?

The Point Motion Controller is specifically optimized to capture the most accurate movements at the fastest rate. It is designed to recognize specific movements in any type of environment. By using the versatile Point Motion Controller, any space becomes a creative space.

3. What does the Point Motion Controller do?

The Point Motion Controller will allow you to use your Point Motion apps in the most effective manner. You can place your camera anywhere in your room and easily access any changes to your sound pallet on either your computer or phone. The controller also allows you to collaborate. One user can modify the features in the app while another is moving in front of their Point Motion Controller.

4. Can I use Point Motion along with my other music equipment?

Just like any major audio recording application, our Puppet Master app allows users to create with their own instruments and voices. Hook up your guitars, beat on your drums, or sing to your hearts content; Puppet Master will help you maximize the potential of all your instruments.

5. Will there be outside developers working on apps for Point Motion? Could I get my hands on the API?

Initially, we will be developing our apps within our own team to keep the vision focused on what our users want. Once users have had the time to understand Point Motion’s capabilities and potential, we will open the doors for them to contribute to this revolutionary instrument with user-developed apps.

6. What kind of sounds will I get in my sound library?

Our sound library consists of hundreds of beats, samples, loops, and effects for you to manipulate and activate at your will. We also include dozens of original songs from professional recording artists for you to remix and experience, and classic songs to interpret such as Bach, Beethoven and Chopin.

7. I’m an artist and want to create something completely original; can I create my own sounds or control instruments rather than pre-loaded sounds/loops?

Absolutely. While Point Motion gives amateur musicians the ability to create and alter templates from our Sound Pack, we also give the more experienced musicians the utmost control to create freely from any restriction. Set your own loops, sounds, effects, and instruments with custom motion-activated key swipes. You can choose what movements will trigger what effects, giving you complete control over your sound and movement.

8. Can I record what I create?

Of course! Although you don’t have to, we make sure you have the ability to record your creations. You can upload them directly to social media or share them with us in our community forum on our website.

9. How hard is it to use? I have no rhythm...

First off, everyone has rhythm. Point Motion conforms to any style of movement, giving "inexperienced" users the same freedom and flexibility to create music with as much or as little assistance as needed.

10. What if I want to use specific moves as commands?

You will be able to customize and designate movements to signal any chain of effects or sounds. This facilitates users with limited mobility to personalize their creation.

11. Is there a warranty?

If your Point Motion system does not work as advertised, simply send it back to us, and we will refund you for the full amount. This warranty covers all technical issues for one year, free of charge.

12. Can it track more than one person?

Each controller can track one person at a time. The compromise for this with our first release, is that if each person is using their own app or Point Motion Controller, they can collaborate musically on separate units.

13. Do I have to wear any special clothes?

The more clearly defined you are from the background, the better. Your Point Motion Controller tracks the most effectively when you are well lit and wearing solid colors. Lighting and glare also affect the ability of your Point Motion App to track your movement. For optimized performance, make sure the background behind the user is a solid color contrasting to the user's clothes.

14. How much will it cost once released?

  • The MSRP of our Point Motion Controller will be $299 + Tax
  • The MSRP of  each application will be $20 + Tax
  • The MSRP of our cellphone apps will vary (Free-$1.99)

story:
The Music

It began up in Quesnel BC with a laptop, recording  interface and a few guitars. It has continued in the Okanagan  as instruments and equipment have been added and further parts have been recorded. 

Once the 12 songs were selected  from many we have written over the years  we set out to arrange them in their unique styles. Choosing grooves, arranging parts for various instruments, digging into the character of the songs we had in front of us was all part of the pre-production process. We wanted to create a full sounding progressive album, both sophisticated and organic.

The Bed tracks were produced with minimal processing to create an "earthy" sound. Some songs were given contemporary shuffles while others, almost jazzy drum beats. There are 16th-note grooves, classic ballads and even an acoustic style waltz. Next Paul recorded electric bass to the arranged drum parts. Synthesizer appears on almost all of the tracks by way of bouncy arpeggiated sounds and wide, lush, sweeping pads. 

The project received a welcomed boost when Family members provided time at Botegga Studios in East Kelowna with engineer Jamie Prentice. This is where almost all the electric guitar tracks were recorded using a Danelectro Baritone and a Fender Jaguar each played through various tube amplifiers. Other featured acoustic guitars include a Washburn high strung  and a Gretsch resonator (dobro style) as well as my Sled Dog Slide which slid in on a few tracks. All other  acoustic parts were recorded with my trusty '57 Martin. 

All in all it has been a great leg of the journey. There are few things in life more rewarding than witnessing lyrics and notes on paper being incarnated into messages of hope and joy through the medium of music.


The Lyrics

Our songs are birthed out of personal  experiences, the experiences of others, philosophical concepts, our faith or simply stories we've created. We are avid readers and seekers of truth.

"We Are One", "Dyin' To Live", "Love of the Centuries"and "Do You Wanna Know My Name?" all deal with different scenarios we see playing out in the world today. These beautifully crafted, emotive songs, written by Debbie, are used as vehicles to deliver messages of hope and unity. "If one of us is broken, none of us are free" is such a simple truth but it needs to be said. How easily we forget about the plight of others when our own lives are so filled with blessing. We must not forget that "Everybody's searchin' for a reason to exist, everyone's got somethin' in their heart to give". These songs challenge us to use the gifts we have each been given to offer hope to a broken world.

"Secrets" and "Silver Lining" are songs Debbie wrote based on her personal faith journey. Secrets takes her back to life as a young girl living in the mountains of British Columbia. The faith of children is a wonderful, pure thing. "Gently I would hear You call me to come near You. I would gladly come to where You were". There is no hesitation, no fear, no shame. "Words of adoration were spilling like a fountain. I could almost see Your face". If we can approach God with this kind of freedom we will experience the depth of His profound love.

Many of Paul's contributions to the album are taken from a period in his life where he was wrestling with aspects of truth and faith. A line from Certainties chants "If you've got stock in certainties what a shame you did not sell while you could"  while posing the question "Is there anything left of me in the Kingdom of Heaven?" Nothin' But You chronicles the journey back to faith and devotion. "Just to walk in quiet meditation while Babylon marches by. To see beyond this illusion and cling to the One who is the Life."

"Waiting No More" is a reggae/folk tune celebrating God's abiding presence. "Shrouded In Mystery" and "Too Much To Ignore" deal with mis-understandings and conflict in human relationships. In the final song, "In Our Way" a choice is made to embrace the flow of inspiration whether it stems from joy or sorrow. 

The Seburns YOUTUBE channel


The Exchange

By getting involved you will buy us some time to really focus our energy on cutting vocals which tell the story well, capturing the unique soul of each song. Since we have been investing in equipment, instruments and software to do what we do, your contribution will help us apply ourselves to the task at hand in a tangible way. 

Your partnership will also help with mixing and mastering, photography and graphic design as well as producing the final product. You of course can choose from the wide range of perks we've made available to you in this campaign. By getting involved now we can develop a relationship and stay connected as we take this music on the road in the fall of 2016.


The Funds


Recording lead and harmony vocals - $2,500

Mixing and Mastering - $1,800

Photography - $500

Graphic Design - $1,200

Website Design - $1,500

Duplication 1000 Copies - $1,500


The Method

For several years now Paul has been exploring some alternative tunings to the standard A=440 Equal Temperament grid of modern music. The entire project has been produced using a lower reference pitch for "A" A=432. In addition the guitars and synths are tuned as close as possible to "Just" which means the intervals are more settled and really "sing". These tuning techniques combined make for a warm smooth and captivating sound in the mixes.

Songwriting is a lifelong passion for us and we plan to launch into a season of live performances to grow and expand our audience, Completing this album is an important step on this exciting journey to share a message of hope in these troubled times.

Even if you can't contribute financially it doesn't mean you can't help! You can help by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Direct friends to our Facebook Page, our YouTube channel and of course this Indiegogo Campaign page. Use the "BACK IT" tools at the top of this page.

A big THANK YOU for your time and consideration!
story_txt:
The Music 
It began up in Quesnel BC with a laptop, recording  interface and a few guitars. It has continued in the Okanagan  as instruments and equipment have been added and further parts have been recorded. 
Once the 12 songs were selected  from many we have written over the years  we set out to arrange them in their unique styles. Choosing grooves, arranging parts for various instruments, digging into the character of the songs we had in front of us was all part of the pre-production process. We wanted to create a full sounding progressive album, both sophisticated and organic.
The Bed tracks were produced with minimal processing to create an "earthy" sound. Some songs were given contemporary shuffles while others, almost jazzy drum beats. There are 16th-note grooves, classic ballads and even an acoustic style waltz. Next Paul recorded electric bass to the arranged drum parts. Synthesizer appears on almost all of the tracks by way of bouncy arpeggiated sounds and wide, lush, sweeping pads. 
The project received a welcomed boost when Family members provided time at Botegga Studios in East Kelowna with engineer Jamie Prentice. This is where almost all the electric guitar tracks were recorded using a Danelectro Baritone and a Fender Jaguar each played through various tube amplifiers. Other featured acoustic guitars include a Washburn high strung  and a Gretsch resonator (dobro style) as well as my Sled Dog Slide which slid in on a few tracks. All other  acoustic parts were recorded with my trusty '57 Martin. 
All in all it has been a great leg of the journey. There are few things in life more rewarding than witnessing lyrics and notes on paper being incarnated into messages of hope and joy through the medium of music.


The Lyrics
Our songs are birthed out of personal  experiences, the experiences of others, philosophical concepts, our faith or simply stories we've created. We are avid readers and seekers of truth.
"We Are One", "Dyin' To Live", "Love of the Centuries"and "Do You Wanna Know My Name?" all deal with different scenarios we see playing out in the world today. These beautifully crafted, emotive songs, written by Debbie, are used as vehicles to deliver messages of hope and unity. "If one of us is broken, none of us are free" is such a simple truth but it needs to be said. How easily we forget about the plight of others when our own lives are so filled with blessing. We must not forget that "Everybody's searchin' for a reason to exist, everyone's got somethin' in their heart to give". These songs challenge us to use the gifts we have each been given to offer hope to a broken world.
"Secrets" and "Silver Lining" are songs Debbie wrote based on her personal faith journey. Secrets takes her back to life as a young girl living in the mountains of British Columbia. The faith of children is a wonderful, pure thing. "Gently I would hear You call me to come near You. I would gladly come to where You were". There is no hesitation, no fear, no shame. "Words of adoration were spilling like a fountain. I could almost see Your face". If we can approach God with this kind of freedom we will experience the depth of His profound love.
Many of Paul's contributions to the album are taken from a period in his life where he was wrestling with aspects of truth and faith. A line from Certainties chants "If you've got stock in certainties what a shame you did not sell while you could"  while posing the question "Is there anything left of me in the Kingdom of Heaven?" Nothin' But You chronicles the journey back to faith and devotion. "Just to walk in quiet meditation while Babylon marches by. To see beyond this illusion and cling to the One who is the Life."
"Waiting No More" is a reggae/folk tune celebrating God's abiding presence. "Shrouded In Mystery" and "Too Much To Ignore" deal with mis-understandings and conflict in human relationships. In the final song, "In Our Way" a choice is made to embrace the flow of inspiration whether it stems from joy or sorrow. 
The Seburns YOUTUBE channel
   The Exchange By getting involved you will buy us some time to really focus our energy on cutting vocals which tell the story well, capturing the unique soul of each song. Since we have been investing in equipment, instruments and software to do what we do, your contribution will help us apply ourselves to the task at hand in a tangible way. 
Your partnership will also help with mixing and mastering, photography and graphic design as well as producing the final product. You of course can choose from the wide range of perks we've made available to you in this campaign. By getting involved now we can develop a relationship and stay connected as we take this music on the road in the fall of 2016.


The Funds

Recording lead and harmony vocals - $2,500
Mixing and Mastering - $1,800
Photography - $500
Graphic Design - $1,200
Website Design - $1,500
Duplication 1000 Copies - $1,500

    The Method For several years now Paul has been exploring some alternative tunings to the standard A=440 Equal Temperament grid of modern music. The entire project has been produced using a lower reference pitch for "A" A=432. In addition the guitars and synths are tuned as close as possible to "Just" which means the intervals are more settled and really "sing". These tuning techniques combined make for a warm smooth and captivating sound in the mixes.
Songwriting is a lifelong passion for us and we plan to launch into a season of live performances to grow and expand our audience, Completing this album is an important step on this exciting journey to share a message of hope in these troubled times.
Even if you can't contribute financially it doesn't mean you can't help! You can help by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Direct friends to our Facebook Page, our YouTube channel and of course this Indiegogo Campaign page. Use the "BACK IT" tools at the top of this page.
A big THANK YOU for your time and consideration!

story:
Hi! I'm Maryanna.

You may remember me from my debut LP "Landfill" in 2010, or maybe you heard me on MTV's "The Real World" in 2011. Perhaps you saw me on tour or heard me on NPR in 2012, or maybe we've been friends since elementary school. Either way, a lot of life has happened since then, and a lot of music has been written about it! It's time to release some of my new songs into the world, and I'm starting with this EP.

New recordings are difficult to get started and even more difficult to fund when you're an independent artist. I've waited a long time to record again because I refuse to release anything I can't be wholeheartedly proud of, and creating music I can take pride in requires time, trust, and money. Time and trust I've got, but money is hard! This project has been in the planning stages for a year, and it has already been postponed once because of a severe concussion that recently had me out of work and out of income for 2 months. 

So here's where you come in! The beautiful thing about making music in the "crowdfunding age" is that, with the help of fans and friends like you, artists like me can not only record, but also own creative control of the music that has been bouncing around in our heads and hearts for years. I will be making this EP with my good friend and producer/arranger/composer Jared Saltiel in Brooklyn, NY. We have chosen 6 of my songs that we're both excited about, and together we will share the responsibility of bringing our entire creative vision for those songs to fruition, from the first scratch to the final mix. Having a hand in every step of the process is a privilege I do not take lightly. 

Costs I am hoping to cover with this campaign include: 
1. Recording studio time
2. Hiring recording engineers and musicians for said studio time
3. Mixing and Mastering for each track
4. Hiring a visual/graphic artist to create album artwork
5. Internet publishing and copyright costs

These numbers add up. Honestly, even hitting that $5,000 goal will not cover the costs of the project from start to finish. But every dollar helps, and I will be immensely grateful for each contribution that helps bring this music to life.

NOW! Let's talk about some things YOU can expect to get from ME! Every single backer will receive exclusive photo, email, and video updates of the creative process. Backers who contribute $5 or more will receive a digital download of the album weeks (or maybe months) before the rest of the world can access it. Some backers will receive hand-written postcards or notes in the mail, a signed hard copy of my previous record, or stickers and other exclusive merch. Zealous backers can receive their own personal original song written by yours truly, and REALLY overzealous backers will be eligible to receive a private concert from me and some friends in an (appropriate) location of their choosing. 

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help by sharing links and spreading the word to your friends on the internet and beyond. I cannot stress enough how grateful I am to everyone who has shown interest in my music and in this campaign. Especially if you've read this far. Seriously. You deserve a medal. 

THANK YOU. I'd be nothing without you!

story:
We are

3 friends, passionate music lovers, dj's. Collecting and playing records for 3 years, entertaining the people of the underground. We are a small and independent Hungarian crew, not enjoying the support of "the big players", but rather going on our own way. Which is sometimes much more difficult, when we are working an everyday job or studying in college. We are still going, so that we are having a monthly live audio stream with some of hungarian underground dj's as a guest and regular gigs as well. If we can, we are always looking for collaborations with other dj's, mc's and vj's to stay fresh, and bring people together for a good dance.

Sound to the SYSTEM promo mix part 1 by b.kov
Promo mix series part 2 by Bazzs
Mix series part 3. by Leap

We would love to have

A proper gear to play on, so we can spend more on new music supporting the artists. We would build a custom soundsystem from individual parts.

  • We would buy mostly second hand stuff while selling out our current things
  • 2 pieces of 18" loudspeakers, for the 40-100Hz area, fitted in Hog Scoop enclosures, to make your chest rattling
  • An amplifier to drive them
  • Selling our mini-scoops, taking the drivers from them and build new ones (hd 15's which are optimised for them, 100-200Hz), to get dynamic kick drums. We could still use them with the same amp.
  • Buy 2 midtop speakers to make sure all the female vocals are nice and the percussions and hats are crispy
  • The system requires an active crossover to separate the lows and highs
  • Selling our blunt midtop pair will cover the cables and the rack for the amps.    

    Listen to Leap works here 



    If You help us You really


    • are helping people to get to know a part of soundsytem culture
    • are helping a lot of talented musician, dj,  mc, or other crew, to perform at a gig
    • are helping the underground culture to stay true, colourful, and original
    • are making the audience's musical experience much much better
    • are helping our dream to come true


    We are not insatiable, and not perfect


    We know our music is not for everyone, and some of you just simply dont like it. No problem at all, we are all different, but we still truly believe music brings people together.  

    • In case we got significantly less than the goal to get our plans covered, we have a priority: we would only buy midtops and an amplifier for them, while selling the actual ones
    • In case we just got less, selling the now used bassbins and amp, building new enclosures with used speakers, maybe new (but used) midtops and an amp for that as well

    Whether our music is for you or not

    Show some love tough and tell your friends about our campaign, maybe they would be interested and up to help. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • If you cant afford, but would love to help, spread the word, and feel our music :)

story:
KNOW LOVE ALBUM


  • WHO AM I
  I am Jordan Williams aka Jordan Gonzaga (formerly known Kid Mufasa). Im a HIPHOP/RNB artist, but I am passionate about all music and art. I grew up playing in various Pop Punk and Metal bands.  Couch Surfing was never the ideal way of living, nor is being in and out of the streets, but I chose to move out of my small town in southern Alberta at 16 years old to Calgary, Alberta. I had roommates to learn from, and took what ever piece of mind I could comprehend from society at that point, I've watched a lot pass me by, from love, home, comfortability to the dark sides of poverty, in turn facing homelessness along with emotional baggage, holding on to very little but the music. The impact that this whole 10 year experience has lead me to is further questions of Passion, love, unity, and self understanding, through exploring creative arts and "right-brained" outlets. 

  • IMPORTANCE
 Love, Unity, and Self Exploration. The album "KNOW LOVE" will be expressing these four ideas into tangible, relevant, and real concepts that can make such expressions a "Hot Topic", more so in HipHop and Rap music as its a very competitive lifestyle/genre. It is very important to me to express to as wide of an audience as possible that positive expression, unity/collaboration with good intentions is ok to.

  • CONTRIBUTORS
 As all of this is nearly impossible without the help from contributors and donations, the importance of you is as important as the music. Your investments will help start a cycle of giving back to the community on a musical and artistic level, further inspiring the movement.


THE BUSINESSY PART...

This is my least favorite discussion, but is essential to making this happen. Two things I need from you. 

  1. SUPPORT SUPPORT SUPPORT
  2. $7000 CAD (GOAL)
Your support will help me make a positive wave of change in a mainstream sub culture that promotes misogynists and chauvinism, guiding our views on each other and encouraging toxic behaviors and habits. By making that wave we can essentially be the tide that cleans up the mess that has been made media wise.
The $7000 dollars will go towards the production and recording of the album, along with a music video for the single #NOSTRESS. The album will have 8 tracks and include features from guest artists. Here is a precise list of expenses involved in this project.
  • Recording - This will involve Studio Time and Engineer
  • Production- Work with the producer (Beat Making/Artist Building)
  • Collaborations- Artists such as Christian Hudson ( 2015 Stampede Talent Search Grand Prize Winner) Mariya Stokes (International Award Winning Modern Country Song Writer)
  • Distribution- Online distribution exp. Download Cards registration fees etc.
If the goal of $7000 CAD is not reached within the 60 days limit, whatever amount that is raised will still be put towards the recording and production of my album "Know Love".

THE IMPACT

"The media's the most powerful entity on earth. They have the power to make the innocent guilty and to make the guilty innocent, and that's power. Because they control the minds of the masses."
Malcolm X
Self expression, Self talk, and Self worth, might seem selfish, but while growing as an artist I have become AWARE of these few things and have realized the impact that it has on ourselves, the world, and communities around us. Youth, Adults, we have all felt powerless some more often than others, some still do. I think the impact of awareness of self belief, reducing  stress, and learning to accept yourself can be a ground breaking idea to promote, The youth is the future, and our future is being pumped full of un mindful "fast food media", we can create a movement and bring real food for thought back to the table! 
#VersesVsHomlessness
I have been blessed enough to be part of Shelter From The Storm a project put on by The Calgary Drop In and Rehab Center, a collaboration project involving clients, staff members, and non resident volunteers. This was a six month song writing project based around the power of collaboration, the successes of this really showed that it is possible to move mountains when people are in sync and in harmony, in tune with eachother, despite ups and downs, Everything can be worked out. Recording the first album titled "Shelter From The Storm" and the second "Verses Vs. Homelessness" has inspired me to share this collaborative experience and story with other communities, in hopes everyone will experience this type of unity.

ROADBLOCKS & FENCES


Every path we take there is always a fence or two, or three, or so on roadblocks are the same. Improvising is never prepared for but it is something that you can get the hang of. 
I want to say that it is going to be smooth sailing, but I do face housing issues on occasion, I can lose balance in where my focus is and sometimes lose jobs, in turn leaves it a struggle to pay bills. I feel like when I raise enough money for my album, I will be able to minimize some of these roadblocks that slow down arrival to the destination. Which will be a public figure/ role model.

                 Like

                                     Share

        TELL 

                          YOUR 

             FRIENDS

Everyone comes from different circumstances, and that is totally cool, but if you're feeling the "KNOW LOVE" not only album but "MOVEMENT" as well PLEEEEEEASE follow me and share your views on tips on self discovery and learning, cause learning together makes sense. Thats what we are here for, right?
Facebook: Jordan Gonzaga (@mrjordangonzaga)
Instagram: @mrjordangonzaga

Thank You

Jordan Williams
