story:
Dear Friends and Friends we’ve yet to meet,

For the last 14 years we have traveled over 650,000 miles of North American highways performing original compositions under the name Tangled Blue. We’ve traveled coast to coast many times and two weeks ago we moved to New Orleans for this next song writing project. We are also self described “Church Nerds” and “Liturgi-geeks”. We love church music! It is the rhyme and rhythm of our faith journeys, and writing a song that is both musically memorable and theologically deep is hard work. In the NOLA Liturgy Project we are striving to create tunes that are that good balance of words, story, and melody based in a specific time, place, and culture with the theological depth and musical energy to transcend that time and place. 

We’re not doing this work alone. We have a number of partners in and around New Orleans. St. Paul Lutheran Church and School in the Marigny, Gethsemane Lutheran Church in Chalmette, LINCNewOrleans, Urban Impact New Orleans, The Thrivent Financial representative Terry King, and a number of individual New Orleanians have all played a role in bringing us this far have already pledged over $13,000 toward this project. We need your help to bring the project home. 

Your pledge to support the NOLA liturgy project will help us pay local musicians for their contributions, record and duplicate the master recording, and prepare the musical scores for congregations to utilize. Your financial gift will also allow us to commit more time in the city over the next six months so we can absorb the sounds of New Orleans and partner with the community to create a unique and authentic work of art. 

Please join us in this important work! Look to the right for the perks we can offer as a way to say thank you for your patronage and support...

Our overall fundraising goal for the NOLA Liturgy Project is $28,000. We’ve already raised $13,000 through our partners in New Orleans, and we expect to have a few more partners join us in the coming months. Not all of the remaining $15,000 needs to come through this Indiegogo campaign, but we certainly won’t turn any support away! Should we meet our fundraising goals here is how these funds will be utilized:

$10,000 for project development, meeting, creating, and rehearsing music that fits this community!

$10,000 creation of the recording and paying NOLA musicians involved in the recording. 

$2,000 for creating unique experiences in the NOLA community that feature these new compositions.

$2,000 duplication of the recording to get the work into ears of folks across the globe.

$2,000 creation of piano, lead, and congregational scores.

$1,000 creation of a new web site for Tangled Blue’s liturgical settings

$1,000 promotion of the work via online, social, and traditional media.

Thanks for your time, support, and consideration! We know that we have a lot of listeners and friends who may not be able to make a financial contribution to this project. We’d still like you to be part of the process. Go to http://tangledblue.com/nola-liturgy-project/ to sign up for our liturgy newsletter to get all of the news, videos, and free music streams we post online. 

Again, Thanks!

Under the Mercy,

Aimée & Joel

----------------------------------------

March 31 Update: 

With the encouragement of a couple new potential partner congregations, we've decided to extend the campaign for a few days. Thanks to everyone who's made a pledge or shared our story in their community! Here are a few more videos to share from Mardi Gras and Holy Week...

Sanctus: This Unending Song


The Lord's Prayer


-------------------------------------------

Feb. 29 Update: Here's a video shot from the balcony of our Central City apartment (provided by our partners: Urban Impact through LINCNewOrleans) and featuring a tune that will be on the "Two Or More" recording. Though this song isn't part of the NOLA Liturgy Project, you can get the "Two Or More" recording as a perk... Enjoy!


------------------------------------------
March 17 Update: Here's a video shot from Algiers Point on the Westbank of the Mississippi. We are almost half funded! Thanks for bringing us this far! There's more to come...

-------------------------------------------

March 23 Update: Here is another video I created over the last few weeks featuring scenes from New Orleans. 

The full story on this new "Lamb of God" and a downloadable lead sheet can be found at http://tangledblue.com/2016/03/lamb-of-god/

Thanks for listening! Please share them in your community!
story_txt:
Dear Friends and Friends we’ve yet to meet,
For the last 14 years we have traveled over 650,000 miles of North American highways performing original compositions under the name Tangled Blue. We’ve traveled coast to coast many times and two weeks ago we moved to New Orleans for this next song writing project. We are also self described “Church Nerds” and “Liturgi-geeks”. We love church music! It is the rhyme and rhythm of our faith journeys, and writing a song that is both musically memorable and theologically deep is hard work. In the NOLA Liturgy Project we are striving to create tunes that are that good balance of words, story, and melody based in a specific time, place, and culture with the theological depth and musical energy to transcend that time and place. 
We’re not doing this work alone. We have a number of partners in and around New Orleans. St. Paul Lutheran Church and School in the Marigny, Gethsemane Lutheran Church in Chalmette, LINCNewOrleans, Urban Impact New Orleans, The Thrivent Financial representative Terry King, and a number of individual New Orleanians have all played a role in bringing us this far have already pledged over $13,000 toward this project. We need your help to bring the project home. 
Your pledge to support the NOLA liturgy project will help us pay local musicians for their contributions, record and duplicate the master recording, and prepare the musical scores for congregations to utilize. Your financial gift will also allow us to commit more time in the city over the next six months so we can absorb the sounds of New Orleans and partner with the community to create a unique and authentic work of art. 
Please join us in this important work! Look to the right for the perks we can offer as a way to say thank you for your patronage and support...
Our overall fundraising goal for the NOLA Liturgy Project is $28,000. We’ve already raised $13,000 through our partners in New Orleans, and we expect to have a few more partners join us in the coming months. Not all of the remaining $15,000 needs to come through this Indiegogo campaign, but we certainly won’t turn any support away! Should we meet our fundraising goals here is how these funds will be utilized:
$10,000 for project development, meeting, creating, and rehearsing music that fits this community!
$10,000 creation of the recording and paying NOLA musicians involved in the recording. 
$2,000 for creating unique experiences in the NOLA community that feature these new compositions.
$2,000 duplication of the recording to get the work into ears of folks across the globe.
$2,000 creation of piano, lead, and congregational scores.
$1,000 creation of a new web site for Tangled Blue’s liturgical settings
$1,000 promotion of the work via online, social, and traditional media.
Thanks for your time, support, and consideration! We know that we have a lot of listeners and friends who may not be able to make a financial contribution to this project. We’d still like you to be part of the process. Go to http://tangledblue.com/nola-liturgy-project/ to sign up for our liturgy newsletter to get all of the news, videos, and free music streams we post online. 
Again, Thanks!
Under the Mercy,
Aimée & Joel----------------------------------------March 31 Update: With the encouragement of a couple new potential partner congregations, we've decided to extend the campaign for a few days. Thanks to everyone who's made a pledge or shared our story in their community! Here are a few more videos to share from Mardi Gras and Holy Week...Sanctus: This Unending SongThe Lord's Prayer-------------------------------------------Feb. 29 Update: Here's a video shot from the balcony of our Central City apartment (provided by our partners: Urban Impact through LINCNewOrleans) and featuring a tune that will be on the "Two Or More" recording. Though this song isn't part of the NOLA Liturgy Project, you can get the "Two Or More" recording as a perk... Enjoy!------------------------------------------March 17 Update: Here's a video shot from Algiers Point on the Westbank of the Mississippi. We are almost half funded! Thanks for bringing us this far! There's more to come...

-------------------------------------------
March 23 Update: Here is another video I created over the last few weeks featuring scenes from New Orleans. 

The full story on this new "Lamb of God" and a downloadable lead sheet can be found at http://tangledblue.com/2016/03/lamb-of-god/
Thanks for listening! Please share them in your community!

story:
"Happily Neverafter" US Tour Campaign

On tour in support of their new release "Happily Neverafter" on Famous Records Global/ Pavement / Sony Red, be a part of the "Evil Across America" US Tour Campaign. MURDER FM have criss crossed the US on the REVOLVER Magazine "South for the Win-Tour"Co-Headline dates with (HED)PE & ALIEN ANT FARM in December, Texas Headline Dates in January and now heading out on the road in February with DROWNING POOL, Audiotopsy (x-Mudvayne) & Violent New Breed (x-Escape The Fate)

With DROWNING POOL, Audiotopsy, Violent New Breed

2/18 Golden, CO @ Buffalo Rose                                                                                             2/19 Salt Lake City,UT @ The Royal Bar                                                                               2/20 Idaho Falls,ID @ Hitt Event Center                                                                               2/22 Chico,CA @ Lost On Main                                                                                                2/23 Los Angeles,CA @ Los Globos                                                                                       2/24 Mesa,AZ @ Club Red                                                                                                         2/25 Lubbock,TX @ Jake's Backroom                                                                                   2/26 San Antonio,TX @ Fitzgeralds

VIP Perks for those that join the Evil Campaign

ONLY 10 Days to help join the evil and be a part of the "Evil Across America" US Tour campaign and help it be the best in can be! Tour Kickoff, THURSDAY 2/18 in Denver, Co! 

Receive fan perks such as an AUTOGRAPHED Guitar from Murder FM's 2015 Mainstage "Dirtfest" performance, Pre-Show "Private Acoustic Performances" for you and your friends on any of the "Evil Across America" US Tourdates, Autographed T-Shirts, Dinner with the band, Guitar lessons with Vocalist/Guitarist Norman Matthew, a private photo shoot by Guitarist Matt X3r0 & X3r0 Class Photography, Autographed Drumsticks, Heads and/or cymbals from Jason "Shakes" West" or even a Skype call and hair tips with bassist J6!

If the band isn't coming to your town, you can still donate to the campaign and help bring the evil to YOUR city!

Other Ways You Can Help

Finances aren't the only way to help. Spreading the word via social media, emails, texts, phone calls to friends and creating awareness in any way possible is amazingly helpful to the success of the band. We have made it this far thanks to YOU and every time Murder FM wins, YOU win, because in the end, it's all about the blood, sweat & tears we leave onstage and the impact we can make on peoples live, one at a time. Rock isn't dead! \m/

story:
Hi there! I'm James. Let me tell you about a little problem we have... Could it be a blessing in disguise?

Short Summary

Having built a professional recording and rehearsal studio from scratch, beginning with what was just an empty barn and building up an incredible reputation, bringing clients from far and wide, some even from abroad, we faced the pain of having to knock down our beloved studio to make way for a luxury housing development. 

Now, the old studio has been demolished and we have started building again from scratch in a new location. Always trying to look on the bright side, this gives us the opportunity to build an even better recording and rehearsal facility for bands and soloists in the local area.

Both myself and my business partner are working 7 days a week, 15+ hours per day on the project, sharing our never-ending passion for both recorded and live music with bands, solo artists, children, schools and many more people who we believe benefit from having our professional services in the area. We have a large number of repeat clients, who insist on recording only with us, due to our quality promise. We listen to the music and make sure it sounds amazing, not limiting it to the average preset-laden mix you find so commonly nowadays.

Without our studio, there will be nowhere of such a professional quality for local bands and artists to use - we've had to use a lot of competing 'professional' facilities ourselves over the past few months and most have left us sorely disappointed. People are already telling us about how they miss using us, including Rock School - a charity run by volunteers which we usually accommodate during the summer to teach the students about recording, mixing and mastering. We need to get up and running again as soon as possible. 

What We Need

To build the studio on an incredibly tight budget, we are doing all construction work ourselves. There are things that have to be done by qualified professionals for safety reasons, and everything has to exceed building regulations, but everything we can do ourselves we are. We do not have the hundreds of thousands of pounds required to rebuild a studio to the same quality that we achieved with our old studio using a specialist company, and we don't have the tens of thousands required to use regular builders. 

To combat this financial shortcoming, my business partner and I have learnt and taken on the roles of architect, acoustician, designer and builder, carpet fitter, carpenter, plaster, joiner. You name it, we've done it. All construction work so far has been carried out by us, working day and night, and the fruits of our labour have paid off as we opened our first rehearsal room at the beginning of August, to rave reviews from all that have used it. We even had to design and build the studio doors as off-the-shelf doors just don't meet up to the acoustical or quality standards we are aiming to achieve. But the quality of the new room is second to none, and we are confident that the only point on which some of the high end London facilities would beat us would be on the size. 

To afford to build the rest of the studio, we need at least £10,000, enabling us to buy the materials needed to construct the rooms and appropriate acoustic treatments. None of this will be spent on labour costs (due to self-building) and our equipment such as the mixing desk and monitors will be transferred from the old studio. £10,000 is a very tight squeeze for the quality of work we are trying to achieve, but we KNOW we can make it work. If we can build the control room using this, we can start to get some money in from recordings, mixing sessions and more, therefore giving us the money to build the next room.

What Happens If We Don't Get Enough Money

If we unfortunately do not receive the full £10,000 we need to complete the remaining two thirds is the studio, we face a very long and slow process to complete it. We're talking at least a year for the control room and another for the second rehearsal room. Currently we are working as hard as we can externally  to raise funds - doing everything from PA hire, DJ-ing, gigs, tour management and even car boot sales - to survive and raise as much income as we can (we did say the work never stops!), but there is only so long you can survive putting pretty much everything you earn into a fledgling business, and we desperately need to be recording by the end of the year to make it work.

The Impact

Having the money to build our studio again means we can continue to provide our unparalleled quality of music production for the foreseeable future. 

It will save us one to two year's building time. This is because by building the studio using only our own funds, which are quickly diminishing, we have to rely on what little income we can gather through other work. That massively impacts the time we can put into the build. If we had the full sum of money we require, we can build the studio in a much shorter time scale - getting us up and running, and bringing the music back to our customers.

Our old studio had a reputation for producing only the best, at a price the everyday punter could afford. We know that when this new studio is completed, we can only go bigger and better, bringing in more of the best music clients and creating what they want to hear, and all whilst keeping the same value for money we offered in our old location.

Such a devotion to the music industry is what makes the studio work. All day, every day. Bringing quality to today's music world.

Risks & Challenges

Of course there would never be any sort of business that runs without risk. Risk is what keeps us pumping with the adrenaline we need to carry on!

But on a serious note, running a business such as ours is never predictable and one day we may have bookings from 7am until midnight, other days we may be completely empty.

We can't tell how the future will go, but we know that with the vision we have for the future of our business and with the determination we have, and with our track record, our chances of success are good.

There is always the risk of running out of money before you are up and running sufficiently to break even. This is the situation we are in now. Our rent goes out every month, electricity bills, business rates and much more, and our small pool of money is slowly shrinking. This is the reason for creating a crowdfunding campaign, in the hope that you can help us to achieve our goal and that, by return, we can help you to achieve your musical goals. 

With the £10,000 we need, we will be able to open the studio with enough money to do it properly and on schedule.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to our cause, you can still help! Publicity is key when trying to do something like this, and with the rise of social media, it's now easier than ever.

Why don't you share it on Facebook, Tweet it, Instagram, YouTube, you name it! Every time you post something about our cause, such as sharing this crowdfunding campaign online to your friends and family, it helps us to become more known to the community and gives us a better chance at success.

There's even built-in share tools on Indiegogo.com so you don't have to waste any time messing around with apps and emails!

 

Conclusion

So if you can help us and you feel like making a difference to two incredibly dedicated, customer focused and music-obsessed business owners, and you feel you can help us turn what was originally a bad situation into an unbeatable facility for anyone and everyone to use and you feel like joining the Cosmic Audio family, please please donate to us and we promise to you that it will be worth your investment. We have kept our business targets realistic, we have affordable premises, and we have that vision and plan. But the rising cost of materials, and the huge and unexpected cost of moving from our old premises has left us only just enough money to complete our first rehearsal room. And income from one room won't enable us to break even - so we need to get the rest of the studio built as quickly as possible in order to survive. With YOUR help and YOUR backing we can do it. And we promise you the finest, most professional and best value facility for miles and miles around. An architect friend once told us "It doesn't cost any more to design and build a superb facility than it does an awful one, it's all about the vision you have". And our vision is the very best, at a price you can afford. We've already surpassed our expectations with the first room. We know we can carry that through to the rest of the facility. But we can do it faster, more effectively, and be open and of service to the local music community much quicker with your help than we can without. 

Thank You

James

story:
Hello! Thank you for joining us!

We are on the verge of launching our first EP in preparation for our independently, and crowd-funded, cross country van tour scheduled this summer! We'll be performing alongside multi-talented solo artist Emily Clibourn, with guest performances by singer/songwriter Adina Abrahami. We are a Los Angeles based eclectic Neo-Jazz trio asking you to join us as we make our national debut.

Silverfox Ln. is comprised of Donnie “The Coyote” Gee (keys, sax, vocals), Cameron “The Time Machine” Earle (drums), Aaron “We’re Still In The Process of Finding Him a Cool Name” Williams (bass), and YOU!!! We have connected with you along the path of life at some point and hopefully, we've left a sincere and good impression upon you. We hope you feel called to support the completion of our debut EP and musical trek across the country this summer!!! 



About The Silverfox Ln. EP

HEAR A SAMPLE OF OUR MUSIC

Our debut, self-titled EP will contain a diversity of musical genres. We are using our main instruments; Keyboard/Synth, Bass Guitar, and Drums to solidify the core structure, but we will also be layering in guitar, percussion, horns, and a variety of orchestral instruments. Our vision for the project is to weave together a plethora of stylistic sounds using jazz music as the heart of the foundation. 

Your donations will go toward our rental of the recording studio and payment for the talented team of engineers we will be working with. In addition to studio-time, your much appreciated contributions will help to pay for our lodging and transportation on our conjoined “JADACE South” tour 2016. Thank you for helping us get closer to reaching our goals!


About The Tour

The JADACE South Tour 2016 will be kicking off on August 9th, 2016 in Chesterfield, Virginia at Henrico Convention Center, where Silverfox Ln., Emiliy Clibourn, and Adina Abrahami are set to open for legendary recording artists Keith Anderson and Cloud 9 . The tour will continue as all three acts will be making their way up the East Coast to New York City, then back down South hitting some of the biggest hotspot music cities in the country, including Durham, New Orleans, Austin, and Phoenix. After a month of extensive travel and performing, the excursion will conclude in the artists’ hometown of Los Angeles.

Our goals are simple: share our passion for performing music with others, and  to share this experience with audiences from different cities and states and all of our supporters back home. Music has no boundaries or rules and we hope this tour will connect us to people and places we may have never known to have existed, had we not stepped out of our daily routines.  This will be all artists' of JADACE South Tour first time touring! This tour will be one of the most memorable adventures of our lifetime. Thank you for supporting our dreams and making it possible. 


Members of Jadace





MORE ABOUT ADINA ABRAHAMI

MORE ABOUT EMILY CLIBOURN


What we are asking for & what you will receive:

By pledging to support our campaign, you are joining the JADACE team! Literally, you will receive "Band shout outs" and updates from the road. We have joined our various skills together as musicians, artists and professionals to come up ways we can thank you for your acts of generosity and support! A list of "perks" with certain donation amounts are listed under "Perks". 

Thankfully, a portion of the tour's costs have been financed by some amazing contributors.  This campaign is meant to raise funds to cover all supplementary expenses listed below.

  • Public relations firm ($2500) This will cover 2 months of promotion for the tour. Promotion will help build audiences through various forms of media.
  • Silverfox Ln.'s EP production and completion  ($4000) 
  • Lodging & Travel expenses ($3000)
  • Total  Amount- $9,500

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There are so many way you can help. One HUGE way of helping us out is the oldest and most successful means known; (WOM) Word of Mouth. This campaign is dependent on the word of mouth of all of our supporters. In a world of social media, sharing is truly caring. 
  • We will be in many different states (check our tour schedule) so if you know people in those towns or cities, ask them to come to our shows, we love meeting new people and hope to create new friends and fans. 
  • Let us know what songs you love; what are your favorite, who would you like to meet when we come home, stay connected to us. 
  • Believe it or not, buying just one song on iTunes helps as well as any monetary contribution to our campaign. We understand that not everyone has the means to support an entire tour but we still want you to enjoy our heart & soul through our music. 

Your Support...

By pledging to this project, you become a part of the dream, and will receive updates, videos, exclusives, digital downloads and more!

We are grateful for your support, and are so excited to see what lies ahead! Thank you! Much love!

JADACE

Thank you for helping us get closer to reaching our goals!
About The Tour
The JADACE South Tour 2016 will be kicking off on August 9th, 2016 in Chesterfield, Virginia at Henrico Convention Center, where Silverfox Ln., Emiliy Clibourn, and Adina Abrahami are set to open for legendary recording artists Keith Anderson and Cloud 9 . The tour will continue as all three acts will be making their way up the East Coast to New York City, then back down South hitting some of the biggest hotspot music cities in the country, including Durham, New Orleans, Austin, and Phoenix. After a month of extensive travel and performing, the excursion will conclude in the artists’ hometown of Los Angeles. 
Our goals are simple: share our passion for performing music with others, and  to share this experience with audiences from different cities and states and all of our supporters back home. Music has no boundaries or rules and we hope this tour will connect us to people and places we may have never known to have existed, had we not stepped out of our daily routines.  This will be all artists' of JADACE South Tour first time touring! This tour will be one of the most memorable adventures of our lifetime. Thank you for supporting our dreams and making it possible. 






Members of Jadace







MORE ABOUT ADINA ABRAHAMI


MORE ABOUT EMILY CLIBOURN

What we are asking for & what you will receive:

By pledging to support our campaign, you are joining the JADACE team! Literally, you will receive "Band shout outs" and updates from the road. We have joined our various skills together as musicians, artists and professionals to come up ways we can thank you for your acts of generosity and support! A list of "perks" with certain donation amounts are listed under "Perks". Thankfully, a portion of the tour's costs have been financed by some amazing contributors.  This campaign is meant to raise funds to cover all supplementary expenses listed below.
Public relations firm ($2500) This will cover 2 months of promotion for the tour. Promotion will help build audiences through various forms of media.
Silverfox Ln.'s EP production and completion  ($4000) 
Lodging & Travel expenses ($3000)
Total  Amount- $9,500




Other Ways You Can Help 


There are so many way you can help. One HUGE way of helping us out is the oldest and most successful means known; (WOM) Word of Mouth. This campaign is dependent on the word of mouth of all of our supporters. In a world of social media, sharing is truly caring. 


We will be in many different states (check our tour schedule) so if you know people in those towns or cities, ask them to come to our shows, we love meeting new people and hope to create new friends and fans. 

Let us know what songs you love; what are your favorite, who would you like to meet when we come home, stay connected to us. 
Believe it or not, buying just one song on iTunes helps as well as any monetary contribution to our campaign. We understand that not everyone has the means to support an entire tour but we still want you to enjoy our heart & soul through our music. 

Your Support...
By pledging to this project, you become a part of the dream, and will receive updates, videos, exclusives, digital downloads and more! 
We are grateful for your support, and are so excited to see what lies ahead! Thank you! Much love!
JADACE

story:
what you can do...

You can help me achieve my longtime goal of recording in Nashville, AKA music city! Check out the video to find out more about me, and feel free to listen to a few of my self-produced songs. 

what you'll get...

As a thank-you for your contribution in any amount, I'll be sure to send you a digital copy of the EP when it releases in the fall - just remember to include your email in the memo! Check out the other perks too.

what your support means to me...

I really can't put it into words. The only thing better than actually making the music is knowing that I have a community of friends and family who are so supportive. Ya'll are the best!

story:
(English will follow)

Trois légendes du jazz de Montréal ensemble pour un enregistrement historique!

Un trio à faire rêver les musicologues du monde entier!

Le Jazz de Montréal possède son propre son, sa propre texture, sa propre identité culturelle.Le East Coast Jazz est unique et les musiciens montréalais des années 50 - 70 et même jusqu’à aujourd’hui, en font une ville de Jazz reconnu mondialement.

Le grand Montréal est reconnue pour être le berceau de nombreux musiciens/artistes de grand calibre comme Oscar Peterson, Maynard Ferguson, André Gagnon, Simple Plan et même Céline Dion.

Montréal est aussi synonyme de jazz avec son Festival international, le plus important au monde. Parmi les musiciens qui y ont figuré au long des 37 ans de son histoire, ces trois musiciens montréalais y ont participé avec panache et constance. Ensemble, ils ont fait au minimum 120 représentations au FIJM. Ils sont entres autres tous récipiendaires du Prix Oscar Peterson.


Mais qui sont ces légendes?

Tous nés à Montréal et amis depuis leur enfance, ces trois géants du jazz ont vécu et marqué la belle époque du jazz des années 1950 à 2016.

Aujourd’hui âgés respectivement de 73, 82 et 80 ans et au summum de leur gloire, ils offrent au monde un document qui est un legs musical historique!

Guy Nadon, batteur, compositeur et arrangeur. Surnommé le roi du Drum, il a commencé sa fabuleuse carrière en jouant dans la rue sur des canisses.

Michel Donato, contrebassiste, compositeur et chanteur. Un de nos bassistes les plus en vu au pays, il est aussi membre de l’ordre du Canada.

Vic Vogel a fait le tour du monde. Il est un pianiste, arrangeur, compositeur et chef d’orchestre. Il a, entre tellement d’autres choses, il a composé et fait les arrangements de la musique des Jeux olympique de 1976 et accompagné les plus grands noms qui sont venu à Montréal. La liste est exhaustive. Il pratique toujours avec son Le Jazz Big Band depuis 1968.


En écoutant le CD Chez Vic, vous allez revivre l’atmosphère du célèbre Red Light. Et encore mieux, vous pourrez le voir sur DVD / Blu-Ray!

Enregistré à la résidence de Vic Vogel le 17 décembre 2011, cet enregistrement sonore sera disponible qu’en version numérique.

Les ventes de CD étant anémiques, voir quasi inexistante, nous avons opté pour une nouvelle approche, pour fans seulement.

Nous prévoyons financer la finition/impression de notre projet avec la vente de CD/DVD/Blu-Ray en coffret limité. Vendu seulement ici durant la période Indiegogo non disponible en magasin.

Nous avons présentement l’audio et le vidéo. La captation audio et le matriçage est de Guy Tourville qui a terminé le mixage et le matriçage audio. Michel Lauzon et son équipe ce sont occupé de la captation vidéo. Nous avons fais le vidéo séquence, montage rush son/image, montage. Nous travaillons présentement à la finition du montage vidéo du trio et de l’ajout de l’entrevue faite par Winston McQuade. 

Par la suite, il nous restera la programmation du DVD et Blu-Ray à faire. On a décidé d’ajouter un Blu-Ray car on a tout filmé en HD et nous pensons qu’il en vaut la peine pour vous d’avoir cette qualité. 

Nous avons  notre Concept et Design, le montage et la maquette, il reste quelques correction et ajout et nous pourrons passer à l’impression. Le coffret contiendra un livret horizontal format boîtier DVD avec plus de 34 pages de photos, une affiche, textes, etc.

Nous vous remercions tous d’avance pour votre soutient dans notre projet.

Si vous avez des questions ou commentaires, n’hésitez pas, réponse rapide assuré.

L’Équipe Donato Nadon Vogel 


                                     

Three Montreal jazz legends together for a historical recording!

A dream trio for all musicologists worldwide!

Montreal has its own Jazz sound, its own texture, and cultural identity.The East Coast Sound is unique and Montreal musicians of the 50s - 70s and even today, make it a world-renowned city of Jazz .

The greater Montreal area is recognized as the birthplace of many prestigious musicians / artists like Oscar Peterson, Maynard Ferguson, André Gagnon, Simple Plan and Celine Dion.

Montreal is also synonymous with its International Jazz Festival, the largest in the world. Among the musicians who appeared there throughout the 37 years of its history, these three Montreal musicians took part with panache and constancy. Together they have performed at least 120 times at the Jazz Fest. They also count themselves as recipients of the Oscar Peterson Award.

But who are these legends?

All born in Montreal and friends since childhood, these three jazz giants lived and marked the height of the jazz years 1950-2016.

Today aged 73, 82 and 80 and at the height of their fame, they offer the world a testament that is a historical musical legacy!

Guy Nadon, drummer, composer and arranger. dubbed the “King of the Drum”, started his fabulous career playing in the streets on tin cans.

Michel Donato, bassist, composer and singer. One of the most sought after bassists in the country, he is also a member of the Order of Canada.

Vic Vogel has gone around the world as a pianist, arranger, composer and conductor. Among many other things, he composed and arranged the music for the 1976 Olympic Games and has accompanied many of the greatest names who have performed in Montreal. The list is exhaustive. Since 1968, he still practices with his Le Jazz Big Band.


Listening to the CD Chez Vic, you'll relive the atmosphere of the famous Red Light. And even better, you can see it on DVD / Blu-Ray!

Recorded at the home of Vic Vogel on December 17th, 2011, the audio recording will be available only in numeric/digital form.

CD sales are anemic, even virtually non-existent, we opted for a new approach for fans only.

We expect to fund the finishing / printing of our project with the sale of CD / DVD / Blu-Ray limited box set. Sold only here during the Indiegogo period and not available in stores.

We currently have audio and video. The audio capture and mastering is by Guy Tourville that as finished mixing and mastering the audio. Michel Lauzon and his team are busy on the video capture. We have done the video sequence, rush / image editing and are currently finishing the video montage of the trio and adding the interview by Winston McQuade.

Subsequently, there will we be the programing of the DVD and Blu-Ray to do. We decided to add a Blu-Ray because everything was shot in HD and we think it is worth it to give you this quality.

We have our Concept and Design, editing and layout, there are some corrections to do and some adding before we can proceed to printing. The box will be a DVD size case with an horizontal booklet with over 34 pages of photos, a poster, texts, etc.

We thank you all in advance for your support in our project.

If you have questions or comments, feel free, quick response is ensured.

Donato Nadon Vogel Team





                                   


Michel Donato
Contrebasse / Bass

Guy Nadon
Batterie / Drums

Vic Vogel
Piano

Entrevue / Interview
Winston McQuade

Enregistré le 17 Décembre 2011 /
Recorded December 17th, 2011
Chez Vic Vogel à Montréal

Producteur Exécutif /
Executive Producer
Bob Pover

Réalisateur et Directeur Musical /
Producer and Musical Director
Vic Vogel

Produit par /
Produced by
529jazz, Saint Toniz, V V Records

Ingénieur du Son et Matriçage Son
Sound Engineer and Sound Mastering
Guy Tourville / Studio Tangerine

Assistant Son / Sound assistant
William Gabouri

Directeur Images et Éclairage /
Director of Image and Lighting
Michel Lauzon

Caméramans / Cameramen
Marc Warden
Michel Lauzon

Assistante Caméra / Camera Assistant

Opérateur Grue  / Jib Operator
Marc Warden

Bob Pover

Montage Vidéo /  Video Editing
Marc Warden

Montage Vidéo Entrevue /
Video Editing Interview
Pierre Cloutier

Matriçage / Mastering Blu-Ray& DVD
Pierre Cloutier

Direction Artistique et Concept /
Art Direction and Conception
Christian Morency
Bob Pover

Infographie et Montage / Graphics & Montage
Christian Morency

Assistant
Géo Giguère

Julie Benoït

Autres Photos / Other Photos
Winston McQuade
Michel Lauzon
Géo Giguère

Rhonda Mullins

Traduction / Translation
Tandy Sauvé
Bob Pover

story:
Frank Palangi EP Acoustic Release

Your support means so much! Fans have the power to change artist's careers in many ways. By helping to contribute, you'll be on board as one of my SUPERFANS making it possible to finish and promote this project. It's the 5th year anniversary of the debut "EP" and I'm doing this project for you that enjoyed those tunes so much the 1st time around and to shed other side of me with the acoustic versions. Thank you so much! I appreciate you all so much! Let's get on board and \m/ \m/ ROCK!
  • www.frankpalangi.com


Why am I asking for your help and what comes back to you?

- Helping with production costs, and promotional costs

- Being a SUPERFAN and involved in an artists career 

- A variety of perks coming straight to you :) :) Take a look to the right:

It's tough nowadays to get yourself noticed at all. I've built a base over the past few years and the areas to hit with this but I'm not afraid to admit when I need help as well. I personally will have contact with you about what's going on with the progress of this EP, news and more. I'll be broadcasting a few pre-release performances and after the release as well through Concert Window and Stageit.com  - https://www.concertwindow.com/frankpalangi 

- https://www.stageit.com/frank-palangi


BIO: Recording Artist Frank Palangi™! Hailing from Upstate New York, his music fuels a feeding frenzy of positive rock that delivers strong. With his self quote “I have no plan b on backing down on my dreams.”, says it all about taking on a career path of no turning back. Being a singer/songwriter, and mult-instrumentalist, Palangi constantly crafts fresh creativity giving his all to fans. Partying every day and every night as you may think all rockers do, is not in the cards for him. Grounded from growing up with a solid family support system molded a confident attitude and work ethic. "Palangi’s positivity extends beyond his music into the way he interacts with his fans. " - Guitar World. Frank replies "It has been a blessing talking with great people and having social media be a great tool no matter where you are. Growing up, I've dealt with medical illnesses that had a major impact on my lifestyle. Learning how to adapt and overcome challenges somehow let me reroute illness into a strength. It lead me to my passion, determination and will to fight on. The music industry itself I know is tough also but it doesn't scare me to break open doors to achieve my dreams.” 

- Through his intense networking, Palangi sparked attention from various industry professionals and producers. Working with producer Rob Coates from TN with the "I Am Ready EP" in 2013 (Nominated for Best Rock Single at the LA Music Awards), he received national press features with GuitarWorld.com, Revolver Mag.com, Music Now Magazine, Young Celebrity News, The Examiner.com, Mi2n.com and local FM airplay also national internet radio play. CD Available at Bestbuy.com and Barnes & Nobles.com. Other independent singles include "Hope" which delivers an inspirational message is available for free on CDbaby.com 

- His current independent single "Break These Chains" is proving to be a fan favorite falling in love with the attractive attitude and gritty deep voice from the studio track to the stage. Charting the top 10 on various internet radio stations and the live performance version on Youtube gained 100,000 views within 3 weeks of it's upload. Produced under the wheel of Brian Craddock (Guitarist from the successful band Daughtry) earned an Akademia Music Award for May 2015 for "Best METAL/POP SONG" and April 2016 for "Best ROCK SONG" with also a semi-finalist "Unsigned Only Competition 2015" slot. Available on iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, Spotify and more through Symphonic Distribution. "Frank’s natural talent and certifies that he can write songs that compete with the big boys of rock." - Jamsphere Magazine. "Palangi's hard-hitting track features intense metal musicianship, top-notch production, and songcraft worthy of Metallica at their best." - Akademia Music Awards 


BACKGROUND: In 2010, fate crossed paths handing a demo CD to the Grammy Nominated Christian rock band, “Day Of Fire” at Upstate Concert Hall in Clifton Park, NY. Singer Josh Brown (also in Full Devil Jacket) saw potential and forwarded it over to their current Nashville producer Rogers Masson who has worked with acts Marylin Manson, Vintage Trouble. Shortly after Frank was on his way traveling to TN to record his 1st EP at the music mecca with a seasoned act. Masson said, “This is the baddest rhythm section in the land, and along with the vocal guidance from Josh, Frank’s songs are going to turn out amazing." . Frank says "The first EP grew my sound into the place where it needed to be get to another level. The great musicians I worked with and culture of that area was absorbed into the record. I felt a platform to stand on and opened to new opportunities from national shows, local gigs, and local radio." 


www.twitter.com/frankpalangi
www.facebook.com/frankpalangisoloartist
https://www.instagram.com/frankpalangimusic/

"Frank’s natural talent and certifies that he can write songs that compete with the big boys of rock." - Jamsphere Magazine. "Palangi's hard-hitting track features intense metal musicianship, top-notch production, and songcraft worthy of Metallica at their best." - Akademia Music Awards BACKGROUND: In 2010, fate crossed paths handing a demo CD to the Grammy Nominated Christian rock band, “Day Of Fire” at Upstate Concert Hall in Clifton Park, NY. Singer Josh Brown (also in Full Devil Jacket) saw potential and forwarded it over to their current Nashville producer Rogers Masson who has worked with acts Marylin Manson, Vintage Trouble. Shortly after Frank was on his way traveling to TN to record his 1st EP at the music mecca with a seasoned act. Masson said, “This is the baddest rhythm section in the land, and along with the vocal guidance from Josh, Frank’s songs are going to turn out amazing." . Frank says "The first EP grew my sound into the place where it needed to be get to another level. The great musicians I worked with and culture of that area was absorbed into the record. I felt a platform to stand on and opened to new opportunities from national shows, local gigs, and local radio." www.twitter.com/frankpalangiwww.facebook.com/frankpalangisoloartist
https://www.instagram.com/frankpalangimusic/

story:
West Coast Opera Studio

The West Coast Opera Studio is a newly-founded studio opera program in Vancouver, BC aimed at giving performance opportunities to talented opera students and young artists whose financial limitations or personal situations have kept them from the operatic stage. WCOS is here to help lift these amazing singers by getting them the roles, stage experience, and operatic role credits they need to support future international careers. 

The West Coast Opera Studio is co-producing an evening of opera with Opera Mariposa, a company that "stands at the forefront of Vancouver's opera scene" (The Vancouver Project) and which is currently in its fifth critically acclaimed year. Together, they will present two baroque one-act operas from the standard repertoire - Pergolesi's La serva padrona and Purcell's Dido and Aeneas - for two nights only at Vancouver's iconic Metro Theatre. 

But the arts in the Lower Mainland are hard to sustain and fund. Theatre, musical direction, insurance and costume costs can become insurmountable financial hurdles without your help. On July 29th and 30th, 2016, we want to celebrate the arts in Vancouver and showcase these amazing voices - but we can't do it without you. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to cover costs for the show, plain and simple. $2500 is at the very low end of what we might need for these operas - $1000 goes to the theatre rental cost alone - and even then the financial burden is high. The founder of the West Coast Opera Studio, soprano Robin Eder-Warren, is an artist as well, and is hoping to move to Europe to pursue her singing career - much like several of the cast members of the operas. "The operatic community is built upon artists and creative minds supporting each other, and that's the spirit in which we're launching both the company (WCOS) and the Indiegogo campaign," she says. "We as artists are all in this together."

With your help, we can put on two evenings of high-quality, well-produced baroque opera, starring some of the most promising voices in Vancouver. You can support, and ultimately create, tomorrow's brightest operatic stars by giving them these opportunities. 

The Impact

Projects like this help ensure that Canadian opera singers get a chance to build their resumes - something they need to do if they wish to continue pursuing their careers on the world stage. WCOS stands against the idea that opera is a dying art form by supporting this talented new generation of singers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help fund WCOS? We are always in need of volunteers, both before and during show days - email robinederwarren at gmail dot com to see what you can do!

story:
From the first to 11th September UKOM will experience a great adventure: a trip to Moscow and St. Petersburg to get to know children, traditions and places that make us grow and meet a world that is, for us, new and with a different culture.
Dal primo all’11 settembre UKOM farà una bellissima avventura: un viaggio a Mosca e a San Pietroburgo per conoscere bambini, tradizioni e luoghi che ci facciano crescere e incontrare un mondo per noi nuovo e con una cultura diversa.
С 1 по 11 сентября нам хотелось бы совершить интересную поездку: путешествие в Москву и Санкт-Петербург, чтобы знакомиться со сверстниками, их традициями и новыми местами, что позволит нам стать взрослее  и открыть для себя новый мир и культуру доселе нам незнакомую.

To make this wonderful experience, we have to support many costs: rental of instruments, visas, travel, accommodation and meals for all children taking part in the tour...
So: HELP  US TO TAKE OFF!
MAKE YOUR CONTRIBUTION BY CLICKING ON THE AMOUNT YOU WISH TO DONATE!! CHOOSE AMONG THE AMOUNTS YOU SEE ON THE RIGHT: FOR EACH CONTRIBUTION YOU WILL GET THE PERK DESCRIBED IN THE BOX...
Per fare questa bellissima esperienza, dobbiamo però sostenere tanti costi: il noleggio degli strumenti, i visti, il viaggio, il vitto e l'alloggio per tutti i bambini che partecipano alla tournée...
Quindi: AIUTACI ANCHE TU A PARTIRE!
FAI UNA DONAZIONE CLICCANDO SULLA SOMMA CHE VUOI DONARE!! SEGLI TRA LE CIFRE INDICATE QUI A DESTRA: PER OGNI DONAZIONE RICEVERAI QUANTO DESCRITTO NEL RIQUADRO CORRISPONDENTE...
Для осуществления этих гастролей нам предстоит столкнуться с немалыми расходами: аренда инструментов, визы, перелеты, питание и проживание для всех детей, которые будут принимать участие в гастролях…
Поэтому: ПОМОГИ И ТЫ В ОРГАНИЗАЦИИ НАШЕЙ ПОЕЗДКИ!
СДЕЛАЙ ПОЖЕРТВОВАНИЕ, ЩЕЛКНУВ МЫШЬЮ НА СУММУ, КОТОРУЮ ТЫ ХОЧЕШЬ ДАРИТЬ!! ВЫБЕРИ СРЕДИ СУММ, УКАЗАННЫХ СПРАВА: КАЖДОЕ ПОЖЕРТВОВАНИЕ  ПОЛУЧИТ СООТВЕТСТВУЮЩИЙ ПОДАРОК В ЗНАК БЛАГОДАРНОСТИ...

www.associazioneimmaginarte.it

www.facebook.com-unitedkidsofmusic

story:
Help fund my new album:

 As a prolific songwriter, it's now time to record a new album (my 10th) and in this election year the time is ripe.  I'm very excited about this new group of original songs about big banks, small stores, privacy in the social media age, income inequality, climate change and the environment, billionaires and folks who live on the fringe all over the world.  I intend on taking the music to some new exciting directions.  Your pledges will fund the costs of recording studio time, all production, mastering and promotion (including a music video.) I'm looking to you to help make these next songs live forever.  I have 34 days to raise my budget of $15,000. so please pitch in whatever you can.  There are certain gifts based on the levels of contribution starting with $27. If you're not familiar with my music please listen to free streaming songs on my website,  https://www.reverbnation.com/mikerimbaud

You can watch my videos too: https://www.youtube.com/user/mrimbaud

I'll be recording with my fellow rockers from over the years, some of the best rock n' roll musicians in New York City.  I'll be producing, playing guitar and singing as I did with my critically acclaimed previous album, "Put That Dream in your Pipe and Smoke it" (2014.)  I'm looking to raise  $15,000. that will allow me the freedom to create the album I imagine.   We need songs and music that connect people to the difficult times we live in and offer inspiration for the future.  I hope you'll contribute what you can and help me produce a powerful record in this election year.  Check out the perks you will receive for contributing to the album below.  If you can't contribute please spread the word to others who might be able to.  Thank you.

Sincerely, 

Mike Rimbaud

New York, New York

"A strong case could be made that no other New York artist represents this city’s defiantly populist past – or, one hopes, its future – more than Mike Rimbaud.  NYC’s current powerpop/new wave counterpart to Joe Strummer "

- New York Music Daily  2015.

For more artist info, bio, press and videos, please visit: https://www.reverbnation.com/mikerimbaud

Mikerimbaud.com

Please enjoy some music videos from my previous album:



Listen to the last single, Talkin' Bout Revolution Again released April 2016:

story:
About Me and Peace, Love & Music

The Peace, Love & Music Project is a project setup by Vernon Chatlein.
Born and raised on the small Caribbean Island Curaçao; he got exposed to different types of music early on in his career. 

When I was 15 my school buddies started a band to play all the "quinceañera" parties. (When the girls turn 15 it is celebrated BIG in the Caribbean). They asked me if I wanted to come sing, so I said yes and thought it would be fun. Little did I know 5 years later I would be in Cuba studying music and afterwards in Amsterdam traveling the whole world with different artists and groups.

As long as I could remember I would always sign my emails with Peace, Love & Music, when I started realising that Music was a language that is understood worldwide, just like Love. I was a lot in to Hip Hop culture when I was younger so signing off with Peace seemed cool at the time. As I grew older (and wiser... narf!) I started learning how all these three principles are a primordial subset of things that we all need and that is ever present throughout history and throughout our lives.

By helping me fund this campaign I get to cover the costs for my 3-part album Peace, Love & Music, the short film 'A Piece of Peace' and the photo series with the same name. The music will be mostly originals and arrangements of existing songs/tunes. The band consist of musicians from all over the globe; Mexico, Italy, Germany, Spain, Netherlands, Curaçao. This happened purely by chance but puts further emphasis on music as a global language and as a way of uniting people from all over.

More than just an Album; Peace, Love & Music (PLM) is in itself a concept and in itself a campaign that will last for the rest of time, for I believe we all as a people on this Earth should work towards our goals with PLM in mind.

'Harmony is Pure Love, for Love is a Concerto' ~ Lope de Vega (Spanish Baroque Poet)

Why Crowdfunding?

Where does the money go to:

Producing the Album - Peace, Love & Music

  • Recording Studio, Equipment, Mixing, Mastering, Artwork, Printing, Distribution, Promotion and much more...
Making the Photo series 'A Piece of Peace'
  • Equipment, Printing, Materials (Carton Boards, Markers, Picture Stands, Picture Frames etc.), Transportation
Making of Short Film 'A Piece of Peace'
  • Equipment (Cameras, Lighting, Cables, Mics etc), Small Film Crew, Promotion, Production, Editing and much more...
Perks & Quirks 
I am giving away different fun and amusing perks for your contributions.
You can pre-order a new album get a previous one, take private and/or group lessons. You can even receive your own private living room concert (terms and conditions may apply).

Other Ways You Can Help

Again it does not matter if you cannot help financially, as I said before this is an ongoing campaign for all of us. You can always help by:

  • Spread the word by talking about PLM and following me on facebook.com/vcelements
  • Share your PLM video online on social media and tagging your friends
  • Share the campaign on your social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram)
And always whatever you do remember to do it with Peace, Love & Music in mind.

 Ayo, Ciao, Bye, Adios, Dag, Sayonara

Vernon Chatlein

story:
Hi Everyone,

                           I want to make a music video, and I am completely excited about this!  I am asking You to be a part of this vision, I have an awesome team behind me.  They are a group of a million dollar production company doing a "Hollywood worthy" video for me for $1200, this will include three camera men a drone, makeup/hair/ and outfit changes, these companies are not wasting their time on anyone not after something.  Typically I'd try and come up with this myself but I am in a race for time, because I am have heart surgery in June and I'd really like to keep my momentum going.  Everyone this opportunity doesn't come everyday, oh and my boss is also allowing me to utilize his penthouse at the W in Tempe, Az.  I am so excited, and know there is something big just around the corner help me make it happen!

story:
Short Summary

Ok here we go, nobody on no score and bottom of the ninth.... yeah I dunno where I was going with the Meatloaf lyrics either but I am hoping it got a wee smile and hopefully keeps you reading.

So hello and welcome my name is Simon and I am a part time singer and karaoke presenter although mainly the karaoke nowadays.  Been singing as long as I can remember, starting in school choirs and then joining a local male voice choir that my father was in by the time I was 12.

The bug caught fully by adulthood and I became a karaoke fiend who just had to sing which as so often happens led to doing some hosting then a party or two before the big pressure of weddings and even funerals...trust me it is the toughest audience you could ever play too for about the first hour then it it the most glorious celebration and energy that I have ever witnessed in my life and I have done more than a couple of them over the years.

So where is this all going I hear you ask. Well quite simply I would like to finally release an album of some of the songs I have done over the years to finally find out just what I sound like with some proper recording and mainly to simply say "yeah I did that".


What We Need & What You Get

Well as you can no doubt imagine starting all this from scratch is not the cheapest idea I have ever had so I am hoping to get a little help from across the country, maybe from some others who have thought "I wish I had done that have some cash nice person".

I am aiming to keeps the costs totally open, honest and upfront although I hope you can appreciate that as I have never done any studio work I can't be certain of total time needed for recording.  I will be honest and say that many of the songs I do I have had years of practice at, so am confident of only needing a few takes and hopefully getting as many as 12 songs onto the final album but a minimum of 8 is the goal and will announce the prospective set list within next few weeks.**UPDATE AT BOTTOM OF PAGE**

So I will be using a local studio (like literally right next door to where I work which is a bonus) and they have been great with tips and advice as well as a sweet deal.  My estimated cost for the studio time and work is around £400

They are also able to assist with the licencing of the album so all the royalties go to the right people and I get no letters from very rich people with very good lawyers that would just make me cry. The licencing for the initial run of 200 albums is expected to be around the £200-£250 mark depending on final inclusions to the album although depending how well this campaign goes I might even get a few more done which would be lovely.

I am even updating my backing track library and have also arranged a good deal on this to get all needed backing tracks for just £50

Reproduction is no cheap thing as I have found out after hours and hours of web surfing, phone calls and emails back and forward.  In the end I have chosen a large, established and reputable as well as ethical company to carry out the work for around about £240 for the run of 200 albums. This incluses full colour printing on the CD as well as full colour card packaging for the album.

Well that pretty much covers the costs although I am happy to point out that saving hard (yeah I work full time too) has got me to the point that I should be able to have the studio booked and paid for and ready to start recording by the end of May 2015.

The Impact

Ok I have no sob story, no lifelong promise to a friend or family member just a burning itch to see if I can take my music to the masses and maybe just maybe prove that there are still some great amateur singers out there that if given the chance can get some of the spotlight. 

Hey I have enough material (ok ok I do covers but it is still material) for another album or two so with a little help from you dear reader we could turn this unknown fat lad with a mic into the next big superstar or at the very least I get my 15 minutes of fame.

Risks & Challenges

I can honestly say other than getting the finances in place I don't really foresee any obstacles or risks. I know I can sing (yeah it sounds very big headed but if I couldn't then I honestly wouldn't be wasting your time and trying to make a go of this). I know I have the passion to make this succeed and I know that I have thoroughly planned this out over a very long time to make sure I can get this done.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ok so I am after money and not planning on sugar coating that. But any form of support right down to a share on your Facebook or Twitter account would be fantastic and you get my eternal thanks.

I am even offering a very special £1 pledge which will get you a personal thank you email from me for simply putting forward £1.  If I could get 1000 of you to pop just a pound into the fund I will happily sit and type up the thank you emails and even thank you personally on my Facebook page for your kind support.

Well that is pretty much me in a nutshell and I will keep this page up to date with stories, maybe even a sample song or two and if I get brave some pictures and videos although I am pretty camera shy.


Oh and I suppose I had better set a date for release....yeah it's probably gonna change a dozen times but here goes nothing. I hope to have the album fully completed and ready to send out by October/November so perfect for all those Christmas presents you are going to need.


EXPECTED PLAYLIST

Mack The Knife
Galway Girl
Bonfire Heart
Chasing Cars
Let It Be
Losing My Religion
The Gambler
I Won't Give Up On Us

POSSIBLE EXTRA MATERIAL (Up to another 4 of these)
That' Life
Ain't That A Kick In The Head
When You Say Nothing At All
I'm On My Way
Mr Brightside
Lay Down Sally
Dignity
Hot Fudge
Gold


Just to give you the kind of range which you can look forward to.

Short Summary Ok here we go, nobody on no score and bottom of the ninth.... yeah I dunno where I was going with the Meatloaf lyrics either but I am hoping it got a wee smile and hopefully keeps you reading.
So hello and welcome my name is Simon and I am a part time singer and karaoke presenter although mainly the karaoke nowadays.  Been singing as long as I can remember, starting in school choirs and then joining a local male voice choir that my father was in by the time I was 12.
The bug caught fully by adulthood and I became a karaoke fiend who just had to sing which as so often happens led to doing some hosting then a party or two before the big pressure of weddings and even funerals...trust me it is the toughest audience you could ever play too for about the first hour then it it the most glorious celebration and energy that I have ever witnessed in my life and I have done more than a couple of them over the years.
So where is this all going I hear you ask. Well quite simply I would like to finally release an album of some of the songs I have done over the years to finally find out just what I sound like with some proper recording and mainly to simply say "yeah I did that".
   What We Need & What You Get Well as you can no doubt imagine starting all this from scratch is not the cheapest idea I have ever had so I am hoping to get a little help from across the country, maybe from some others who have thought "I wish I had done that have some cash nice person".
I am aiming to keeps the costs totally open, honest and upfront although I hope you can appreciate that as I have never done any studio work I can't be certain of total time needed for recording.  I will be honest and say that many of the songs I do I have had years of practice at, so am confident of only needing a few takes and hopefully getting as many as 12 songs onto the final album but a minimum of 8 is the goal and will announce the prospective set list within next few weeks.**UPDATE AT BOTTOM OF PAGE**
So I will be using a local studio (like literally right next door to where I work which is a bonus) and they have been great with tips and advice as well as a sweet deal.  My estimated cost for the studio time and work is around £400
They are also able to assist with the licencing of the album so all the royalties go to the right people and I get no letters from very rich people with very good lawyers that would just make me cry. The licencing for the initial run of 200 albums is expected to be around the £200-£250 mark depending on final inclusions to the album although depending how well this campaign goes I might even get a few more done which would be lovely.
I am even updating my backing track library and have also arranged a good deal on this to get all needed backing tracks for just £50
Reproduction is no cheap thing as I have found out after hours and hours of web surfing, phone calls and emails back and forward.  In the end I have chosen a large, established and reputable as well as ethical company to carry out the work for around about £240 for the run of 200 albums. This incluses full colour printing on the CD as well as full colour card packaging for the album.
Well that pretty much covers the costs although I am happy to point out that saving hard (yeah I work full time too) has got me to the point that I should be able to have the studio booked and paid for and ready to start recording by the end of May 2015.
    The Impact Ok I have no sob story, no lifelong promise to a friend or family member just a burning itch to see if I can take my music to the masses and maybe just maybe prove that there are still some great amateur singers out there that if given the chance can get some of the spotlight. 
Hey I have enough material (ok ok I do covers but it is still material) for another album or two so with a little help from you dear reader we could turn this unknown fat lad with a mic into the next big superstar or at the very least I get my 15 minutes of fame.
    Risks & Challenges I can honestly say other than getting the finances in place I don't really foresee any obstacles or risks. I know I can sing (yeah it sounds very big headed but if I couldn't then I honestly wouldn't be wasting your time and trying to make a go of this). I know I have the passion to make this succeed and I know that I have thoroughly planned this out over a very long time to make sure I can get this done.
    Other Ways You Can Help Ok so I am after money and not planning on sugar coating that. But any form of support right down to a share on your Facebook or Twitter account would be fantastic and you get my eternal thanks.
I am even offering a very special £1 pledge which will get you a personal thank you email from me for simply putting forward £1.  If I could get 1000 of you to pop just a pound into the fund I will happily sit and type up the thank you emails and even thank you personally on my Facebook page for your kind support.
Well that is pretty much me in a nutshell and I will keep this page up to date with stories, maybe even a sample song or two and if I get brave some pictures and videos although I am pretty camera shy.

Oh and I suppose I had better set a date for release....yeah it's probably gonna change a dozen times but here goes nothing. I hope to have the album fully completed and ready to send out by October/November so perfect for all those Christmas presents you are going to need.

EXPECTED PLAYLIST
Mack The KnifeGalway GirlBonfire HeartChasing CarsLet It BeLosing My ReligionThe GamblerI Won't Give Up On UsPOSSIBLE EXTRA MATERIAL (Up to another 4 of these)That' LifeAin't That A Kick In The HeadWhen You Say Nothing At AllI'm On My WayMr BrightsideLay Down SallyDignityHot FudgeGold

Just to give you the kind of range which you can look forward to.

story:
Our Band:

Rantipole:  a wild, romping young person; wild, roving, rakish
Hello! We are Rantipole, a group of musicians from all over the United States, but we met here, at Bard College in the Hudson Valley. We have made a studio album, been the house band for a surrealist circus,  been the pit orchestra for scores of plays, and have been making amazing music together since we became friends three years ago. 
If you want to get a sense of the music we play, here's our first album!
https://rantipole.bandcamp.com/

What we've made:

Over the past 4 weeks, we have made an incredible album that is our most cohesive sound yet. It's titled "Alarum" because it's thematically focused on sleep, fire, and general ruckus. We also managed to create/record it during the end of our school year on top of all being dedicated, full time students. We are incredibly proud of the sound we have made and can't wait to share our music with you. 


Your role:

The album is so fantastic that it deserves to be mixed by a sound professional. That's why we need your help. We have hired the amazing Kyle Walker to help us produce our music, and like all working artists, he deserved to get payed.  Since all of us are current college students, we need help raising the money to pay him fairly. That's where you come in!


Ways you can help:

All money raised by this campaign will go to paying our sound engineer, Kyle. By even donating a few dollars, you are not only helping him pursue a career as an artist, you are helping us realize our endeavors as musicians. We care deeply about our art and about being able to share it with our audience, but balancing that on top of a college budget is a challenge to say the least. By donating even $5, you are helping us continue to do what we are so passionate about doing: making music. 
Please donate as much as you can! And share us on your social media! A facebook/twitter/email push goes a long way.

Thank you and much love!

-Rantipole

story:
Introduction


Hello! We are Michael Neal and Andrew Baughman and we make up the spoken word infused band September Stories.


We have finished our first 5-song EP and we are ready to hit the recording studio, Capital House Studio, with Nick Ingram and make these songs exactly how we want them. Both of us, Michael and Andrew, have had lots of experience with music throughout the years. With genres ranging from metal and it’s sub-genres all the way to light acoustic rock (Links to other projects at the bottom). We both have been very inspired to make this EP, Dreaming or Sinking, by Levi The Poet and Hotel Books. The raw emotion that both artists have in their songs, is what we’re trying to capture with our EP, while including catchy tags to make the songs very emotional, but yet still fun to sing along with.


The goal of this EP is to show all the people out there that are dealing with awful things in life, that they’re simply not alone. That there are other people out there that feel their pain and are going though, and better yet, making it through those hardships, and that there’s nothing that music can’t do. Music is simply a gift from God and we want to use it to help people through the hardest parts of their lives.


The only thing that stands in the way of us making this a reality is the money. You guys could be the start of something great that we want to bring to you.



We Need Your Help


We need to raise $3,600 to cover all of these factors: All recording, mixing, and mastering charges, cost of making physical CDs, IGG fee, lodging and food, and perks. Here's a break-down of all of the fees in making the EP:



Along with the EP, we also we will offering perks such as shirts with our logo, canvases of the album art (sizing of 10”x10” and 22”x22”), September Stories buttons that you can pin to bags and anything of your choosing, webchats, in-person hangouts, special “thank you's” in the liner notes, playing shows in YOUR OWN hometown, and even writing songs about anything of your choosing!


Even if you don’t have enough to purchase the EP, anything is honestly a TREMENDOUS help. Just $1 would honestly help us out so much, or even sharing our page on your Facebook or any other social media will play a vital role in helping us to reach our hopes and dreams that we’ve poured our heart and souls into. Anything helps!


Risks And Challenges


Making a record is not an easy task, and that's why we have specifically chosen the producer that we would like to record our EP. We feel that he knows the sound that we're aiming for, and that he will help us to further reach our goal of what we want the songs to sound like. Both of us are extremely dedicated to making this EP the best that it possibly can be in hopes that you all love what we make. With your help we will make this dream a reality and be able to get our foot in the music industry!



Thank You!


Without any of you guys this would never be possible. Thank you for taking the time to check us out and thank you for any and all donations! We’re so grateful to have people who are willing to help support our dreams and to someday make music our living. THANK YOU!


Link to pre-pro demo of "Obsession" on SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/september-stories/obsession-demo


EP/Canvas Album Art:


International Shipping Available!

Special thanks to Micah Tewers for recording and editing the film clip. Contact at:
https://www.facebook.com/micah.tewers?fref=ts&a...

story:
Short Summary

New album release Tough Times on HMG records is a beautiful mixture of positive vibes about life that will warm your heart. Signature vintage sound, with across the board influences of rock, r& b, country, and gospel, unleahed on a roots reggae vibe.From an inspiring story, this artist takes his music over the top, and succeeds in capturing your conscious. http://professorbarmyoflove.com   (BMI) 

What We Need & What You Get


We have already created the music. recorded and pressed the CD.  We want to bring the message of this music to the people, and we need your support to promote the music and help the band tour.  Reggae bands need a lot of folks to deliver the show, and its expensive to tour, particularly in the early stages.  We hope to use the funds to promote the band up to a level where it can support itself.
This project was initiated by Horizon Music Group as a means to help Professor B combat his diagnosed cancer.  As we have found in the past, working on music has greatly improved his health through the positive vibrations of music.  Help us share that message.
The funds we raise will be used to obtain press and radio support for the Tough Times CD, and defray travel expenses for the band to perform at festivals and venues up and down the east coast.  All money raised will go to these ends, and the more funds available the carter we can reach.
In addition to the perks described, all supporters will be included on a list that will get reduced or free admission, or other preferential treatment wherever the porter is cooperative.

The Impact

Professor B's message of universal love and positivity has proven to have strong impact in these troubled times, both sociologically and medicinally.  

Risks & Challenges

Promoting music projects is always a difficult proposition.  There are many artists vying for the public's attention.  But we feel both the music and the experience of the Army of Love pack a big punch.  Producer Vic Steffens of Horizon Music Group has produced over 300 full length CDs and worked with may notable artists.  The music and the live show are truly inspirational.

Other Ways You Can Help

Music is a largely word of mouth medium.  Spread the word wherever and whenever you can.  If you can't contribute you can still make a difference.
