story:
Help this FREE Community Youth Choir to expand and stay FREE for all members! Your donation will keep these kids singing.

On Saturday mornings, kids from all backgrounds leave their worries and differences behind to join voices and sing their hearts out - together. A program of the MacPhail Center for Music in Minneapolis, MN, the MacPhail Community Youth Choir (MCYC) welcomes all kids in grades 9-12 from throughout the Twin Cities to learn and gain confidence through music. Inclusion, friendship and hope are the cornerstones of this inspiring group, and are reflected in all the music they perform. Led by Twin Cities’ artist J.D. Steele, of the famous Steele Family, this choir is free and open to students of all skill levels and talents through the programming of the MacPhail Center for Music in Minneapolis. These energetic, young people perform many styles of music including jazz, gospel, pop and East African. 


(Choir performing at MN Governor's inauguration.)

Your donation will ensure this choir remains a free program to all its young members and will help expand the membership to more kids who otherwise couldn't participate. You can help ensure that we never have to turn away a child because of financial hardship. Watch the video, listen to the music and invest in these brilliant kids. 

(Choir with Shangalia  - a youth choir from Kenya at the Ordway Theater.)

A thrilling highlight for the choir in 2010 was the opportunity to perform at the Flint Hills International Children’s Festival with Shangilia - a similar youth performance group from Nairobi, Kenya, also under the direction of JD Steele. This exciting international project provided the MCYC youth the opportunity to engage with their peers in Kenya on a cultural and artistic level.

What we need.

Please, give generously and give now.

We urgently need $5,300 to... 

1) Keep the choir FREE for ALL kids who wish to join by continuing to cover critical operating expenses, like rehearsal space. 

2) Help ensure that no child is ever turned away from the choir for financial reasons. 

3) Bring in new choir members through basic marketing. 

4) Fund future experiences and performances for the group, like the concert with the choir from Kenya!


What you get.

You get access to one of a kind music opportunities ONLY available through this campaign. 

How about a recording session on state of the art equipment, produced by JD Steele, for you or your band? 

Or, get a discounted music lesson (in person or online) from a world class instructor at the MacPhail Center for Music. 

Perhaps you'd like to have the choir, or JD and Fred Steele perform at your next party? 

Or, just sit back and enjoy the choir's musical talent with a free download of their album.



(JD Steele working with a choir member at a recording session.)

The Impact.

“A city, state or nation cannot live by industry alone. There must be something for the heart and soul.” William S. MacPhail - Founder of MacPhail 

Music is the universal language that binds us - its essential food for the soul. We need your help to continue nourishing the creativity of these children and provide a safe environment where they can thrive and shine!


LOW RISK and very HIGH REWARD.

Low Risk - MacPhail Center for Music in Minneapolis is a community music school with a long history - 108 years! As a national leader is music education, MacPhail's programs are tested and proven to achieve results. 

High Reward - As a non-profit, substantial funds must be raised for each of the MANY programs MacPhail offers for all stages of life. Today, help is needed for MacPhail's Community Youth Choir - to expand it and keep it free for kids of all backgrounds to join. Your donation of any amount will go directly to this program to cover the expenses associated with sustaining this wonderful kids' choir.


Can't donate $? Then help spread the word!

Even if you can't contribute, chances are good you know people who can. Please help us share our campaign by posting the URL below to your social media!

http://igg.me/at/macphailmcyc

Thank you, thank you, thank you - from the MacPhail Community Youth Choir and all the people it touches. You've done something really GOOD!

MacPhail Center for Music 
501 South Second Street
Minneapolis, MN 55391

Perks - value details:

You can waive your perks. If you chose them, please see below:

·  Contributions of $10 or fewer receive perks valued at $0 fair market value

·  Contributions of $50 receive perks valued at either $62.10 for a 15% MacPhail class discount OR perks valued at $34.31 for a 15% discount on three private lessons

·  Contributions of $150 receive perks valued at $112.10 for 2 Spotlight tickets and a 15% discount on a MacPhail class OR perks valued at $84.31 for 2 Spotlight tickets and a 15% discount on three private MacPhail lessons

·  Contributions of $250 receive perks valued at $203.50 for 4 Spotlight tickets and a 25% discount on a MacPhail class OR perks valued at $176.25 for 4 Spotlight tickets and a 25% discount on a 4 MacPhail private lessons

·  Contributions of $500 receive perks valued at $1,200

·  Contributions of $1,000 receive perks valued at $1,400

·  Contributions of $1,500+ receive perks valued at $1,500

story:
My name is Conrad Useldinger. I am a songwriter from the San Francisco Bay Area and I'm working on releasing my debut album. This album, "Catharsis", has 14 songs including both instrumentals and lyrical pieces. The album doesn't have a story -- it is simply a reflection of my journey through what short part of life I've experienced so far. I want to get this album to the public because I know that others have dealt with the same things I have; if I can show them that they aren't alone in whatever they're going through, then the whole process would be worthwile.

Here is a link to my SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/conradu

If 150 people buy a digital copy of my album, we'll reach our goal. If 75 people buy a vinyl copy, we'll reach our goal. So if you would like to purchase my album, please take this opportunity. Also, feel free to help spread the word on Facebook, Myspace, Friendster, World of Warcraft -- any method whould be greatly appreciated!

Also, feel free to help spread the word on Facebook, Myspace, Friendster, World of Warcraft -- any method whould be greatly appreciated!

story:
Lacrimae Mundi


My Story


A Dramatic Symphony for Stings

My name is Anthony Thers-Crow, I am a composer, totally self initiated from an early age without any coercion from outside, and for the most part I am entirely self taught. The subject of my campaign, ‘Lacrimae Mundi,’ is a large scale symphonic piece, for an equally large string orchestra. It is a canvas of huge dimensions, a journey in music, touching upon lush romantic harmonies moving through expansive deserts of arid dissonance, going in one instance from ‘scenes’ of dramatic turbulence, to almost serene etherial silences. A tapestry thus, in sound. Its overall structure is that of an extensive “Original Theme and Variations.”

A theme is very akin to a seed, an apple pip held in the palm of the hand. Within  already exits, so miraculously concentrated, the future tree with its own character, its root system, its branches, leaves, later blossom, then fruit within which again, those generative pips. Thus a theme, or musical idea, in possession of real essence, contains likewise, entire worlds, of harmonies, rhythms, and possible evolutions which need their own unique time to unfold like a butterfly from out a chrysalis. A piece of music thus requires its own time too, to evolve and fulfill itself, and only thus can the result be fully satisfying. Thus space in time is a very mute point.

The most wonderful thing a creative artist can be given is this crucial and most valuable of all commodities, space in time, to realize his or her vision to the full. This is what I have the audacity to encourage you to grant me now, so I myself can fully realize my visions and  intentions thus hopefully rendering something truly satisfying into the world. This extraordinary work is now in the process of composition but still requires an enormously quantity of intensely concentrated hard work to bring to completion, the most important component being, which is at the very heart of the matter, sufficient time within which to do so. I reckon, the ‘space in time’ needed would be a further fifteen to eighteen months to complete this most joyous task. The object of this project thus, is to gather together a sufficiency of funds, to sustain me during this period, enabling me to live moderately, in relative peace and quiet, without financial worries, so that I can work without interruption to realize this vision that is “Lacrimae Mundi.” In a word, I am asking for the ultimate true artist’s dream. I thus invite you to join me in pursuit of this objective.

Just to give a further glimpse, a bit like a preview, as to what you can expect, musically speaking, the work sets out in the apparent style of a divertimento in ‘innocent’  C major, with a theme announced on  unaccompanied violas (see video) which could be deemed ‘skittish’, but this illusory, as it leads very soon into music of extreme contrasts, turning sudden corners, evoking in the listener equally contrasting emotional responses. The opening motif returns as a ‘Puck’ like character, definitely metamorphosing towards the ‘skittish,’ much like a court jester but in musical terms, in various guises, at one point as a jaunty grotesque march with the theme coming in, in multiple canon and altered forms, on a cluster of solo violins, shrouded in an atmosphere of nightmare, whilst at another point, a surreal dance leading into a huge epic collage, and finally as a cock-a-snoop mocking figure, emerging from a dark landscape of harmonies, as if out of the dust of catastrophe, accompanied as it were by a band of crazy minstrels adding their weird accompaniments, who dance and cajole, twirl and whirl around, an extraordinary phantom ballet evoked by sound, only to fade away into the gloom out of which comes a surprise. The piece is in fact a huge fantasia held together by thematic cohesiveness, thus therefore, truly symphonic. The title though, Lacrimae Mundi, “The tears of the world” is not at all illusory.

A Biographical Note

I was born on 11th July 1950, (née Anthony John William Crowthers) in Newcastle Upon Tyne, into a very original family, all very musically inclined, who have in their own way contributed considerably in their chosen fields to the world and the greater well being of humanity. I discovered music by ‘accident’ so to speak, at the age of twelve, when I unearthed amongst a heap of very dusty junk in the back of our garage, some old 78’s dating from around 1935, with all the labels illegible, faded by time, apart from the still recognizable, just barely visible image of that immortal icon known throughout the world, of the dog looking down the gramophone horn. Intrigued, I snuk back into the house, and started playing them. As soon as the needle touched bakelite, I was entranced, enraptured, and upon that instant everything changed. My world as it were turning upon a sixpence! This was my first experience of classical music, and for better or for worse, music, not so very slowly, was to become the epicenter of my life.
 

The second shock, as if to seal the deal, was administered upon hearing Beethoven for the first time, and thus the ‘die was caste’, and I made at the age of 14 the definite irrevocable decision, never to be revoked, to be a composer. It became my one and all consuming passion. Literally I lived, ate, drank, slept even dreamed music. I spent all my pocket money on buying records and scores, from which I taught myself, amongst other things, the art orchestration. I fell wildly in love with 20th Century classical music, which I investigated with dire alacrity, my first purchased score being Alban Berg’s three Pieces for orchestra, Op.6. Shostakovich, whose music was to me a revelation, became the central musical influence of my life, and is as dear and close to me now, if not more so, than it was then. His music as well as his astonishing personality and shear greatness of soul, profound humanity, and of an extraordinary resilience in the face of terrifying tyranny, has been my great abiding inspiration and he is perhaps above all, the ‘father’ of my musical creativity. To him I owe much.

But, my glee and joy at this totally new orientation of my life was met by very stony faces, not amused you could say, in the least, and there began a ruthless opposition that took on subtle and not so subtle forms and so violent and heavy was the discouragement with which I was dealt, trampling all such aspirations  underfoot over a protracted period of four years, so that by the age of eighteen I was rendered dysfunctional and considerably psychologically disturbed landing me on a psychiatrist’s couch, which was rather ironic, as I was not the one who was insane, but more in an acute state of hyper-distress, a condition directly precipitated by having been forcibly divorced from my life’s true purpose. “Beware of those who seek to destroy the soul,” I got to know a lot about them! But nevertheless this deep love of music never died, slipping as it did deep inside, a cunning exercise perhaps in self preservation, becoming dormant, undergoing a metamorphosis in its inner silence, liken unto mushrooms growing in the dark, only to re-awaken later. I never quite believed the lies and abuse I was subjected to. There is always that deeper self that knows the truth.

In spite of everything though, I did manage in those harrowed schooldays, to compose a piano sonata, the exposition of a very dramatic symphony, a song for tenor voice, clarinet and piano, other songs, and many sketches and fragments for other pieces, and extensive creative plans. I was totally self taught in all these creative endeavors. But alas all had to be abandoned. But nothing though, as I later found out, is ever lost.

So my life took on entirely new contours entering into a series of phases and experiences, passing through as many different professions as I did countries. I ended up as a gourmet chef at a ‘world class’ hotel on the Greek Island Santorini, achieving mention in the press and a certain renown attracting a considerable following. But all the while, whenever spare coins jingled in my pocket, they went to buy a record, a score, music always remaining very close to me. On the 25th February 2009, I took the “Bull by the Horns,” and decided to re-dedicate my life, totally this time, to its true purpose, composition, abandoning everything else. It was ‘now or never’ time. And quite literally everything abandoned me. A reflexive action. Doors slammed shut. Again the forces of opposition and hostility rose up like specters. But this time I ignored them and was perhaps even encouraged, and began working relentlessly hard, from early in the morning late into the night to consolidate my ‘style‘ from which came my first composition in my newly developed idiom, “Requiem for a Friend” for Lyric Soprano and Solo Flute. I laid the foundations for Lacrimae Mundi (see video and story) in the Winter of 2010 in very harsh economic circumstances. But the darkened sky above was not without its stars, two friends sent me a little allowance to sustain me during this period. To them I will be eternally grateful.

But I realized that I had also to find a means to earn enough money to scrape by in such a way that it did not sap my vital energies detracting me as little as possible from my music. Thus, upon an unexpected suggestion of a friend I became a travel guide on Santorini, taking guided tours, up the famous volcano, through the plethora of beautiful villages with which the island is well peppered, visiting some of its extraordinary churches and famous wineries. I was beginning to make a very definite name for myself in this new found ‘career,’ thoroughly enjoying this work, being well and truly in my element, and was set to do very well, when out of the blue, the hand of fate stepped in, in the form of a motorcycle accident, being turned over as I was in the volcanic dust, by my fateful motorbike, ‘Red Cow’, shattering the central bone of my right ankle, the Talus.

All was flung up into the air! Everything was swept away : means of livelihood, lifestyle, practically all my possessions amongst which there was my wonderful library of scores and books accumulated since boyhood, being rendered suddenly homeless, thrown out on my neck by a very ruthless landlord with literally my crutches being thrown after me. Total disaster?..........No! By an extraordinary series of events, guided by that invisible hand which has been protecting me all my life long, I was brought to a small Greek village, Nea Gonia, in North Greece, near to Thessaloniki, where I was taken into the home of angelically kind friends who looked after me while I underwent an extensive series of surgical operations on my feet. They made a very cosy space for me in their home where I was able to set up my music studio. Where in my invalid condition I was yet again able even more so than ever before to focus and concentrate on my music advancing my creativity into new territories, into new heights of expression and exploring new possibilities. So life, after all, had conspired all the while to bring me to this point. This is where you find me now. I am glad to announce that the days of my convalescence are nearing their conclusion and I will able once more to set sail, entering in upon unchartered waters, to continue my musical odyssey. Upon which, the first great gargantuan task will be, the completion of Lacrimae Mundi.

The Fund's intended destiny

I have estimated that the funds necessary  to enable 'Lacrimae Mundi' to be completed will be $45,000 which requires around eighteen months to finish and have the score ready.

          "At the still point of the turning world, there the dance begins."

                                                                                               T.S.Elliot from the Four Quartets

The majority of the money will be used to give me a moderate monthly income to enable me to work in a very much required secluded quiet environment uninterrupted so that I can concentrate without disturbance  to bring this work to complete fruition. I have to add that I am extremely sensitive to sound and thus in this extremely mechanical age with all its alien noises, to find a suitable place to live is an art in itself. But somewhere quiet and a little remote where a bird still sings is not so difficult in the rollings hills of Northern Greece. So there I will endeavor to find that most sought after

                                   'Pool of clear silence, for by it, there the music grows.'

The other expenses will be materials and perhaps  some extra musical equipment, a keyboard, notation software, to help the 'work' along. Not to mention oodles of manuscript paper, rubbers and pencil leads!

What would happen if...........

I do not succeed in achieving my fund goal is that with the monies that I will receive. I will dedicate it to working to complete Lacrimae Mundi, advancing it as far as I can go.

 












 










 




















 



 





Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name is Simon Chadwick and I am a musician based in St Andrews, Fife, Scotland, specialising in the ancient harp music of Scotland and Ireland.

Every year since 2007 I have played a monthly series of summer lunchtime harp concerts in St Andrews.

Last year we moved the concerts to the wonderful Arts & Crafts ambience of All Saints Church Hall - a wonderful venue with a superb acoustic for the harp. We also launched our furst Crowdfunding campaign to support the concert series.

So here we are again! For 2015 we are planning five concerts:
Thursday 6th May, Colainn Gun Cheann: Ranald and the ghost
Thursday 4th June, The contest betwixt fiddle & harp
Thursday 2nd July, Carolan’s Concerto: Baroque Irish harp music
Wednesday 5th August, Ceòl Rígh Innse Gall: Music for the Lords of the Isles
Thursday 3rd September, Heroic music: Tristram, Arthur & Fionn Mac Cumhail

As with last year, we have no institutional support or sponsorship at all - the entire series and its expenses are paid for by you, our supporters and concert attendees.

And, just like every year since 2007, the concerts are completely free admission.

So, do your bit to keep this St Andrews summer institution going, by helping us hit our goal of £500 raised by the day of the first concert in the series. 

Any contribution is welcome - you can contribute as little as £1 which will still make a difference to our work. And please do share this with your friends and contacts. Thanks so much for your help!

story:
Short Summary

  • Introduction // Background: I grew up with the Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers. As a 1st grader, all I wanted to be was that green ranger guy, Tommy Oliver, I watched on TV everyday at 5 o'clock. In October 2001 I got a keyboard for my birthday, started playing in a few bands and began composing my own music. In late 2006 I self-produced my first full-length album, A Break Through. In 2009 I formed my own indie music label, Meda Yin Music, to serve as an umbrella for releasing all my musical projects. To date I have self-produced 8 albums, which will make Destiny & DragonZords my 9th and 10th. In 2012 I added bass guitar to my repertoire. In 2013 I worked at a wellness center and created martial art based work-outs set to Ron Wasserman's Power Rangers Redux soundtrack. I lost 25 pounds that way, regained a slim physique and taught Power Rangers inspired fitness classes, to both children and adults, in a green MMPR shirt, taking on that persona. I dressed up as a white ninjetti ranger at Anime Boston in 2013 and several people told me I looked a little like Jason David Frank (green and white mighty morphin power ranger) and thus Green Ranger Jr was born. Playing along with this look-a-like comparison, I grew out my hair, started slicking it back Tommy Oliver / Green With Evil style and fully satisfied my 7 year old self to be that Green Ranger.  I began hitting my music studio hard in hopes of crafting a new sound, aiming for a style of largely keyboard/synth based rock/pop sound with bass guitar and Power Ranger-themed lyrics. Here I am now, two years later, ready to release a double-disc album two years in the making. Destiny & DragonZords may be my biggest musical accomplishment yet.
  • Campaign description and why it's important to me: As I've said in the end of my Like A Smoke Stack music video, off the DragonZords album which is now on YouTube, one of my greatest dreams and visions for this double-disc project is to see it materialized and mass-produced in physical form; something I can hold in my hands, listen to in my car, give out to friends and family, sell at concerts, and think... "this was my dream. I made it real."
  • Production and logistics: The production of CDs with silver undersides is called "CD replication." I have done some research and made a few phone calls. To create a double-disc jewel cased album with a swing tray (2 CDs inside one jewel case), the minimum one must order is 300 units. With a single sheet insert instead of a CD book (cheapest option) I can order 300 copies for $1,190. I work a day job just like everyone else, paying my own rent, bills, student loans, car payments, car insurance, martial arts tuitions... and unfortunately $1,190 is more than I can afford to pay out of my own pocket to make my vision a reality, as much as I would do it in a heartbeat had I the cash. Hence this crowd-funding campaign. 
  • Magnitude of what you can help me achieve: But maybe this is happening for a reason. Maybe there are people out there who might share in the excitement of the Green Ranger Jr musical experience, and would like to be a part of bringing this idea to life, so that if ever a monster were to attack, Green Ranger Jr will be on-call ready to summon that DragonZord, save Angel Grove, and fulfill his Destiny. Oh wait, I'm Green With Evil. So if you don't fund this project, I kid you not I will summon my DragonZord, find your city and lay it to waste! And there won't be any Power Rangers to help you *evil green ranger laugh* Hmhmhmahahaha. But all that could be avoided if you simply help me out and back this campaign...

What I Need & What You Get

The break down:

  • a run of 300 double-disc albums is $1,190. Max length for indiegogo campaign is 60 days. As music production is nearing completion and I will be putting out a series of music videos to give everyone a taste of what to expect and hopefully get a few backers, the first of which, Like A Smoke Stack, released on youtube May 15th, I will be running two campaigns for $600 each. The first campaign will be for 50 days and carry us to about July 4th. Then the second campaign will be for another $600 and last until the album drop date of August 7th 2015. I wish I could do it all in one campaign, but I'm working with length limits imposed by indiegogo. Also, I'm a big believer in setting small, incremental goals to reach something great, so I don't mind breaking things down into 2 smaller goals if both successful will fund the project.
  • The biggest perk will be an autographed copy of Destiny & DragonZords shipped out to you. But if you are on a budget, I totally understand, and there will be options to get digital singles emailed to you, as well as digital copies of the albums emailed to you. Data-bits are virtually free, so just help me out even a little bit and I will be eternally grateful and generously fill your email inbox with downloadable content :)
  • In the event I do not raise the full $1,190 to mass-produce a limited edition 300 run of Destiny & DragonZords, thankfully I have a lightScribe CD burner I purchased when I self-produced my first album, A Break Through, in 2006, so I will personally make by hand each and every double disc album pre-ordered via these indiegogo campaigns, burning custom artwork on the disc faces (which is what lightScribe does), printing up all the artwork, assembling these double-disc albums myself. I promise you, I will leave no one empty handed or dissatisfied. 

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

  • Every dollar donated to this campaign makes it that much more likely to happen. Dollar by dollar, the dream comes to be. Together, we can make this happen.
  • Why my project is valuable: Most likely, only 300 copies of Destiny & DragonZords will be created, so if you are a fan of Power Rangers or just limited edition items in general, you won't want to miss out.
  • This is my first time crowd-funding for an album, but in the past, I have had success crowd-funding novel projects on two occasions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you like the music and this pitch, please help and share this page via the convenient Indiegogo share tools.

Work Hard. Live Fearlessly. Die Satisfied. -Green Ranger Jr

story:
***NEWSFLASH: Ascension was released to domestic and international listeners on July 17th! Available Now on iTunes, Amazon Music, Bandcamp, Google Play Music, and Spotify.***

What is this campaign about?

Twenty six years; most people are thankful to have full brain development for decision-making skills by this time (well, that’s age 25 but who’s checking?). Fewer can say that they’re looking to cross the musical bridge that a 26-year-long path has led them to. That is exactly what we’re setting out to do in this campaign.

And no, this doesn’t mean we’re asking you to help raise money to build a bridge that plays music. Or to pave a path that will take 26 years to complete.

What we are asking for, with good faith that we’ve budgeted this entire journey as humbly yet realistically as we could have, is for your help in funding the breakthrough album, release, and promo concert tour for Russian-born, Israeli-raised, and San Francisco Bay-based (gasp for air here) classical guitarist Yuri Liberzon.


Who is Yuri Liberzon?

He started pursuing his passion for guitar at the age of 6, and followed his dreams after high school to live and study in a completely different country at Johns Hopkins with Manuel Barrueco and finally Yale for his master’s degree in music with Ben Verdery. He currently has a busy private studio where he teaches students both young and old about the technical and musical aspects of playing classical guitar.

Now, Yuri is confident that his music and passion for guitar can reach beyond the San Francisco Bay Area with the launch of a successful album.

We’re defining success by public buzz, peer recognition, and eventual chart topping that can only be reached by making an investment both financially and by word of mouth, with your help. --------------------------------------------------------------------------->


What Your $ Pays For

Specifically, we’re aiming for producing 1000 prints of his debut album ($13k), between 40 and 80 influential folks attending a get-together to promote the release of the album ($3k), and a concert tour spanning 20 states ($30k). 

If you want even more specifics than that, your contribution also covers: 

  1. recording, 
  2. mastering, 
  3. licensing, 
  4. album art, 
  5. distribution, 
  6. press releases, 
  7. promotions, 
  8. programs, 
  9. transportation, 
  10. lodging, 
  11. ticketing, 
  12. event insurance, 
  13. and IndieGoGo fees. 

Here are the compositions that will be on the album -


So although the goal says $12,799, that's the minimum. We can take Ascension to Billboard and the Grammys, with $46,000. And, we have a financial analyst heading our team so your money is in good hands!

We aren’t friends with the Waltons, the Kochs or the Mars families of the world but we do have allies like you who can help with any and all of the following:

Push for a breakthrough

Birth awesome music

Witness talent


Yes, all of that sounds eerily like we’re delivering a baby. But in a way… that’s kind of true. Investment of time, pain, and then only a world of possibilities ahead after what seems like the worst is over.

To show that we are serious, we’re encouraging you all to fall into one of these tiers depending on what form of gratitude you’d find most acceptable for your level of help --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------->



If you're off the grid...

For those of you without credit or debit cards, we will also accept cash (USD only) or check payments direct to the artist!

Make it payable to: Yuri Liberzon, and mail it to: Mispressivo Music Management, PO Box 2727, Santa Clara, CA, 95055 USA. 

Include your name, mailing address, and/or email address so the perk --------------->

that best matches your contribution will be sent to you once we receive it in the mail, and it will still boost our funding meter. Hooray!


Or, if you want to help but money is tight,

(times are tough, we totally get it), please do help SOCIALLY:

LIKE his page on Facebook

FOLLOW and TWEET about this #Ascension campaign on Twitter

(+1) on Google Plus

SUBSCRIBE and SHARE his videos on YouTube

NETWORK on LinkedIn

BROWSE Online


Maybe your imagination is your best currency!

Questions? Comments? Want to customize a perk? We’d love to hear them! Send them to info@yuriguitar.com and we’ll reply within 48 hours.


T  H  A  N  K      Y  O  U.

-Yuri & team

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sarah Fenwick, I'm a jazz and blues singer in Cyprus, and passionate about promoting these great musical arts. My husband, Savvas, and I have invested almost 30,000 euros in renovating the space for Sarah's Jazz Club, and we need another 15,000 to complete it and buy the equipment needed for a great jazz bar. 

With your help, we can launch Sarah's Jazz Club by the target date of October 2015, and establish a cultural centre in the capital of Cyprus while creating a showcase for talented jazz performers.

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise with your help will go towards paying our construction crew for the final renovations, and towards buying the bar equipment and sound equipment. We're almost there! 

In return, your name will be inscribed on a plaque that will be hung on the wall in Sarah's Jazz Club, with thanks for being a major supporter of the jazz community.

If we don't reach the target of 15,000, the funds that we do raise will go towards the last renovation expenses. 

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference because Sarah's Jazz Club will provide a showcase for young jazz musicians and singers, giving them a place to become known and helping them to build their careers. Jazz is a multi-cultural music and art form, and a fantastic way to build bridges between people. 

As a jazz singer of many years experience, I always love to see the joy on peoples' faces when the first notes of this beautiful music are heard during a performance. I have a vision of bringing this beauty into peoples' lives on a more regular basis with Sarah's Jazz Club.

Risks & Challenges

We do face obstacles - there is a recession in our country, so it's a risk to start a new business now. However, I believe that music can overcome every obstacle and is a welcome way for people to escape pressure and stress. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate any help you can give, by using Indiegogo share tools, even if money is short right now, your shares will help us find donors for the project.

Thank you so much!

story:
Oz Sounds is a full service recording studio located in Nashville, TN founded by friends Conor McEneaney and Ryan McClincy in 2014. 

Over the past year we have made huge strides in our craft, from ear to gear, and we continue to get better with every new project we take on. 

Our most recent venture has been the purchase of a house to build a space that exudes the professionalism and quality product that we produce. However, there is still much work to be done to make the studio exactly how we want. From floor to ceiling there are things that must be done to create an ideal recording environment to produce a better sounding final product. That's where you come in. We are asking you, our friends, family, and surely people we have never met, to help us achieve our goal, and chase our dream. We ask that you put your faith in us, as so many of you have done already, that we may take this to the next level, and we promise you will not be disappointed. 

The money raised will go directly towards the materials and man-power we need to develop the studio top to bottom. Anything you can spare, from $1 to $100 (or more if you're so inclined) will be utilized to the very last fraction of a cent. We feel that in time we will be able to make a large impact in the world of music and art, and with your help the amount of time from now till then will shrink drastically. 

Unfortunately, we do not have anything to give you. At least not anything you can hold in your hand. What we promise is much different. A chance to fulfill a dream, and create something with the potential for greatness. And we also promise to release any material we make of our own volition (i.e. not that of a client) for free. Absolutely. 100%. Free. 

Our drive to do this is not out of a pursuit of money, but rather love. Music and sound is what we love, it is our passion and no amount of money (big or small) will ever diminish that love. And regardless of whether we achieve this goal or not, we appreciate any support given to us, and will continue on our path. So please, help us create a place where passion can thrive and where dreams are no longer forgotten.

story:
We are Mount Lassen Campgrounds.

We are a Christian campground & conference retreat facility located in beautiful Lassen National Forest just 8 miles from Lassen National Volcanic Park. We have been around for over 50 yrs. Our desire is to provide a place where People can come and get away from the busyness of their lives and have an encounter with the God of the Bible. Over the years we have seen many lives transformed. We have seen people come to our camps and give up drugs, alcohol and other addictions. We have seen peoples marriages begin to heal. We have seen young people take the first steps to completely changing the course of their life while at camp. So many great stories have been forged at Mount Lasses Camp.

Now you have an opportunity to be apart of helping forge new stories. We need to make Mount Lassen Camp better. As we improve our camp more and more people want to come and be apart of it. And that means more lives touched and changed.

Right now we are in need of new mattresses. The ones we currently have are old and worn. So we are asking for $2000 to replace our mattresses. But we are hoping that we will exceed this goal and be able to improve the camp in other ways. All the money above and beyond what we need for mattresses will go to fixing up our beautiful camp. So please consider giving. All the money is tax deductable. If you can’t help financially we understand but please consider spreading the word so others can learn about the opportunity.

story:
About Me and the Campaign!

Hi, My names Melisa Kelly, I'm a singer/songwriter based in Glasgow. I've always loved singing and creating music, and for the past five years I have been gigging and writing all around Scotland. I've released an EP and two albums, all with the help of my wonderful music family, with next to no budget and IT'S BEEN A BLAST! This summer having completed my HND at the Academy of Music and Sound, I want to create a new, professional EP of blues music and you can help.


I have written the four track blues EP and through Indiegogo we can make it happen. Musicians don't make much, especially original ones but sites like Indiegogo are starting to turn the tides. Taking the power out of the hands of faceless labels and management and putting it back in the hands of musicians.

What We Need!

I am looking to raise £4000 for this project, it's a big mountain to climb but many hands make light work. So, what is it that this money is for:

  • Recording Costs - £700, we use a fantastic independent studio, ran by a full time sound engineer and musician.
  • Production of CD - £300, from an environmentally conscience company in Ireland who use recycled materials.
  • Session Musicians - £1000, those sexy folks and their talent, we must pay them for their time in the studio. It is a drop in the ocean when you consider the years of practicing with bloodied fingers to be what they are...EPIC!
  • Music Video - £500 venue, extras, costumes, filming and production.
  • Launch Party - £500 venue, staff, food, drink, and sound engineer. We have a super cool Glasgow venue that are only charging for the bare essentials!
  • Launch Night Support - £400, more sexy musicians!
  • Merchandise - £400 t-Shirts, badges, plectrums, posters!
  • PR, Advertising - £200, tickets, posters, promotion!

PHEW!!!!!

Obviously these amounts are rough amounts as there are some £2.16 amounts in there a plenty. Also Indiegogo take 5% of our target amount for the fabulous hosting but also to keep their website going and helping all kinds of great projects.

Anyone who wishes to see an itemized list of expenditure can have it emailed to them directly with all the pennies accounted for :)

What You Get!

Everyone and I mean EVERYONE! that supports the project gets something awesome in return. As you are helping me create my first really professional EP you first have my thanks, and the thanks of those who will be employed to do their creative jobs throughout the process, and paid well for it. Up for grabs!

  • A copy of the new EP! (of course)
  • Framed lyrics of your favorite song and CD's of unheard previous music.
  • A gig in your house! A personalized song about you uploaded to YouTube!
  • An appearance in the music video or an EP song dedicated to you!
  • A VIP booth for you and friends at the Launch.

AND TONS MORE!!!!

Risks & Challenges

Not everything is so easy, it's a lot of money and nobodies a millionaire. But lots of people aiming for one thing can move mountains and that's why crowdfunding works. So what if we don't reach target? Well, Indiegogo promise that even if we don't reach target, we still get the money we raised to do our project on a smaller scale, most crowdfunding websites don't do that!

Also there is a lot of hard work to be done. If we reach target we must fulfill every promise to our backers and then we must make sure to create a truly kick-ass EP and music video to make you all really proud to be part of it. We are answerable to both you and Indiegogo, we certainly don't get off likely!

Being a musician can be frustrating at times because of finance, but we do it because we love it! Using Indiegogo to fund the project means that we can achieve a far higher quality output and still keep hold of creative control.

Other Ways You Can Help

SO, you're looking and thinking 'Hell yeah! I'll fund ya!', thanks bud!

SO, you're looking and thinking 'I don't really have it, but I know some folks who might'. Indiegogo have some great sharing tools for those of you who would like to help in other ways! :)

Thank you in advance for any help you give, you all rock and will be reincarnated as something really cool! Big love!

Melisa Kelly xxx
story_txt:

 Hi, My names Melisa Kelly, I'm a singer/songwriter based in Glasgow. I've always loved singing and creating music, and for the past five years I have been gigging and writing all around Scotland. I've released an EP and two albums, all with the help of my wonderful music family, with next to no budget and IT'S BEEN A BLAST! This summer having completed my HND at the Academy of Music and Sound, I want to create a new, professional EP of blues music and you can help. 

I have written the four track blues EP and through Indiegogo we can make it happen. Musicians don't make much, especially original ones but sites like Indiegogo are starting to turn the tides. Taking the power out of the hands of faceless labels and management and putting it back in the hands of musicians.

story:
Hello, hello?

We decided to set up an IndieGoGo project to help fund our LP. I'm sure you all very well know it can get expensive really quick with studio time, videos, publicity and post production.

We have toured the U.S. playing most of the states, multiple times. Our latest video is in rotation on mtvU and AXS-TV. If you haven't caught it, go over to YouTube and search 'Shake, Shake'.

We have set up a few different rewards for you all if you choose to help us out. So, spread the word and let the rocking (with guitars, real drums, non-autotuned vocals) commence!

story:
About Us:

Leeds Vocal Movement (LVM) is an SATB choir dedicated to providing choral opportunities to a more varied age range - we look to bridge the age gap between Youth Choirs and Choral Societies. We pride ourselves on being an open access choir able to perform an eclectic repertoire to a very high standard. Our inspirational Musical Director, Charlie Rhodes, is strongly of the belief that everyone should be given the opportunity to sing in a choir - watch our video to hear more about us from Charlie and some of our members.


Our Campaign:

LVM is in its 4th year now, and although the choir is as popular as ever, performing in concerts and festivals throughout the year. This year, we are ready for our next big challenge - we have started this Indigogo campaign to create a new website, record an album and upgrade our repertoire with some new music. We are looking for £2,500 for the following:

£500 to cover recording a CD

£800 for new music

£1000 for a new website

£200 for publicity materials


How You Can Help:

With your help and kind donations, you can help us re-launch the choir, attract new members to sing with us, and create even more beautiful music in Leeds. You can claim from our list of perks or just donate however much you like - every little helps.

If you can’t quite spare the money but want still want to help out, we would still value your support through sharing our campaign with your friends and family. Don’t forget to come back to our page for updates, and thanks for your support!


Hugs and love,

The LVM Committee

story:
PressPlay

We are a social tour that began in December, 2013 in Virginia Beach, VA with YouTubers, Viners and artists coming together to start something big.  A year later PressPlay has produced 1 1 full sized Meet & Greet | Concert shows, been featured at both Playlist Tri-State and Playlist Orlando.  PressPlay is gearing up for a 2015 Summer Tour of 10-12 cities, but we need your help!  

Campaign

We got together with our talent and we decided to do this because we as a group want the tour and our talent to grow.  We're going to utilize these funds to produce a 10-12 city Summer Tour, fund our merch store and enhance the tour with new pop up walls, displays and an expansion of our YouNow events.  A few of the talents also need cameras, computers, etc in order to create better content for their fans.
The contributors are helping us grow. We're a very small operation, who has the potential to grow into an amazing tour, management company and group of creators but we will never forget our fans.  We engage our audience every day on YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, Vine and YouNow.  That will never change.  We also love to give back. We've flown two fans to Orlando for a Day at Universal and another fan to LA to broadcast live at our show.

Why do we need to do this?

  • We need $25,000 to launch a 10-12 city summer tour.  It's 100% going to bigger, better venues, ground transportation (tour bus or RV), hotel rooms, etc.  
  • We're going to spend $5,000 of that on more pop up walls, better displays for selling merch and more merch designs.
  • Whatever is left over will go to buy the talent new cameras and laptops (a few of the boys cannot afford decent equipment to make content).
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!

Perks

  • We want to be the tour that gives back!
  • Our perks are what the fans want (we know cause we ask)
  • We want our tour to be a two-sided experience (we are active on YouNow talking about what changes are taking place, new talent being added, etc)
  • If we don't meet our goal, whatever money is raised is 100% going into the tour and improving the quality of our shows, the fans experience and growing into a better experience.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Social media is a growing medium.  We need to prove to the world that it's real and so are we.  
  • We've produced 11 shows around the US.  We have CT, Detroit and New Jersey launched and are readying Dallas, San Diego and a 10-12 city summer tour.
  • If you invest in us, we will prove ourselves to you again and again.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • We will overcome our hurdles because we're motivated, dedicated and if you look at the growth the talent have had from when we launched in March, 2014 until today we are constantly and tireless growing, improving and sharing our progress with you (the fan).
  • Our plan is a 24/7, 365 day assault on social media.  We're going to involve sponsors that not only benefit us (the tour), but our fans. We love involving others who can help us give back to those that support us.

story:
This is album is dedicated to all who have struggled with sadness, tragedy, loneliness, and depression.  

Meet the Artist: Friend Owen

Friend Owen is an alternative project created in 2014 by singer-songwriter and composer Thomas Sulkoske.  Friend Owen blends elements of pop, alternative, classical, and choral music, taking cues from artists such as Keane, Coldplay, Ben Folds, and The Beach Boys.  How I Defeated the Darkness is a concept album featuring a linear story about a breakup, coming to terms with the past, and sharing happiness with those you care about.  In addition to being the sole creative force behind Friend Owen, Thomas Sulkoske writes music for short films, video games, and other forms of entertainment media.  

Meet the Producer: Kevin Heiland

Originally raised as a classical performer and composer, Kevin Heiland began writing and producing electronic music in 2011. Bringing audiences along on for the journey, Kevin strives to create a beautiful and authentic musical portrait of a human story. Kevin acquired a Bachelor of Arts in Music from Truman State University in Kirksville, Missouri. He is currently finishing his Master of Music in Media Writing and Production at the University of Miami in Miami, Florida.

The Budget

From the start of this project, we've been committed to making sure we fairly compensate everyone involved in the realization of "How I Defeated the Darkness".  Here's the break-down:

  • Production, Mixing, and Mastering Fees: $1400
  • Musician and Engineer Fees: $2600 (Includes compensation for 2 engineers, 6 string players, 4 brass players, bass, drums, and guitar.)
  • Distribution, Packaging, and Shipping Fees: $500
  • Marketing, Production, Graphic Design, and Videography: $500
  • Total Goal: $5000

The majority of the project funding is going to musicians (as it should be!).  Without them, there's no way we can realize this music to its full potential. If we exceed our goal, additional funds will be used to provide further compensation for these extremely talented individuals.  

Without your help, we will not be able to record and produce How I Defeated the Darkness in its entirety.  The music is challenging, and we need talented artists and engineers to properly realize it!  If our fundraising goal is only partially met, a shorter EP will be released featuring selected songs from the album.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, we still want you to be part of this story!  Please share with your friends on Facebook or Twitter, and stay in the loop so you can get updates about the progress of the album!  

Above all, we want to put something truly good and fantastic into this world.  Thank you for choosing to be a part of How I Defeated the Darkness.

Sincerely,

Friend Owen & Company

story:
Words from video: 'Hi my name's Owen, and welcome to my crowd funding campaign to open a record store here in Berlin. Whether you're a supporter of independent music, a record collector, music lover or just like getting behind small business, please take 5 minutes to check out the campaign I've put together. Inside you'll see people who have already supported the project such as the Independent newspaper , Fabric London, Inverted Audio and many more. You'll also see the wide range of pledges and rewards for getting behind the campaign. With your contributions I hope together we can really add a great asset to Berlin's music and cultural landscape, thanks again.'

Music by Benjamin Brunn. 
Benjamin Brunn - Acidic Sun [Third Ear] 

             

                           Carousel: A Berlin based record store

"It’s not just a shop, there’s something else going on, it’s like a resource for people, a library for your ears and your mind." Johnny Marr, 2012, Last Shop Standing

Introduction:

Welcome to my Indiegogo for launching Carousel, an online and physical record store here in Berlin, Germany. I'm hoping to extend the existing Carousel business (more about that later) into a record store with a little help from you! You might be wondering, why?

Personally, I want to preserve the physical, tangible side of music. The sort of music that gathers dust, the sort of music friendships in record stores are formed over. These physical moments and places are assets to the music and wider communities.

Despite cherishing these physical forms and moments, I would also like to embrace technology in the store, finding that fine balance between moving forward and looking back. We will play host to EP and album launches, and conduct weekly streams online, connecting music aficionados on a global and local community level.

Although music is clearly my passion, I am approaching this with a rational, well planned business mind. With vinyl sales at record highs in 2014, my years working in various tiers of the music industry and running 2 independent (vinyl releasing) labels, this is the next stage for both Carousel and myself as a young, passionate cultural entrepreneur hoping to add a great new asset to Berlin's rich musical and cultural landscape.

DE:

Einführung:

"Es ist nicht nur ein Laden, es passiert was anderes. Es ist wie eine Ressource für die Menschen, eine Bibliothek für deine Ohren und deinen Geist.” Johnny Marr, 2012, Last Shop Standing

Herzlich Willkommen zu meiner Indiegogokampagne für den Launch von Carousel, einem Plattenladen mit Onlineshop hier in Berlin. Ich hoffe, mit ein bisschen Hilfe von Euch, das bereits bestehende Carousel Unternehmen (dazu mehr später) in einen Plattenladen zu erweitern. Ihr fragt Euch vielleicht, warum?

Persönlich möchte ich die physische, materielle Seite der Musik konservieren, die Art von Musik, die Staub sammelt, die Art von Musik, durch die sich in Plattenläden Freundschaften schließen. Diese Momente und Orte sind eine Bereicherung für die Musik und die größere Gemeinschaft.

Mir liegt viel daran, diesen Aspekt der Musik aufrechtzuerhalten, aber ich will auch die Vorteile des Internets nutzen, um die feine Balance zwischen Vorankommen und Zurückschauen zu finden. Deswegen werden wir EP- und Album-Launches und wöchentliche Online-Streamings veranstalten, um Musikfanatiker auf einer lokalen und globalen Ebene zu verbinden.

Musik ist zwar eindeutig meine Leidenschaft, dennoch gehe ich an dieses Projekt mit einem vernünftigen, gut durchdachten unternehmerischen Konzept heran. Mit Vinylverkauf auf Rekordhöhe im Jahr 2014, meiner Erfahrung in der Musikindustrie und als Betreiber zweier Independent-Labels, wird das der nächste Schritt sein – sowohl für Carousel als auch für mich als jungen, leidenschaftlichen kulturellen Entrepreneur, der hofft, eine Bereicherung für die vielfältige musikalische und kulturelle Landschaft Berlins anbieten zu können.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Carousel has been featured and supported by The Ransom Note, Inverted Audio, Fabric, The 405, Last Shop Standing, Decoded Magazine, The Independent, The Underground, CDR Project, Well Rounded, This Is Why We Dance & HoxtonFM.

_____________________________________________________________________________

What Is Indiegogo?

"Indiegogo is a way for people all over the world to join forces to make ideas happen. Since 2008, millions of contributors have empowered hundreds of thousands of inventors, musicians, do-gooders, filmmakers—and other game-changers—to bring big dreams to life." - Indiegogo, 2015

DE:

Was ist Indiegogo?

"Indiegogo ist ein Weg für Menschen überall auf der Welt, sich zusammenzuschließen und ihre Ideen zu realisieren. Seit 2008 haben Millionen Spender Hunderttausende Erfinder, Musiker, Weltverbesserer, Filmemacher – und andere Impulsgeber – befähigt, große Träume zu ermöglichen." - Indiegogo, 2015

_____________________________________________________________________________

”Ever since I was 12 years old, when my fascination and obsession with music started, I would get on my skateboard and ride down to the local record store. I'd find the most tattooed guy there and have him recommend me a new album once a week. Then I'd learn it and play it on my drums. With internet and technology, there are some great platforms of discovering music, but I would HATE for kids to be deprived of the incredible experience of discovering music through their local record stores. Let's keep record stores alive and well, please." Josh Dun, Record Store Day website
_____________________________________________________________________________

What Is Carousel?

Carousel is an independent record label, agency and record store run by Owen Howells and Mike Davis in Berlin, Germany. Our online version of the record store launches on August 1st.

Carousel also releases electronic music on vinyl and digital formats and is distributed internationally, having received praise from different tiers of the music press and peers. The next step for Carousel is to open a small independent physical record store in affordable disused space in Berlin, this will also double up as a community/exhibition/music venue.

DE:

Was ist Carousel?

Carousel ist ein Independent-Plattenlabel, eine Agentur und ein Plattenladen in Berlin, betrieben von Owen Howells und Mike Davis. Die Onlineversion unseres Plattenladens startet am 1. August 2015.

Carousel veröffentlicht elektronische Musik auf Vinyl und in digitalem Format und wird international vertrieben. Die Veröffentlichungen wurden von der Musikpresse und von Kollegen sehr gut aufgenommen. Der nächste Schritt für Carousel ist die Eröffnung eines kleinen, eigenständigen Plattenladens in einem unbenutzten Raum in Berlin, der auch als gemeinschaftlicher Veranstaltungsraum für Ausstellungen und Musik dienen wird.

_____________________________________________________________________________

“Seit ich 12 Jahre alt bin, als meine Faszination und Obsession mit Musik anfing, bin ich auf meinem Skateboard zum lokalen Plattenladen gefahren. Ich fand den tätowiertesten Typen da und ließ ihn mir wöchentlich ein neues Album empfehlen. Dann lernte und spielte ich es auf dem Schlagzeug. Durch das Internet gibt es einige großartige Plattformen, um Musik zu entdecken. Aber ich würde es für die Kinder sehr bedauerlich finden, wenn sie diese unfassbare Erfahrung, Musik durch die lokalen Plattenläden zu entdecken, missen würden. Lasst uns die Plattenläden am Leben erhalten, bitte.” Josh Dun, Record Store Day Webseite

_____________________________________________________________________________

Who’s behind it?

I’m a 28 year old musician, DJ and record collector from the UK living in Berlin, Germany. I first announced the project in one of the UK’s leading newspapers The Independent.

I studied Music Production & Culture at university and transferred into a Bachelor of Science with honours in Music Technology.  My final dissertation and year of study focused on music markets, the re-emergence of vinyl as a music medium and the business development and planning for Carousel. The head of department whilst taking my studies left me this reference regarding my plans for the store.

Throughout the last decade I’ve worked across various tiers of the music and entertainment industry including digital music services and record stores. I also co - run 2 independant vinyl releasing labels, Carousel (obviously) and the UK-leaning Shades, now up to its 15th record.

DE:

Wer steckt dahinter?

Ich bin ein 28-jähriger Musiker, DJ und Plattensammler aus Großbritannien, der jetzt in Berlin lebt. Das Projekt habe ich zuerst in einer der führenden Zeitungen Großbritanniens, The Independent, angekündigt.

Ich habe Musikproduktion und -kultur an der Universität studiert, bevor ich zu einem Bachelor of Science in Musiktechnologie wechselte, den ich mit Auszeichnung absolviert habe. In meiner Bachelorarbeit und meinem letzten Jahr an der Uni habe ich mich mit den Musikmärkten, dem Wiederauftreten des Vinyls als Medium und den geschäftlichen Entwicklungen von Carousel auseinandergesetzt. Der Fachleiter hat mir dieses Zeugnis hinsichtlich meiner Pläne für einen Plattenladen während des Studiums gegeben.

Im vergangenen Jahrzehnt habe ich auf verschiedenen Ebenen der Musik- und Entertainmentindustrie gearbeitet, darunter digitale Musikdienste und Plattenläden. Ich bin auch Mitbetreiber zweier Independent-Labels, die Vinyl veröffentlichen: Carousel (versteht sich!) und des UK-orientierten Shades (jetzt bei seiner 15. Platte).

_____________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Help me get the word out about my campaign, make some noise.
  • Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to help me reach out on social media platforms.
  • Help by getting this story featured on a blog, ezine or website (this really helps!)
  • Offer your expertise in publicity, campaigning, crowdfunding
  • Follow Carousel on our Facebook and Twitter links below to keep updated with my crowd funding campaign progress.

DE:

Andere Möglichkeiten uns zu helfen:

  • Leute über meine Kampagne informieren. Lasst krachen!
  • Die Sharing-Tools von Indiegogo benutzen, um andere auf Social Media-Plattformen zu erreichen
  • Das Projekt für die Veröffentlichung in Blogs, Ezines oder auf Websites weiterleiten (das hilft besonders!)
  • Eure Kenntnisse in Werbung, Kampagnenarbeit, Crowdfunding anbieten
  • Carousel unter unserer Facebook- und Twitter-Seitenlinks unten folgen, um über den .      
  • Fortschritt unseres Kickstarterprojektes auf dem Laufenden gehalten zu werden.

Thank you

Danke

_____________________________________________________________________________
story_txt:
Words from video: 'Hi my name's Owen, and welcome to my crowd funding campaign to open a record store here in Berlin. Whether you're a supporter of independent music, a record collector, music lover or just like getting behind small business, please take 5 minutes to check out the campaign I've put together. Inside you'll see people who have already supported the project such as the Independent newspaper , Fabric London, Inverted Audio and many more. You'll also see the wide range of pledges and rewards for getting behind the campaign. With your contributions I hope together we can really add a great asset to Berlin's music and cultural landscape, thanks again.'Music by Benjamin Brunn. 
Benjamin Brunn - Acidic Sun [Third Ear]              


                           Carousel: A Berlin based record store
"It’s not just a shop, there’s something else going on, it’s like a resource for people, a library for your ears and your mind." Johnny Marr, 2012, Last Shop Standing

Introduction:
Welcome to my Indiegogo for launching Carousel, an online and physical record store here in Berlin, Germany. I'm hoping to extend the existing Carousel business (more about that later) into a record store with a little help from you! You might be wondering, why?

Personally, I want to preserve the physical, tangible side of music. The sort of music that gathers dust, the sort of music friendships in record stores are formed over. These physical moments and places are assets to the music and wider communities. 

Despite cherishing these physical forms and moments, I would also like to embrace technology in the store, finding that fine balance between moving forward and looking back. We will play host to EP and album launches, and conduct weekly streams online, connecting music aficionados on a global and local community level.

Although music is clearly my passion, I am approaching this with a rational, well planned business mind. With vinyl sales at record highs in 2014, my years working in various tiers of the music industry and running 2 independent (vinyl releasing) labels, this is the next stage for both Carousel and myself as a young, passionate cultural entrepreneur hoping to add a great new asset to Berlin's rich musical and cultural landscape.


DE:

Einführung:
"Es ist nicht nur ein Laden, es passiert was anderes. Es ist wie eine Ressource für die Menschen, eine Bibliothek für deine Ohren und deinen Geist.” Johnny Marr, 2012, Last Shop Standing

Herzlich Willkommen zu meiner Indiegogokampagne für den Launch von Carousel, einem Plattenladen mit Onlineshop hier in Berlin. Ich hoffe, mit ein bisschen Hilfe von Euch, das bereits bestehende Carousel Unternehmen (dazu mehr später) in einen Plattenladen zu erweitern. Ihr fragt Euch vielleicht, warum?

Persönlich möchte ich die physische, materielle Seite der Musik konservieren, die Art von Musik, die Staub sammelt, die Art von Musik, durch die sich in Plattenläden Freundschaften schließen. Diese Momente und Orte sind eine Bereicherung für die Musik und die größere Gemeinschaft. 

Mir liegt viel daran, diesen Aspekt der Musik aufrechtzuerhalten, aber ich will auch die Vorteile des Internets nutzen, um die feine Balance zwischen Vorankommen und Zurückschauen zu finden. Deswegen werden wir EP- und Album-Launches und wöchentliche Online-Streamings veranstalten, um Musikfanatiker auf einer lokalen und globalen Ebene zu verbinden.
Musik ist zwar eindeutig meine Leidenschaft, dennoch gehe ich an dieses Projekt mit einem vernünftigen, gut durchdachten unternehmerischen Konzept heran. Mit Vinylverkauf auf Rekordhöhe im Jahr 2014, meiner Erfahrung in der Musikindustrie und als Betreiber zweier Independent-Labels, wird das der nächste Schritt sein – sowohl für Carousel als auch für mich als jungen, leidenschaftlichen kulturellen Entrepreneur, der hofft, eine Bereicherung für die vielfältige musikalische und kulturelle Landschaft Berlins anbieten zu können.

_____________________________________________________________________________



Carousel has been featured and supported by The Ransom Note, Inverted Audio, Fabric, The 405, Last Shop Standing, Decoded Magazine, The Independent, The Underground, CDR Project, Well Rounded, This Is Why We Dance & HoxtonFM.

_____________________________________________________________________________












What Is Indiegogo?

"Indiegogo is a way for people all over the world to join forces to make ideas happen. Since 2008, millions of contributors have empowered hundreds of thousands of inventors, musicians, do-gooders, filmmakers—and other game-changers—to bring big dreams to life." - Indiegogo, 2015

DE:

Was ist Indiegogo?
"Indiegogo ist ein Weg für Menschen überall auf der Welt, sich zusammenzuschließen und ihre Ideen zu realisieren. Seit 2008 haben Millionen Spender Hunderttausende Erfinder, Musiker, Weltverbesserer, Filmemacher – und andere Impulsgeber – befähigt, große Träume zu ermöglichen." - Indiegogo, 2015


_____________________________________________________________________________

”Ever since I was 12 years old, when my fascination and obsession with music started, I would get on my skateboard and ride down to the local record store. I'd find the most tattooed guy there and have him recommend me a new album once a week. Then I'd learn it and play it on my drums. With internet and technology, there are some great platforms of discovering music, but I would HATE for kids to be deprived of the incredible experience of discovering music through their local record stores. Let's keep record stores alive and well, please." Josh Dun, Record Store Day website_____________________________________________________________________________








What Is Carousel?

Carousel is an independent record label, agency and record store run by Owen Howells and Mike Davis in Berlin, Germany. Our online version of the record store launches on August 1st.

Carousel also releases electronic music on vinyl and digital formats and is distributed internationally, having received praise from different tiers of the music press and peers. The next step for Carousel is to open a small independent physical record store in affordable disused space in Berlin, this will also double up as a community/exhibition/music venue.

DE:

Was ist Carousel?

Carousel ist ein Independent-Plattenlabel, eine Agentur und ein Plattenladen in Berlin, betrieben von Owen Howells und Mike Davis. Die Onlineversion unseres Plattenladens startet am 1. August 2015.

Carousel veröffentlicht elektronische Musik auf Vinyl und in digitalem Format und wird international vertrieben. Die Veröffentlichungen wurden von der Musikpresse und von Kollegen sehr gut aufgenommen. Der nächste Schritt für Carousel ist die Eröffnung eines kleinen, eigenständigen Plattenladens in einem unbenutzten Raum in Berlin, der auch als gemeinschaftlicher Veranstaltungsraum für Ausstellungen und Musik dienen wird.
_____________________________________________________________________________
“Seit ich 12 Jahre alt bin, als meine Faszination und Obsession mit Musik anfing, bin ich auf meinem Skateboard zum lokalen Plattenladen gefahren. Ich fand den tätowiertesten Typen da und ließ ihn mir wöchentlich ein neues Album empfehlen. Dann lernte und spielte ich es auf dem Schlagzeug. Durch das Internet gibt es einige großartige Plattformen, um Musik zu entdecken. Aber ich würde es für die Kinder sehr bedauerlich finden, wenn sie diese unfassbare Erfahrung, Musik durch die lokalen Plattenläden zu entdecken, missen würden. Lasst uns die Plattenläden am Leben erhalten, bitte.” Josh Dun, Record Store Day Webseite

_____________________________________________________________________________





Who’s behind it?

I’m a 28 year old musician, DJ and record collector from the UK living in Berlin, Germany. I first announced the project in one of the UK’s leading newspapers The Independent.

I studied Music Production & Culture at university and transferred into a Bachelor of Science with honours in Music Technology.  My final dissertation and year of study focused on music markets, the re-emergence of vinyl as a music medium and the business development and planning for Carousel. The head of department whilst taking my studies left me this reference regarding my plans for the store.

Throughout the last decade I’ve worked across various tiers of the music and entertainment industry including digital music services and record stores. I also co - run 2 independant vinyl releasing labels, Carousel (obviously) and the UK-leaning Shades, now up to its 15th record.

Wer steckt dahinter?

Im vergangenen Jahrzehnt habe ich auf verschiedenen Ebenen der Musik- und Entertainmentindustrie gearbeitet, darunter digitale Musikdienste und Plattenläden. story:
Short Summary

I auditioned for Teambackpack last year and was eligible to make it to the finals but didn't have the funds to go to Los Angeles and back. This year I want to change that!

What I Need

  1. About $1000 and that's going to cover:
  • The round trip
  • Transportation
  • Hotel
  • Food
  • Extra money for memories
    2. Your support <3 (that's from the heart)


The Impact

This will definitely give me a boost for my career in music. I've been following Teambackpack ever since it was just a small local Bay Area movement and I watched it grow and become a nationwide phenomenon. Seeing all these MCs showing off their talent really motivated me to build my skills. By leaving your name after you donate, I'll be sure to mention you in a future song either by rhyming it or by shouting you out in the end.

Risks & Challenges

If I don't have enough it will definitely be difficult to get around...every donation counts :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Telling other people about this campaign! Check out my own music to see if I deserve your donation :D

story:
Opportunity Music Project brings free private music lessons to deserving NYC kids with a passion for music who would not otherwise have the chance to pursue their dream. 

Four years ago, Juilliard student Jessica Garand started Opportunity Music Project with seven budding violin students. Today, OMP has grown from a passion-driven student experiment to a non-profit organization with 60 students, an orchestra, a summer camp, and a dedicated network of artists, teachers, volunteers, and community audiences.

This Spring, join us to raise $20,000  to grow OMP and accept 100 deserving students from our wait-list of over one hundred applicants. Help these student hopefuls achieve their fullest potential as both artists and leaders in society.

Here's a breakdown of how your contribution will make dreams happen:

In 2013 you joined our crowd funding campaign and helped us grow over 500%. Take a look below to see what you did:

What Does a Typical Student Experience Look Like?

Students at OMP receive the following services:

  • 28 Weekly private music lessons on a string instrument of their choice
  • One-on-one instruction by Juilliard-trained faculty members
  • 28 Weekly orchestral training
  • 10+ yearly performance opportunities
  • Mentoring trips to arts institutions
  • A quality instrument to bring home
  • Summer Camp
  • Service Opportunities to give back to the community
Testimonials from OMP students and parents
"I think I am meant to play the cello! The cello is like my new best friend!"- Morgan, 9 year old OMP cello student
"I am so glad I got to learn the violin so I could come here" -  Aiyanna, 8 year old OMP violin student
"I love violin this year and this summer I practiced even on hot days. Violin is like a breeze in the air.. This expression when you play the violin helps you to be a happy person."- Anai, 10 year old OMP violin student
"My daughter is always getting comments from her schoolteachers that she does not participate and does not speak audibly or with confidence in front of others. So I was a bit amazed tonight to see her actively and joyfully participating in the class. I think this is due in large measure to the environment you create and I think it is wonderful."- Kathryn, OMP parent

Be a Leader, Be the Difference!

Join us for a 45-day journey to give 100 kids in New York City the musical experiences of a lifetime!

With your help, these deserving students will start their studies at Opportunity Music Project in September 2015. Help our student hopefuls achieve their fullest potential both as artists and leaders in society.

If you can’t support us with dollars, don't worry! Your influence, and enthusiasm is equally valuable. You can be part of this landmark year by sharing this campaign on your favorite social media outlets, and by talking about the project with family, friends, neighbors and colleagues. Your voice and influence is just as important! We’re so grateful for any support you can offer. We thank you in advance, all 100 of us.


Check out our campaign video from 2013:


National & International Press 

The Juilliard Journal 

The Globe and Mail 

The News Dispatch 

The Examiner

Univision 41

More About our Great Perks! 






Thank you for being a part of this exciting journey!

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for taking the time to read this page. My name is Tim Chatwood. I am a music composer from Reno, NV.  I have been working on compositions of new music that involve the use of effects and other sound changing means. I am looking for support in attending the premier of my original compositions of solo viola works in Dublin, Ireland.  
Over the past few months, I have composed two new works for viola entitled "Echoes" and "Pushing the Fader". I would love the opportunity to share these pieces with others. My compositions are my way to communicate with others.  

Inspiring New Music 

New music is being written around the world everyday. As composers, sometimes we are unable to attend the premier of our works. Without a composer being at the premier, at times the message of the piece can be lost. 
I will be going to Ireland no matter what, but any assistance would be much appreciated. The $1,800 will be going towards expenses such as travel, equipment, and recording costs after the premier.  

For supporting this project, perks will be available. 

The Impact

Support new music and allowing a composer to see their piece come to life in person. Also, the work being performed at this event will be performed music students in the Northern Nevada area. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Share my dream and this page with family & friends. Use link:
     Indiegogo Link
  2. Like my Facebook page Here
  3. Subscribe to my Vimeo Channel Here

Thank you all for taking the time to consider this project!!!!

You are not just supporting a project, you are letting the creator see their piece come to life!!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
