story:
Who are we?

The Festival committee members are all locals, volunteers, some are musicians and each has a skill to bring to the table, including previous festival and event organising, marketing and street events.

This being Hebden Bridge, the festival atmosphere is made not just by the acts, but by the town and our funky community. We want everyone to see this as an annual calendar event, bringing people back again and again to our beautiful space. 

Think of it as the festival right up your v-alley.

Why do we need your help?

We are raising money because funding is tight and some running costs need covering in advance. These will help with planning a successful event. 

We want the festival to be as accessible to the public as we can. This means free events where possible and affordable, realistic ticket prices for paid gigs and workshops. Ticket sales will generate some money, but not enough to fund the entire festival.

In addition to the fund kindly given by the local council Hebden Royd, we are generating cash through fundraisers, donations, busking and sponsorship & ad sales (for the programme).

We wish to pay as many of the local, new and unsigned acts as well as the more established performers ensuring we bring as many attractive acts to Hebden, all of whom will draw in the visitors to help support our unique community economy.

There will also be skilled teachers leading workshops, sound equipment to hire, story tellers, venues to hire, all the marketing and advertising so we get the message out there and finally the potential of professionally recording the acts perform to share once the event has finished. 

Please donate to ensure we make a splash on the circuit and create a festival for a festive town. Get in from the start to build the vibe and help stitch the fixture into our calendar of special annual events.

What We Need


 What You Get



What if you've got no dosh?

We welcome any help at all so if you want to offer your services free of charge and revel in the atmosphere of the weekend then there is always opportunity to  perform, act, busk, dance, steward, work a mixing desk, be a roady, floor sweeper, beer pourer, food server, lost property finder, spare change asker, litter picker...then get in touch! 
hebdenroots@gmail.com
facebook.com/hebdenroots
twitter hebden_roots

What if you've got no dosh?We welcome any help at all so if you want to offer your services free of charge and revel in the atmosphere of the weekend then there is always opportunity to  perform, act, busk, dance, steward, work a mixing desk, be a roady, floor sweeper, beer pourer, food server, lost property finder, spare change asker, litter picker...then get in touch! hebdenroots@gmail.comfacebook.com/hebdenrootstwitter hebden_roots

story:
Servitor is a drum and dance entity that takes traditional rhythms from around the world and sometimes maintains, those traditions and sometimes mashes them up with heavy grindy sounding industrial music. 

West African, Mediterranean, Mid Eastern, Brazilian, Afro Cuban and North African rhythms have all been featured in the past and there are even more on the way with The Forest Crept Back Into The City.

There are some super-talented artists involved as well as 16 tracks worth of drum and dance along with a multitude of soundscapes.

The best way to experience Servitor is through a live show, which in the past has sent an infectious inclination to scream and dance among people of all ages, backgrounds and creeds. So this campaign is focused on raising money for TWO albums (surprise!) and on groundwork to getting Servitor on the road permanently which means filling the ranks with extremely talented and high energy drummers and dancers. 
Watch the video, check out the perks, take a listen.
GET SLAM PUNCHED RIGHT IN THE DANCE BONE!!!!!

story:
Introduction

Hey everybody!
We are be the moon! Some of you know us and some of you are new to our music! In either case, WELCOME! We are an Americana/Indie-Rock band from Mebane, North Carolina. We are raising funds to release our second recording project titled Golden Age. This album is the follow-up to our 2011 EP Streetlight Views. Golden Age is also our first "full-length" recording project. These songs represent 18 months of tireless work from ourselves and a dedicated team of recording staff. Your contribution will help us get the culmination of this work out to our fans here and abroad! 

Golden Age track sneak peek!!!  https://soundcloud.com/be-the-moon/golden-age-p...

What We Need & What You Get

OK! So here's what we are asking for...we need $2,500.00 to finish up this project. We have work diligently to keep our costs down in order to make this record. This has included have TWO separate studios donate their time and expertise to help us record an mix Golden Age. This $2,500.00 will go towards a few things:

1. Covering the cost to "master" of the album (which is, essentially, the "gloss coat" to make the music shine). This process helps make the album ready for radio airplay and general release by enhancing the audio quality of the overall recording.

2. The manufacture and shipping of the physical discs. This means CD's...for the last 4 years we have been relying completely on digital copies of our music being passed around by fans. However, we have had a large number of fans request physical copies of our music. In response to this, we are going to do an initial run of 300 discs for for Golden Age! This will account for $600.00 of the budget.

3. Merchandise! Folks...we need some shirts, bumper stickers, hats, and whatnot! Why? Well, we're glad you asked! Believe it or not this is one of the best ways that we can keep ourselves on the road. To those of you who have never played music for a living...it does NOT always pay the best! Now this is due to a variety of factors. However, having merchandise that we can sell at shows allows us to have a separate revenue stream that will cushion us on those "lean" paying shows. Plus, it helps us leave our band name in new markets which, in turn, can help us grow a larger fan base. In other words, it helps a LOT! This will account for, roughly, $600.00 of our budget

4. Publishing. Now this is where the music business side comes in. Publishing helps to ensure that everybody is protected from possible illegal use of our music. In other words, it protects us from someone (or a group of someones) taking our songs and claiming them as their own. That happens more than you think. We will be contracting with ASCAP which is an industry leader in protecting guys like us. This will cost $50.00

5. Release promotion. On top of getting the album finish from a production and physical standpoint we also need to TELL folks that we have a new album out. This also costs some money. We will be engaging in a focused media campaign to let people know about us and Golden Age. We will be employing advertising via Facebook and in the community. This will take about $500.00

Now, what happens if we don't make it? Well, in that case we'll have to evaluate what we can trim from the list and still get the record out...but that's NOT going to happen! Why? Because we have the best, most supportive fans in the world and you kind people will come through!

But wait...there's more! We've got a LONG list of awesome and amazing perks that you will receive for helping us fund this project! We'll have autographed CD's, lyric sheets, guitar strings from actual shows, and all manner of other wonderful things!

    What Golden Age Means For You & Us

    By contributing you are enabling us to take the next step in our musical journey. We have poured our hearts into the making of this record and we want the world to hear it! Your contribution helps to make that goal possible!

    Challenges

    For those of you that follow us, you KNOW that this album has been a LONG time in the making! For those of you that are new to be the moon...let us enlighten you! We started making this album in November of 2013...yeah, 2013. At that time we thought that we could record AND release it in six months...that turned out to be wrong. In the middle or recording we had a lineup change in the band and that triggered a rethinking of the entire record. We decided that the material we were working on at the time could be better...no, it NEEDED to be better. So we started from scratch and made the entire album over again! 18 months later...here we are. It has been difficult and tedious at times. However, we feel that we have made the best album that we possibly can at this point in our career. Did we feel like giving up along the way? Sure...but we didn't...and we're not now. Help us overcome the last hurdle to releasing the album by contributing. Every little bit helps...and THANK YOU!!!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute...we understand! Would you mind sharing out our Indiegogo campaign and helping us spread the word? It doesn't cost a dime and we'll be eternally grateful!

story:
We are Shangl Hangl; for almost 6 years we have been cultivating a cultural melting pot of different musical and creative talents in the heart of Berlin's artistic centre, Neukölln. 

Through workshops, concerts, exhibitions and generally maintaining an atmosphere that attracts creative people to come and relax, rehearse or co-create we have built a reputation, both among artists and audiences, for high-quality Swing, Jazz, Flamenco, Arabic and many other styles of live music.

This has always been a non-profit labour of love for the constantly evolving group of people involved, and for this reason we want to continue.

Now we have to find a new home, so we will use this as an opportunity for progression and to find a bigger place, where we can go louder for longer while maintaining the Shangl Hangl 'living room' vibes that everybody knows us for. But we need your help to do this!

We have asked for €10000. This might seem like a lot, but to make our dream venue we could spend a lot more!

This money will cover sound insulation, furniture (such as chairs and tables and a bar) and some equipment for the stage, such as lights, amplifiers and drums.

What we can offer you:

€1: A Shangl Hangl souvenir (to be determined)*

€10: An invitation to the exclusive donors opening party with welcoming drinks**

€50: A membership card for 3 months that entitles you to free entry to every show and 2 free drinks per visit

or

A copy of the CD we will produce featuring all of the artists we are associated with.

€100: A membership card for 6 months that entitles you to free entry to every show and 2 free drinks per visit

or

A copy of the CD we will produce featuring all of the artists we are associated with, signed by as many of the artists as possible.

or

A super-limited-edition Shangl Hangl screen-printed T-Shirt

€250: A membership card for one whole year that entitles you to free entry to every show and 2 free drinks per visit

or

A copy of the CD we will produce featuring all of the artists we are associated with, signed by as many of the artists as possible, with your name in the cover

€500: A membership card for life that entitles you to free entry to every show and 2 free drinks per visit, plus your name on a plaque in the bar

or

A copy of the CD we will produce featuring all of the artists we are associated with, signed by as many of the artists as possible, with your name in the cover PLUS a super-limited-edition Shangl Hangl screen-printed T-Shirt

*Everybody who contributes will get one of these

** Everybody who contributes above €10 will be invited to this party

If we don't make the €10000 then we will first do the sound-proofing and acoustic design of the room, and purchase whatever equipment we can afford. The rest we can do as we go along (just like we did in Shangl Hangl before)

This is your opportunity to help a whole host of talented people in a unique, on-going and genuinely valuable way. There is a desperate need for a good-quality, late-night live music venue in Neukölln, and with our experience and connections to the massively eclectic, talent-filled scenes in this wonderful creative city we are just the people to provide it.

Having learned all we have so far we will take a lot of care in picking a new location; neighbours, accessibility and atmosphere will be our main priorities. We really want to be able to have the cool, late-night jams we've all come to love without causing any discomfort for anybody. Plus if we really do achieve these aims we'll be able to have a more varied programme of music, giving all kinds of bands a place to perform.

Please help us to spread this campaign across the world; even if you can't contribute anything yourself share the links and tell everyone you know. There's a lot of people out there who love live music and want to keep it alive!

story:
Summary

Hi all, I am trying to raise a part of the funds needed in order to be able to record and release my first solo piano cd which will include Classical and Contemporary Music works.

The cd will be published and distributed both digitally and physically.

Your support is fundamental because recording a CD needs several expenses that must be afforded by the artist.

In the past i have recorded a couple of pieces for compilations of classical and contemporary music and now is arrived the time to record an entire cd by myself.

My main interest lies in discovering new music both from past and from the present, one of the tasks of the cd is to join classical and contemporary music which haven't be played a lot until now.

Here you can listen a couple of previous studio and live-cd recordings:

I really hope to receive your support, on my website you can find additional information about me and additional recordings: http://vitantoniocaroli.jimdo.com
The cd will be recorded in July and August 2015, Mixed and Mastered in September and October and published in November 2015.

How the funds will be used

The funds will be used in order to cover the costs for:

- Recording, Mixing, Mastering

- Distribution


I prefer to be short and I hope to receive your kind support.


Thank you!

story:
The sexually intimidating (or just very tall?) duo of Hannah Kloepfer and Tessa Hope Slovis have a lot to say about love. After a sold out show at the Duplex, hit performances in Feinstein’s/54 Below’s inaugural Concert Lab, a few unceremonious breakups, and a lot of bad Coffee Meets Bagel dates, the girls have some plans to bring their show to a computer screen, tv and stage near you.

Who We Are: Tessa Slovis and Hannah Kloepfer met as freshman at Barnard College and Columbia University. After graduating they joined forces to begin writing their own cabaret series about their lives as young women in New York City. What has developed is a highly theatrical, heart-on-its-sleeve theater experience, featuring powerhouse arrangements of pop favorites, Golden Age Broadway tunes updated for 2016, and brand-new songs by female songwriters.

What’s up with us Now:  We are headed to 54 Below on April 6th at 9:30pm, But we can’t do it alone. We need your help to keep our show running!

Where Your Money Goes:

    • Supporting our team: That includes allowing us to pay our director, musicians, production team, tech staff and guest artists. We make art because we love it and we want to be able to support our fellow artists as much as we can!
    • MultiMedia: Your donations help us to  keep our website up, and will help us launch our webseries and other multi media projects that we’ve been brainstorming over the past year!
    • Supporting Our Shows: rehearsals spaces, stages and technical fees are expensive! Your donations help us keep our show on the road!

story:
The Short Story

  • We're a small, independent music production company supporting one artist—Reid the Martian. Our people have many years in the music business, doing things like playing drums with Davy Jones of the Monkees and marketing and promoting 5 gold and 2 platinum albums for a national record label. 
  • Our producer has had hits with Lupe Fiasco, Ne-Yo, Musiq, Jamie Foxx, Trey Songz, Young Jeezy, Kanye West, and Diddy.
  • We believe Hip Hop is the most poetic and culture expanding genre in music today, and Reid the Martian has the ability to take this form of music to new heights.
  • We also believe this is how the music business should be run. It should be about developing and supporting amazing artists—not just signing the newest young turk who will get chewed up and spit out in a year's time. It’s creating art for the sake of enriching the world. And that’s exactly what you’ll be doing when you support this project.

Who Is Reid the Martian?

Reid the Martian, aka Reid Smith, is a hip hop (and then some) artist from Lawrence, KS who’s like no one you’ve ever heard. He raps. He sings. He plays the drums, guitar, and keyboards. He produces unique beats that reflect his love of old-school hip hop, 60s and 70s rock, Broadway tunes, and drumline.

He’s been described by industry pros as a cross between Justin Timberlake and Eminem, and a “hip-hop novelist” by producer DJ Toomp. His authentic and intricate lyrics, combined with his awesomely singable and memorable hooks, have won him fans from ages 8 to 80. (Not an exaggeration.)

Reid’s first EP, Hardball, was released in 2015. We could tell you how awesome it is, but instead of taking it from us, take it from some critics:

  • "This isn't just music to Reid, it's art, and he uses every arsenal at his disposal to make sure he makes the best product available, and he does just that with Hardball." 
  • "Reid the Martian's music is poignant and speaks to the human condition, crafting hip hop for a new generation of fans." 
  • "In a way, Hardball feels like the era-defining anthem, despite being hot off the press." 
Better yet, judge for yourself:

Who's Raising the $?

Smith Bender/Scott Free is a small, but full-of-heart music production company working exclusively with Reid the Martian. Over the past four years, we’ve watched him develop as a songwriter and producer. In 2014 we spent several weeks with Reid in Los Angeles and Atlanta working with some of the biggest names in hip-hop today. Seeing him excel in that environment was what made us realize he's the real deal.


In that same time period, we also realized that the big labels aren’t interested in working with an artist who hasn’t already “made it.” Basically, as many of you know, an artist has to do all the work the labels used to do, just to get them to give you a look. Given that experience, we decided to take a page out of Macklemore’s and Kansas City’s own Tech N9ne’s books and go the independent route.  

Our Team

It’s not just us at Smith Bender/Scott Free who believe in Reid. Here are a few of the players who’ve signed on because they believe Reid has the potential to be big. Like international superstar big.


Melita Irie - Reid the Martian's hype lady was born into music and the arts through her parents' reggae band, Deepa Reality, and her grandparents' admiration for jazz and dance. She has performed her whole life, from West African dance to musical theater to contemporary arts, and she found a place in live production when she moved to Lawrence, KS in 2013.She co-wrote and is featured on several of the songs on the new album and we’re proud to have her the team. 

        


Diego - Our great on-stage DJ. Diego plays a major role in RtM's live vibe, and makes sure everyone's having a good time, all the time. 

Miykal Snoddy - one of rap’s top producers, he has signed on to  produce this album. His credits include Ne-Yo, Musiq, Jamie Foxx, Trey Songz, Young Jeezy, Kanye West, and Sean Garrett. In his own words, he says: “My feeling is that if you’ve got the right words or phrase, people will receive it.” And he believes Reid’s got it. As you might guess, he wouldn’t put his name on just any project.

                       

Henry Diltz - the iconic rock ‘n’ roll photographer, will be the photographer for the album art. He was one of just two official photographers at Woodstock and has shot more than 200 album covers for artists including The Doors, Eagles, Crosby Stills & Nash, Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr, Jimi Hendrix, The Rolling Stones, James Taylor, The Monkees, The Mamas & The Papas, and hundreds more. He was there for the seminal moments in music history. This puts Reid in some very exclusive company.

The Current Project

After promoting Hardball throughout 2015, Reid went back into the studio in December (2015) to record his first full-length album. It was originally planned to be just a five-day session, since we had a modest budget. But once we heard the rough mixes of what Reid was recording, we did an about face about the budget and knew it would be a mistake to underfund the album and rush it out.

That's why we need your help.

What We Need

We need to sell enough product in advance to finish recording properly, create packaging, and market and promote Reid’s album in the way it deserves. What does that look like? Here’s a down-and-dirty budget.

  1. A watershed album doesn’t get recorded quickly or on the (too) cheap. We’ll need $11,000 to finish in the studio. This includes tracking, mixing, and mastering. 
  2. Creating a great album doesn’t do any good if no one hears it. We need to market and promote the heck out of it to get it to the public. That’s another $5,000.
  3. High-quality music videos are the next step to getting Reid’s music out around the world. We can do top notch production of two videos for $6,500. Check out Reid's YouTube channel to see what we did last year. (While you're   there, please subscribe. Every fan helps!)
  4. Any additional money we get? That goes right back into marketing, PR, and whatever else needs to happen to get Reid’s name and music out there.

What You Get

We worked hard to put together some pretty cool and unique products for supporters like you. Of course, we're offering the traditional digital downloads, bonus tracks, and physical CDs, (which we're confident you'll love), but we also have some off the chain, one-of-a-kind items that you will not find on any other crowdfunding campaign. Many of these products and perks reflect Reid's interest in KU Basketball, KC Chiefs, KC Royals, and The Beatles. 



Your Impact

For the past 4 years, we’ve supported Reid's efforts and seen him develop as a songwriter and producer. We’ve seen highly successful rap and hip hop producers like Duane Da Rock, DJ Toomp, and Miykal Snoddy go from saying, "Who is this skinny white boy?" To, "Damn, I wanna work with this guy!" in the course of one session.
He’s got the talent. He’s got the drive. He’s the only rapper ever featured on the cover of a Hallmark greeting card, for crying out loud! All he needs is to be heard by a larger audience. We hope we can count you as one of our supporters so that can happen. 


Risks & Challenges

There is little risk when it comes to completing the project because we have a track record as executive producers that shows we can complete high quality projects on time and within a modest budget. That means anyone who contributes is going to get the product we promise and it will be very good indeed.

The challenge will be promoting the CD and getting people to take time to listen. Let's face it, there's a lot of talent in the world so we'll need to make the most of our marketing and PR budget to cut through the clutter. We learned on previous projects that having a a unique story to tell goes a long way in getting the attention of bloggers and reviewers. Having Miykal Snoddy and Henry Diltz working on the project will be the hook that gets them interested. Then, once they hear the music, we feel confident they'll like it and share it with their readers and listeners. 


Other Ways You Can Help Us Help RtM

We appreciate every single person who enjoys Reid’s music and know not everyone can kick in the cash to help out. If you like what you hear, though, there are other ways we can use your support.

  • Listen to and like Reid’s music on SoundCloud. Leave comments, and download the Hardball EP for free.
  • Like the official Reid the Martian Facebook page. 
  • Subscribe to Reid's YouTube Channel.
  • Spread the word! Send the above links to your network and tell them what you think of the music. (We’ll even give you a shout out as part of the RtM street team!)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.
story_txt:
The Short Story  We're a small, independent music production company supporting one artist—Reid the Martian. Our people have many years in the music business, doing things like playing drums with Davy Jones of the Monkees and marketing and promoting 5 gold and 2 platinum albums for a national record label. 
Our producer has had hits with Lupe Fiasco, Ne-Yo, Musiq, Jamie Foxx, Trey Songz, Young Jeezy, Kanye West, and Diddy.
 
We believe Hip Hop is the most poetic and culture expanding genre in music today, and Reid the Martian has the ability to take this form of music to new heights. 
 We also believe this is how the music business should be run. It should be about developing and supporting amazing artists—not just signing the newest young turk who will get chewed up and spit out in a year's time. It’s creating art for the sake of enriching the world. And that’s exactly what you’ll be doing when you support this project.



Who Is Reid the Martian?
Reid the Martian, aka Reid Smith, is a hip hop (and then some) artist from Lawrence, KS who’s like no one you’ve ever heard. He raps. He sings. He plays the drums, guitar, and keyboards. He produces unique beats that reflect his love of old-school hip hop, 60s and 70s rock, Broadway tunes, and drumline.

He’s been described by industry pros as a cross between Justin Timberlake and Eminem, and a “hip-hop novelist” by producer DJ Toomp. His authentic and intricate lyrics, combined with his awesomely singable and memorable hooks, have won him fans from ages 8 to 80. (Not an exaggeration.)
Reid’s first EP, Hardball, was released in 2015. We could tell you how awesome it is, but instead of taking it from us, take it from some critics:


"This isn't just music to Reid, it's art, and he uses every arsenal at his disposal to make sure he makes the best product available, and he does just that with Hardball." 


"Reid the Martian's music is poignant and speaks to the human condition, crafting hip hop for a new generation of fans." 

"In a way, Hardball feels like the era-defining anthem, despite being hot off the press." 


Better yet, judge for yourself:



Who's Raising the $?Smith Bender/Scott Free is a small, but full-of-heart music production company working exclusively with Reid the Martian. Over the past four years, we’ve watched him develop as a songwriter and producer. In 2014 we spent several weeks with Reid in Los Angeles and Atlanta working with some of the biggest names in hip-hop today. Seeing him excel in that environment was what made us realize he's the real deal.
In that same time period, we also realized that the big labels aren’t interested in working with an artist who hasn’t already “made it.” Basically, as many of you know, an artist has to do all the work the labels used to do, just to get them to give you a look. Given that experience, we decided to take a page out of Macklemore’s and Kansas City’s own Tech N9ne’s books and go the independent route.

Melita Irie - Reid the Martian's hype lady was born into music and the arts through her parents' reggae band, Deepa Reality, and her grandparents' admiration for jazz and dance. Miykal Snoddy - one of rap’s top producers, he has signed on to  produce this album. His credits include Ne-Yo, Musiq, Jamie Foxx, Trey Songz, Young Jeezy, Kanye West, and Sean Garrett. As you might guess, he wouldn’t put his name on just any project.

                       
Henry Diltz - the iconic rock ‘n’ roll photographer, will be the photographer for the album art. He was one of just two official photographers at Woodstock and has shot more than 200 album covers for artists including The Doors, Eagles, Crosby Stills & Nash, Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr, Jimi Hendrix, The Rolling Stones, James Taylor, The Monkees, The Mamas & The Papas, and hundreds more. story:
Short Summary

The 'Babylon Tour' is set out to be an epic adventure. The plan is simple enough; move across the United States & Canada in search of Whitewater to run on a Riverboard while meeting other Riverboarders and members of the Whitewater Community.

Riverboarding is an up-and-coming Whitewater Sport that has silently been developing in the shadows of other extreme river sports such as whitewater kayaking and rafting. 

In France, to where the sport's origins can be traced, it is known as 'Hydrospeed' and already holds a place among popular river sports (leagues and regular competitions), but in the past few years the sport has begun to bloom and new branches/disciplines have developed within the global community of boarders; some concentrate on competition and speed, others on challenging new rivers, others focus on freestyle surfing on river-waves or hucking large waterfalls.

The sport is now in a period of growth, and after the 2nd ever Riverboarding World Championship in Guatemala in October of 2015 it was clear that the greatest concentration of Riverboarders outside of France - is in North America - and it is these people that have the best hope of really propelling this sport into the future.

This is how the idea for the "Babylon Tour" was born. 

This is not necessarily a mission to find the biggest rapids nor the most challenging runs (though any opportunity to do so will surely be taken), but rather a road-trip focused on popular river-runs and the people that make up the North American Whitewater & Riverboarding Communities.

It is a chance to promote the sport around people who live and breathe the river and hopefully help in the process of making Riverboarding as popular and accessible as Kayaking or Rafting is today.

My name is Asaf and I have been Riverboarding for years now in places like Southern Chile, Kenya, Uganda, Peru, Guatemala and Israel.

During the tour, I will be moving from place to place along a general plan that will take me criss-crossing the US & Canada. I will be hosted along the way by friends and other Riverboarders and they will show me around their local spots. 

This will all be published on social media for people to be able to follow my travels and/or get involved in any way they can - from advice and tips, to hosting & work options, to offering contacts and information, gear - and of course, funding.

The trip is planned to be many months in length and will cover thousands of kilometers/miles. Most of the generated funds will go towards food & travel costs as I move between the people who have offered to take me in for a few days.

Every dollar counts and it is only through the contributions of individuals, organizations, and businesses that this journey will be successful. 

If you can, please consider donating to this historic, once in a lifetime quest to put Riverboarding on the map.

story:
Support my next Single and Album

The purpose of this campaign is to fund the release of my next single and to finish producing my next album.  I've been very fortunate with my music so far, considering it's all been done in a DIY kind of way with a close knit group of helpers.  A lot of it looks like there's influence and money behind it.  There isn't.  There are great talented friends, believers and a whole lotta love.  For that, I am truly blessed.  Now I would like to reach more people with my music, and that is why this campaign is so important to me, and to the loyal band of fans and colleagues who have stuck by me through thick and thin. 

What We Need and What You Get

I have written and recorded a single for the new movie ‘Blood Orange’ starring Iggy Pop.  The song is called 'Money Kills Love' (a title taken from the screenplay).  We've also made a video and we are releasing the song and the video on 3rd June 2016. I've done pretty well so far without any marketing at all for my music, but I think it's the right time to give my music the same opportunity other artists have who DO have promotional support, and I need some help from you to make that happen!


Our first goal is to raise £4,000 - which would cover everything we would ideally like to do that will be involved with releasing “Money Kills Love”, including Marketing & PR budget to sufficiently promote the single and the video.  This would also help pave the way for my next album.

The breakdown of these costs is:

  • Single Marketing & PR (25%) - £1000
  • Single Radio and TV Promotion (50%) - £1500
  • Album Mastering (12.5%) - £500
  • Artwork, Design & Video expenses (12.5%) - £500
  • Campaign support team (5.5%) - £220
  • Indiegogo (5%) & Paypal fees (2%) - £280

If you would like to take part and help turn this dream into a reality, you can make a contribution to the campaign by choosing one of the special edition perks - see right hand column of this Indiegogo webpage. Any contribution would be a huge help!


The Impact

Making new music popular is not an exact science and you never know what will happen when you release a song.  Over the last few years, I've released songs that have done pretty well, and that was without any marketing at all. 

  • Being able to promote this song could lead to more opportunites for my music.
  • Everything else I've released without promotion has always been received well by everyone I have managed to reach.

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating money isn’t an option at this time, that's ok.  Simply sharing this webpage with your friends in an email, or on facebook and other social media sites would be wonderful.

Thank you so much for taking part, I am grateful and extremely hopeful for this opportunity.

Love and light,

Tim x

Reviews

“His labour of love is universal” Q MAGAZINE

"Tim's haunting and compelling, it'll be fascinating to hear what he does next.” NME

“Possibly the concept album that Ray Davies never wrote about Soho.” DAILY EXPRESS

“As much Peter Ackroyd as Pete Townshend.” FATEA MAGAZINE

“A kaleidoscope of musical styles and songs.” GET READY TO ROCK

“Priase for Blood Orange” – Top 12 movies for lovers of music in 2016 - GIGWISE

story:
Summary

The goal of this Indie Go Go campaign is for Abandon Theory to finish the Live @ the Drive-In album.  We need to pay the recording engineer and have the project mastered and duplicated.  These costs will be further outlined later on.  We have some great perks as our way of saying thank you for helping us to create this album.

We are an independent, original, banjo rock trio based in Sacramento, CA.

  -Independent means we have no record label financially backing us.  

  -Original means we create music that is unique and personal to us and our fans. 

 And that is why we are calling on like minded people to help us create something we can all appreciate and benefit from.

We have big time fun playing music.  It comes naturally for us, there is nothing forced about it, the result is infectious and it seems almost magical.  "Abandon Theory literally stopped me in my tracks with their charisma and originality." - Dean Haakenson (musician).  


*You can listen to one of the songs from the live show here:  LISTEN HERE 


THE PROJECT:

Although we have recorded 4 studio albums, our passion is playing live.  And to that end, our fans have been asking for a live album for quite a while.  So last year we booked a drive-in movie theater as the venue for our live album.  We played for hours as the California sun was setting and cars kept streaming into the parking lot.  As soon as the show ended and it was dark everyone ran back to their cars to watch the movie.  It was a great night and we got some great recordings!  We selected 12 songs that recreate the feeling and flow of the night.  These particular songs mean a great deal to us - they come from our life experiences and from the heart. They speak to the nature of the human experience and the joys and challenges that come with taking life's journey.  The music and lyrics can be humorous or reflective, the songs can be folk-based, up-and-funky, or even  electronic sounding.  “I can’t believe there are just 3 of you, your sound is so big and full!”  - anonymous fan. 

THE EXPENSES:

-First we need to pay the recording engineer for capturing the sound at the live show.   $425

-Next we need to recoup some equipment loses.  Jhon, the bass and banjo player also does the mixing, editing, and producing for the band, which saves a ton of money in studio costs.  He created most of the “It Is” album and the entire “Acoustic” album from his home studio.  While he was working on the Live @ the Drive-In album his computer crashed and could not be fixed.  Therefore a new computer and software are needed to finish this project and create future recordings.  = $3,700

 -Then comes the mastering.  This is the process that utilizes super expensive equipment and a very fine tuned ear to add the sparkle and depth to the recording.  It makes the recording sound as good as other professional/radio worthy music, and is required by iTunes and other digital media outlets.  $700

-The final step in the musical process is duplication.  This is the process of professionally creating the cd’s and the cases with our art work, and packaging it all up.   $1,542

 -And lastly the fees involved in running the campaign and processing the payments add an additional .085% to the total.

Which makes the grand total that we need to put the Abandon Theory – Live @ the Drive-In Album in your hands... $6,900.00


The Song List:

Oceans and Waves

Baby

Get It While The Gettin’s Good

Red

Money's not Success

Raven Hair

Kisses On My Head

Cinderella Ride

When We Arrive

Modern Day Hippie

Fortified

As Perfection


WHY AREN'T THEY GIGGING MORE TO PAY FOR THIS THEMSELVES? 

Jhon, the bassist and banjo picker, has been battling a debilitating autoimmune disease for several years.   It has caused the band to cancel shows & tours, which is really bad for credibility.  Most gigs are scheduled 3 months or more in advance, and live shows take a great deal of energy.   So until Jhon's health can be more reliable, the band has been unable to commit to most gigs.  That being said, he is doing all that he can to restore his health.


About the band

Abandon Theory has been explained as "the Violent Femmes meets Jack Johnson at a rave." -  anonymous fan.   “The band has a groovy, acoustic roots style that is both lively and dynamic.” -  J. DLT. Sacramento News and Review.

Abandon Theory is a three-piece banjo rock band that sounds much larger.  Jesse (vocals and acoustic guitar) creates melodies that catch your ear and transport you to another place.  The lyrics do the same as they weave captivating stories or invite you to ponder philosophical quandaries.  Randy (drums) has a unique set up that adds bongos and timbales to the traditional drum kit.  He has a polyrhythmic style, which creates the illusion of a drummer and a percussionist playing simultaneously.  Jhon completes the trio with bass and banjo.  He makes the people move by adding the  groove, and infuses the music with energy by adding spirited solos.  His style is creative and non-traditional (he uses effects that are usually reserved for the electric guitar) on both the bass and banjo. 

Abandon Theory creates a world of harmonious contradictions.  Their music can be relaxed and acoustic, or exciting and danceable, fun and light hearted or thought provoking and contemplative.  They are as much at ease playing a waltz, a reggae groove, or a club beat.

You might guess that the target audience for Abandon Theory would be hippies and the party crowd, and they do make up a significant percentage of the fan base.   However, at an Abandon Theory show you are as likely to see an elderly couple swing dancing, as grade school kids enthusiastically jumping up and down.

The band loves to play music together and never shies away from an opportunity to perform.  They have played every type of venue across the country from coffee shop to honky-tonk, and back yard party to amphitheater. After playing a show at a notoriously rough hard rock/metal club, the promoter, Jay Pate, was quoted in the newspaper the next day “Anyone that brings a banjo on stage at the Town Pump might expect to be attacked with a pool stick, instead Abandon Theory commanded the audience’s attention with intelligent lyrics, jumpy hooks, and enough dynamics to make Tool bust a nut!”

-To listen to an unmastered version of Moneys Not Success from the Live @ the Drive-In album, any previously released studio albums, see pix and videos, read press reviews, and learn more about the band visit http://www.abandontheory.com


Other Ways You Can Help

We realize you may not be able to donate anything today and that's okay.  Please help us by spreading the word on social media and  to all of your friends, as well as any bloggers, podcasters, reporters, or dj's that you listen to or read .   There are links below to our Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Website.   

Thank you, we are sincerely grateful for your support.  Let's make this happen together!
story_txt:
Summary


The
goal of this Indie Go Go campaign is for Abandon Theory to finish the Live @
the Drive-In album.  We need to pay the
recording engineer and have the project mastered and duplicated.  These costs will be further outlined later
on.  We have some great perks as our way of saying thank you for helping us to create this album.
We
are an independent, original, banjo rock trio based in Sacramento, CA.
  -Independent means we have no record label
financially backing us.  
  -Original
means we create music that is unique and personal to us and our fans. 
 And that is why we are calling on like minded people to help us create something we can all appreciate and benefit from.
We
have big time fun playing music.  It
comes naturally for us, there is nothing forced about it, the result is infectious and it seems almost
magical.  "Abandon Theory literally stopped me in my tracks with their charisma and originality." - Dean Haakenson (musician).  

*You can listen to one of the songs from the live show here:  LISTEN HERE 

THE PROJECT:
Although we have recorded 4 studio albums, our passion is playing
live.  And to that end, our fans have been
asking for a live album for quite a while. 
So last year we booked a drive-in movie theater as the venue for our
live album.  We played for hours as the
California sun was setting and cars kept streaming into the parking lot.  As soon as the show ended and it was dark
everyone ran back to their cars to watch the movie.  It was a great night and we
got some great recordings!  We selected
12 songs that recreate the feeling and flow of the night.  These particular songs mean a great
deal to us - they come from our life experiences and from the heart. They speak
to the nature of the human experience and the joys and challenges that come
with taking life's journey.  The music
and lyrics can be humorous or reflective, the songs can be folk-based, up-and-funky,
or even  electronic sounding.  “I can’t believe there are just 3 of you, your sound is so big and full!”  - anonymous fan. 
THE EXPENSES:
-First
we need to pay the recording engineer for capturing the sound at the live show.   $425
-Next
we need to recoup some equipment loses.  Jhon,
the bass and banjo player also does the mixing, editing, and producing for the
band, which saves a ton of
money in studio costs.  He created most of
the “It Is” album and the entire “Acoustic” album from his home studio.  While he was working on the Live @ the
Drive-In album his computer crashed and could not be fixed.  Therefore a new computer and software are needed to finish this project and create future recordings.  = $3,700
 -Then comes the mastering.  This is the process that utilizes super expensive equipment and a
very fine tuned ear to add the sparkle and depth to the recording.  It makes the recording sound as good as other
professional/radio worthy music, and is required by iTunes and other digital media outlets.  $700
-The final step in the musical process is duplication. 
This is the process of professionally creating the cd’s and the cases
with our art work, and packaging it all up. 
 $1,542
 -And lastly the fees involved in running the campaign and processing
the payments add an additional .085% to the total.
Which makes the grand total that
we need to put the Abandon Theory – Live @ the Drive-In Album in your hands... $6,900.00

The Song List:

 


Oceans and Waves
Baby
Get It While The Gettin’s
Good
Red
Money's not Success
Raven Hair
Kisses On My Head
Cinderella Ride
When We Arrive
Modern Day Hippie
Fortified
As Perfection

WHY AREN'T THEY GIGGING MORE TO PAY FOR THIS THEMSELVES? 
Jhon, the bassist and banjo picker, has been battling a debilitating autoimmune disease for several years.   It has caused the band to cancel shows & tours, which is really bad for credibility.  Most gigs are scheduled 3 months or more in advance, and live shows take a great deal of energy.   So until Jhon's health can be more reliable, the band has been unable to commit to most gigs.  That being said, he is doing all that he can to restore his health.
   About the band Abandon
Theory has been explained as "the Violent Femmes meets Jack Johnson at a
rave." -  anonymous fan.   “The band has a groovy, acoustic
roots style that is both lively and dynamic.” -  J. DLT. Sacramento News and
Review.
Abandon Theory is a three-piece banjo rock band that sounds much larger.  Jesse (vocals and acoustic guitar) creates
melodies that catch your ear and transport you to another place.  The lyrics do the same as they weave
captivating stories or invite you to ponder philosophical quandaries.  Randy (drums) has a unique set up that adds bongos and timbales to the traditional drum kit.  He has a polyrhythmic style, which creates
the illusion of a drummer and a percussionist playing simultaneously.  Jhon completes the trio with bass
and banjo.  He makes the people move by adding the  groove, and infuses the music with energy by adding spirited solos.  His style is creative and non-traditional (he uses effects that are usually reserved for the electric guitar) on both the bass and banjo. 
Abandon
Theory creates a world of harmonious contradictions.  Their music can be relaxed and acoustic, or
exciting and danceable, fun and light hearted or thought provoking and contemplative.  They are as much at ease playing a waltz,
a reggae groove, or a club beat. 
You might guess that the target audience for Abandon Theory would be hippies
and the party crowd, and they do make up a significant percentage of the fan
base.   However, at an Abandon Theory show you are as
likely to see an elderly couple swing dancing, as grade school kids
enthusiastically jumping up and down. 
The band loves to play music together and never shies away from an opportunity
to perform.  They have played every type
of venue across the country from coffee shop to honky-tonk, and back yard party
to amphitheater. After playing a show at a notoriously rough hard rock/metal club, the
promoter, Jay Pate, was quoted in the newspaper the next day “Anyone
that brings a banjo on stage at the Town Pump might expect to be attacked with
a pool stick, instead Abandon Theory commanded the audience’s attention with
intelligent lyrics, jumpy hooks, and enough dynamics to make Tool bust a nut!”
-To listen to an unmastered version of Moneys Not Success from the Live @ the Drive-In album, any previously released studio albums, see pix and videos, read press reviews, and learn more about the band visit http://www.abandontheory.com





    Other Ways You Can Help We realize you may not be able to donate anything today and that's okay.  Please help us by spreading the word on social media and  to all of your friends, as well as any bloggers, podcasters, reporters, or dj's that you listen to or read .   There are links below to our Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Website.   
Thank you, we are sincerely grateful for your support.  Let's make this happen together!

story:
IS Facebook Page

CIAO A TUTTI!!

Siamo gli IS, duo post-progressive sinfonico formatosi ad Andria nel 2012.

Perché IS? Semplice! I nostri nomi per intero sono: “Ilenia Salvemini” e “Ivan Santovito” e studiamo Architettura presso il Politecnico di Bari. Dal nostro amore per il bello e dalla nostra propensione verso l’inusuale è nata un’autentica opera eclettica, la cui demo è stata ultimata nel 2015.  

Vorremmo, quindi, invitarvi a far parte dei nostri piani e di credere in noi come lo ha fatto Fabio Zuffanti. Sotto la guida di una persona del calibro di Fabio, questo progetto ha pian piano acquisito l’impronta decisiva. Da qui la volontà di produrre il nostro debut album!

Membri

Ilenia Salvemini, voce solista/vocal arrangement.Sono nata ad Andria nel 1993. Adoro il canto, l’arte e la moda. Fin da piccola ho seguito le mie passioni, dapprima studiando danza classica per molti anni. Questo mi ha portata ad avvicinarmi al canto, grazie a recital e musical a cui ho partecipato, segnandomi molto come cantante.

Ivan Santovito, compositore e musicista/cantante del progetto.Sono nato a Trani nel 1991. Ho suonato in vari progetti rock, di musica classica, cantautorale e progressive. Lasciatomi alle spalle vari progetti con bands, ho deciso di concretizzare la mia idea e i suoi concetti in un lavoro autentico, con l’aiuto di Ilenia.

Obiettivi e budget

Per realizzare questo sogno, sono necessari 6000 € ripartiti in spese per:

1.  Direttore artistico, musicisti (batterista e chitarrista), programmatore e sound engineer per missaggio professionale;

2.  visual artist/fotografo Nicola Boccadoro ;

3.  Perks e fees (spese per gadgets e piattaforma)

PERKS

Abbiamo scelto dei perks molto personali, ideati e realizzati da noi nella speranza che ciò accorci le distanze fisiche.    :( 

Molti altri contemplano, invece, lo stare con voi; prevedono un incontro e un confronto per potervi raccontare il più possibile ciò che amiamo.

Ecco a voi i perks! Divertitevi!


P.S. VI CHIEDETE COME DONARE? 

Per poter donare NON è necessario iscriversi a Paypal, basta inserire  i dati della carta di credito. Come un qualsiasi sito di acquisti sicuri sul web, Paypal (unitamente ad Indiegogo) è estremamente sicuro,esente da rischi di frode. :D

Per informazioni e dubbi a riguardo, CONTATTATECI:)

Conclusioni

Insieme possiamo trasformare un concetto in realtà, cercando di aprire nuovi orizzonti e spazi per la sperimentazione. Il vostro supporto, le vostre donazioni e il vostro passaparola saranno importanti per la creazione di un prodotto di qualità. Ognuno è importante per la musica, e lei ve ne sarà eternamente grata.


||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||


HELLO TO EVERYONE!

We are the IS, a symphonic post-progressive duo born in Andria in 2012.

Why IS? Easy! Our full names are "Ilenia Salvemini" and "Ivan Santovito" and we are students in architecture at the Polytechnic University of Bari. From our love for the beauty and our inclination for the uncanny is born our authentic eclectic work, with a demo in 2015. We would like to invite you to take part of our plans and to believe in us, as Fabio Zuffanti did. Under the guide of such an artist like Fabio, this project has slowly acquired the decisive print. Thanks to this, we decided to produce our debut album!

Members

Ilenia Salvemini, solo voice/vocal arrangement. I was born in Andria in 1993. I love singing, art and fashion. Ever since I was a little girl I followed my passions, studying classical dance for many years. This made me closer to singing, thanks to the recitals and musicals I took part in, forming me as a singer.

Ivan Santovito, composer and musician/singer of the project. I was born in Trani in 1991. I participated to many rock, classical, songwriter and progressive projects. Once I left behind many band projects, I decided to make real my idea and its concepts in an authentic work, with Ilenia's help.

Objectives and budget

To make this dream come true, 6000 € are needed, distributed in costs for:

 1) Artistic director, musicians (drummer and guitarist), programmer and sound              engineer for professional mixing;

 2) visual artist/photographer Nicola Boccadoro;

 3) perks and fees (costs for gadgets and platform) perks.

we choose very personal perks, designed and realised hoping to reduce our phisical distance. :(

Many others consider, on the other hand, being with you; they contemplate a meeting and a encounter to have the chance to tell you as much as possible about what we love.

Enjoy with perks!

P.S. DO YOU WONDER HOW TO DONATE?

To donate you have NOT to sign up to a Paypal account, but only fill it with a credit card information.

As one of the many website for purchasing, Paypal (along with Indiegogo) is totally safe, fraud-free.

For info and doubts about this, CONTACT US! :) 

Conclusions

Together we can turn a concept into reality, trying to open up new horizons and environments for experimenting. Your support, your donations, and your word-of-mouth will be important for the creation of a quality product. Everyone is important for music, and music will be always grateful for that.

story:
-The Dead Aura's Determination-

The EP is set into 3 tiers:

Aether: Parallel Skies
Limbo: Enlightened Ones 
Nexus: Corruptor

With the funds, we plan on doing everything just right, from producing the music in studio to lyric and music videos, more merchandise, and other exciting endeavors.

We aren't asking for much, just the rest of the funds to actually get this project off the ground.  We are determined, hard workers and are doing our best to fund as much as possible to make our dream a reality. However we can't do it all on our own and are asking for the help of you, our fans, in creating something huge and are offering the opportunity for the listeners to become the building blocks of The Dead Auras. 

We have many exciting things planned and wish to show you what we are truly capable of. From Electronica to Metal in genre style. 

For fans of: IAMX, Depeche Mode, Motionless In White, New Year's Day, Halsey, Purity Ring, Deftones, Crosses, AFI.

The Dead Auras - Teaser
(soundcloud)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^






About Us.

GhostPop/Metal
McKeΠΠ∆ and ∆uBrey.

In June of 2015, Aubrey Witchshade (Rituals) sought out to create something both innovative and dark. A spark of inspiration quickly transformed into a vision and thus The Dead Auras was born. Bringing in vocalist, McKenna, a short time later, the solo project evolved into a duo. 

Combining haunting, atmospheric melodies with aura resonating bass and other worldly guitar, The Dead Auras delivers a spine chilling rendering of ghostly charm. The unique ambiance can only be compared to the lamentation of two souls trapped in Limbo. 

With the date sharing the 10 year anniversary of its original release, the GhostPop duo made its first audio release with cover song “Precious,” as a tribute to Depeche Mode on October 13, 2015. 

Shortly after the release of “Precious," the pair announced intentions to hit the studio to record a conceptual trilogy. The band announced that the trilogy will be broken down to three separate extended plays (EP): Corruptor, Enlightened Ones, and Parallel Skies. The first E.P. is expected in early Spring 2016.


[The Dead Auras Shirt]


Risks & Challenges

Finances are the Challenges for producing this Trilogy EP themed 
musical journey.

Once funded, all perks or Shipments shall be sent and delivered.
Merchandise, Music, Posters, CDs (Both Digital and Physical.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing or promoting in any way to help us achieve the goal would be greatly appreciated so tell your friends about us, tell the world! 

If you have any questions on how you could help or about the campaign in general, feel free to message us, comment, or reach out to us via Facebook.

story:
Hej!

Mitt namn är Filip Winther och jag håller precis på att bli klar med mitt första "riktiga" musikalbum, vilket jag planerar att släppa om någon månad.
Tanken är att inte endast släppa albumet digitalt, utan även i fysisk form (tillsammans med samlingsalbumet Skåpmat, som släpptes digitalt förra året) och eftersom att detta är rätt dyrt för mig som privatperson vänder jag mig till er! Jag behöver all hjälp jag kan få från er med att nå detta mål! Genom att bidra kommer ni att vara en väldigt stor pusselbit i att göra detta möjligt!

Albumet kommer att bestå av 15 spår. 10 av dessa är aldrig någonsin släppta tidigare och 1 är en remix av en gammal låt!

Alla bidrag spelar roll och alla vänliga själar som går in med minst $1 (ca 8-10 kronor) kommer att få sitt namn skrivet i häftet som finns i CD-fodralet! (Om man inte vill ha med sitt namn men vill bidra ändå är det bara att skicka ett mail till info@filipwinther.com så löser jag det!)
Bidrar man istället med $10 (plus $3 i frakt) kommer man även få en fysisk skiva hemskickad till sig när den är färdig, hur coolt är inte det?!

Jag hoppas att ni vill hjälpa mig med att nå mitt mål. Att ha släppt en fysisk skiva var bara något jag kunde drömma om när jag var mindre. Det här är så häftigt att  jag nästan sprängs!

Om mitt mål dock inte skulle nås kommer det inte vara någon fara för er! Jag kommer fortsätta att spara pengar så att detta kan bli möjligt. Ni som har bidragit kommer fortfarande att få den perk:en som ni "betalat" för! Det kommer bara att ta längre tid på grund av min ekonomi!

Detta är en möjlighet för er att hjälpa mig på traven, få era namn skrivna i mitt första fysiska album någonsin samt en chans att förbeställa albumet ($10 eller mer)!

Om du har läst ända hit är du bäst! Nu hoppas jag att du väljer att hjälpa mig med ett par kronor! Ditt bidrag spelar verkligen roll! TACK!

Det här är så häftigt att  jag nästan sprängs!Om mitt mål dock inte skulle nås kommer det inte vara någon fara för er! Jag kommer fortsätta att spara pengar så att detta kan bli möjligt. Ni som har bidragit kommer fortfarande att få den perk:en som ni "betalat" för! Det kommer bara att ta längre tid på grund av min ekonomi!Detta är en möjlighet för er att hjälpa mig på traven, få era namn skrivna i mitt första fysiska album någonsin samt en chans att förbeställa albumet ($10 eller mer)!Om du har läst ända hit är du bäst! Nu hoppas jag att du väljer att hjälpa mig med ett par kronor! Ditt bidrag spelar verkligen roll! TACK!

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

I am thrilled and honored to be releasing my first solo album, Routes of Evanescence: Music for Solo Violin & Violin + 1 by American Women Composers coming up in December.  My incredible collaborators, Ieva Joukbaviciute and Jennifer Curtis and I recorded the album nearly one year ago, and after months of editing and mixing, we are so excited that the disc is about to launch!

I am so grateful to have received grants to underwrite the recording, engineering, and producing costs, and we are now looking to raise the last $4,000 to help underwrite the remainder of the duplication, tour, and post-production costs.  

The CD officially drops on December 17th in New York City, but we are delighted to be presenting pre-release concerts at Cornell University and in St. Paul, MN on November 22nd and December 6th, respectively; concerts in my three "home towns" only seemed fitting.

All donations are tax-deductible, and we would be so grateful for anything you are able to contribute!

With gratitude, 

Ariana with Ieva and Jen
